Reviews.Title: “Get Away Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: renonj
Reviews.Content: In March, we stayed at The Alex Hotel on a Saturday night. The hotel makes for a nice weekend getaway. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The room was decorated in a very modern style, the shower was great, and the room was quiet at night. It is three long blocks from Times Square and the theaters -- about a 15 minute walk. There are lot of pedestrians out at night and the location felt safe. The hotel is close to Grand Central Station A few down sides -- they charge for internet service, even though the room had a mini kitchen, there was no coffee maker, and the breakfast prices at the hotel’s restaurant were way too expensive. However, there are several good restaurants and coffee shops close to the hotel. We booked the room last minute and got a rate for about $110 on Priceline using their blind bidding approach. We were told that we were upgraded when we got to the hotel to a nicer room on a higher floor. After we checked out of our room on Sunday, we checked our bags with the concierge so we could explore more of NYC. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We would stay there again if we were able to get a similar rate. The hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel on Priceline; it is probably should be rated as a very nice three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for leading members”
Reviews.Author: felipevaz
Reviews.Content: Get yourself a leading hotels membership and stay here with an upgrade, breakfast and nice rate. We had a great room and great service for less than 300...

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: a k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during thanksgiving and had a "okay" time. I booked through a third party website and got a fairly good deal but I do not undertstand why anyone would pay the average rate they charge. Nothing was above the norm of even a holiday inn express. The service was decent/non existant, no "have a good day" or "anything that we can do?" no call to the room to check on things. If you have any issues with space then this is not the hotel for you, but very clean and modern. Wonderful bathrooms and ask for a room with a view, it van be very nice at night.

Reviews.Title: “awesome - except for the elevator :)”
Reviews.Author: bg1492
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, very clean and nice, fairly convenient (I was in town for a UN meeting, so for that it was perfect). Only complaint was the elevator - expect a 10-minute wait each way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda T
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at The Alex in NYC. The manager helped us with an early check-in, a two-bed request for one of our 2 rooms, and security member Jose Tavares went the extra mile when I left behind a set of orthodontic retainers in a case. He went through the garbage and found it! Impressive. We had a great family vacation and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, with quality to match”
Reviews.Author: tph42
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, the front desk staff were pleasant, and the price was unusually low by NY standards. But, the room left a lot to be desired. Start with a working lamp. Despite two calls to housekeeping, and one visit to confirm it didn't work, the lamp was never fixed or replaced. Temperature control: the 15-year-old thermostat has seen its best days long ago, and no longer worked. TV remote (also very old) was defective. Needs batteries, which I requested by they were not replaced. Cordless phone: older than the hotel, and did not work at all. Water pressure in shower: went from Niagara Falls to a desert trickle. There is no desk. The fold-out shelf is not a desk, except in moments of desperation. And last: a smoking floor? Really? Front desk switched me to a moderate-sized room from a closet-sized accommodation, but only on smoking floor. I stayed at the Alex when it first opened, but it needs serious overhaul now.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful modern hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: zuzanaatforbes
Reviews.Content: The Alex is a beautiful modern hotel; we visited NYC for 4 days couple of weeks ago; the location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic, it is close to everything including the Central Station and subway if you prefer not to walk around the city; we were upgraded into a suite – what a treat it was. The suite was always kept clean and service was flawless; I included some pictures – please understand that they don’t do the justice to the décor of the suite; the wallpaper in the pictures may appear almost dirty; it’s made to look that way on purpose; We ordered breakfast from the restaurant downstairs, great food; The pub next door is also great, especially if you are returning to the hotel after 9:30pm and feel hungry ☺; Thank you Alex, my husband and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not four stars!”
Reviews.Author: shawnbarchis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex for two nights over St Patricks wk end. Based on the Priceline deal of $150 that we got, the hotel was ok. However it is not four stars, and I wouldn't pay rack room prices. The room was very basic. Not luxurious or comfortable. The tv was just ok. The phone didn't work at all even after tellIing the desk person. So no room service for us. The airconditioner blew Luke warm air. Fortunately we could crack the window for air. The shower was difficult to use, and the tub was always full of 6'' of water when we showered. Also, the shower doors were difficult to close. All the handles were on the outside? To top things off, we went to the little bar downstairs to have a martini. After being served our drinks, I was relaxing with my feet on an ottoman, and sitting at a booth near the bar when one of the hotel staff walked past and said "Get your feet off there, people sit there!". I was so embarrassed that I didn't want to finish my drink. Every time I walked in and out of this hotel, the bar was dead. I wonder why? Had I not been insulted, I would have stayed for another drink... I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Business People Beware”
Reviews.Author: Wendy D
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Alex Hotel for a business trip that cancelled at the last minute. It was a Sunday evening that I found out that my meeting was cancelled. I called on Monday morning to inform them that I needed to cancel my reservation because my plans have changed. I was informed that they would charge me for 1 nights stay for BOTH rooms that I reserved. Most hotels have a policy where you can cancel the day of and therefore I did not think nothing of it. As a business person that travels alot -- I can tell you that I will make it known to everyone that I do business with that they should not stay at this hotel. They are not flexible and sort of rude. Not only am I posting a message here but I am sending my experience with this hotel to the many bloggers that I know who blog about travel experiences for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Change your staff,”
Reviews.Author: deusel
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice rooms and ok location, but really weird staff, only the doorman was a nice guy, the rest donks, sorry but who they think they are.Get some decent people who know what nice service is,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Jules086
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alex hotel for 3 nights and were very impressed. The rooms are a good size for a central Manhattan hotel and very clean. The hotel has a bar and free internet access for guests in the business centre (located upstairs from the bar). The staff are very helpful and friendly. We found the location was really convenient - just round the corner from the Chrysler building and a short walk from the shops in 5th Avenue and Times square. Would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: roblowe1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice appearance from the outside and a nice inviting reception area. On arrival we were greeted by the Concierge, who opened the doors of our transport and also collected our bags. The Concierge was very nice and friendly and gave us a l ot of valuable infoirmation about New York. But as well as that he showed an interest in what we had done each day and always remembered us. On valentines Night, he got us a taxi to take us to our restaurant. The Reception staff were okay, fiendly and effecient. The room was very tidy, well appointed and perfect for our stay. However, the only problem was there was no tea and coffee making facilities. We did ask for a kettle and some cups which they provided for us, but we had to buy our own tea and coffee and milk. Would be wise to invest in some tea and coffee making facilities as this is much needed especially first thing in the morning and after coming back from a fully packed day. Overall an excellent hotel and venue for our stay in new York.

Reviews.Title: “Poor lighting in rooms”
Reviews.Author: audacive
Reviews.Content: Size of rooms are big, great location but lighting in room are terrible for makeup. Internet is not free and is quite expensive as there are no sharing between devices. Internet is free at the business center. Friendly receptionists and staff

Reviews.Title: “OK, but it wasn't all that...”
Reviews.Author: rockchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alex Feb. 18-21, 2012 room 504 THE GOOD: Location: One can walk to the UN Building and Grand Central Station as each is just a couple of blocks away. A bit further out, but still walkable are Times Square/Broadway, Rockerfeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Chrysler Building, and much more. The Price (via Priceline): I booked via Priceline after researching a bidding strategy via a priceline bidding strategy messageboard so I know I got the lowest possible Priceline price. For this hotel it was a steal possible only because the UN was not in session. However, I wouldn't want to pay rack rate or rates offered on other websites. Room Size: Excellent by NYC standards. (Standard room) The Lobby Staff: The bellmen, doormen, porters, etc. were excellent. I feel bad that didn't always get a chance to tip them, etc. Nice people and very helpful. Desk staff mostly ok. THE AVERAGE: Decor: It is average for a 4* hotel. Interesting but nice. The room could use an update. It shows a fair amount of wear. Some chipped tile/tub in the bathroom. Tub is nice and deep but narrow. And you have to have some muscles in your fingers to flush the toilet. Does not look nearly as nice as the photos online. We had a view of 45th and the building across the street. Boring and a little noisy. Beds: Comfortable, but nothing special. I requested 2 beds but did not get them (not guaranteed by priceline but it would have been nice.) Consierge: We asked for suggestions on a restaurant that would be entertaining and for two teens and 3 40somethings. He was challenged by this. In NYC with 1000s of restaurants, a consierge should be able to name numerous restaurants to choose from. One of his first offerings was Bubba Gumps. Unfortunately, 2 of us were from Louisiana and Bubba Gump's does not fly with our expert knowledge of such southern/gulf cuisine. We settled for Brother Jimmy's BBQ (ok even tho, again, 2 of us were from the south). He said it would be lively. Well, lively apparently meant really really loud music with happy hour with tons of 20somethings in the bar area. So, not appropriate when we wanted something "lively" for teens. However, the food very good. THE BAD: Room Temperature: It is winter and the heat is ON. The room was generally too warm for us (72'-75'F) when healthy sleep temp is 65'F. The only way to cool the room is open the window but then there is the street noise. Housekeeping: Generally clean, but... I did the "I'm in NYC so I need to check for bed bugs check when I arrived (I found NONE an probably no evidence of any.) and noticed some small blood stains (?) on the underneath side of the white comforter/duvet. I did not complain as I always take it off the bed immediately anyway because I don't trust hotels to change them between guests. The Alex might, but I do this at all hotels. Seriously, how often do you see them on the housekeeping carts? Housekeeping didn't leave enough toiletries or replenish when needed, in my opinion. After the first day, I didn't bother to tip because of this and an incident (read below). THE WORST: Housekeeping: On my final day there, I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. I did not have the inside locks enaged because my friend just left the room within the last half hour or so. I was in the room getting dressed after a shower. So, I was in a towel. Guess what happens? I am a female, and a male housekeeper knocks on the door and walks in unannounced before I have a chance to see who it was through the peep hole (I thought it might be my friend returning with Starbucks or something). And yes, there I am barely in a towel. COMPLETELY INAPPROPRIATE. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE. Had he said "housekeeping" or waited a minute before opening the door or READ THE DO NOT FRIKIN DISTURB SIGN the situation could have been avoided. NOT happy at all about this. When I checked out, the desk agent didn't ask how was my stay, otherwise I would have reported this incident. But, I knew I had this public forum to speak. OVERALL: The Alex Hotel isn't bad and if you chose to stay there you will probably be perfectly fine. In my case, it was simply not as positive as I hoped for or expected given the mostly positive reviews. I had a mostly ok stay for a decent price. But, I left a bit disappointed because I had higher expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel, Extortionate breakfast, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Garyorient
Reviews.Content: Came on a 3 day stay with partner and her son from London. Reception area small, but staff greeting friendly and check in very efficient so no problems there. Went up to our room and found out there were no tea/coffee making facilities...... this was no real problem but we called housekeeping who designated a lady to bring up a kettle and a coffee maker, but 1) No tea 2) No coffee 3) No base unit for the kettle, so was somewhat confused as to how I was actually supposed to boil said kettle. Room size was fine, position of hotel (between 2nd and 3rd Ave) a little bit off centre, but not too bad, although I did feel for the position it was somewhat expensive for Manhattan Went down for breakfast on the first morning and had 3 cups of tea 1 smoked salmon beigal 1 French Toast 1 Pancake and was stung for $70 approximately. (£45 in real money). Absolutely unbelievable and totally extortionate. I can't say it was a rip off because I saw the prices and knew what breakfast was going to cost, but it still was a shock when I received the bill. would I stay here again? Probably not, as there are many choices in NY and I do not need to spend £240 per night for this hotel. would I recommend this hotel? Yes, if you can negotiate a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice all around”
Reviews.Author: HannaSL
Reviews.Content: Got the reservation on price-line. First off, we were worried that we won't have space for our two kids. No guarantees on that were given 24hrs ahead over the phone, but at the time of check in the double room was found with two beds and, nicely, early check-in was allowed 2 hrs ahead of time. A couple of things in the room didn't work, but we didn't make a big deal of it (like the TV in the bathroom?!). The shower fixture is a little weird - but there is a phone in the bathroom as well to get quick help in operating the shower. :) The furniture is pretty interesting - many clever ways of using small space in multifunctional way. We were in the room 710 - not the greatest view perhaps, but very quiet at night, and I would rather take that, if the view would have to come with the noise. Personnel was very helpful and polite at every single interaction in the hotel. (Advised on places to eat, etc.) Also we got offered extra hour before the check out. All together, at the price we paid, it was a pretty nice experience. Things to keep in mind: 15$ for WiFi connection and 43$ for parking (both per day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the room size is good for NYC. The hotel lobby is quite small. There are more staffs in the lobby than customers constantly which I suppose it is good. My friend said he feltl being watched when he was waiting in the lobby for me. The room is good. I didn't know how to turn on the shower until I saw the instruction. There was good maid service that they came to my room in the morning and evening. However I felt bothered one morning that I got up late but I could hear the maid knocking other guests doors for maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, however...”
Reviews.Author: peteb201
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for Saturday before Valentine's Day using Priceline. Upon arrival the staff was quite cordial and helpful. The room was spacious and surprising large for NYC. Bed was comfortable as well. MIni bar and snacks are way over priced so bring your snacks or hit the CVS or Duane Reade around the corner for much cheaper options. So the problem occured when we went to shower in the morning. When I turned on the shower and pulled the knob to get the water to flow to the shower head, the entire knob ended up in my hand. After spending a few minutes trying to get it work, I was able to get the shower to come on but the flow rate was at a quarter that it should have been. None the less, we were both able to take showers. When checking out I told them of the problem and their first response was "did I know how to use the shower?", I told them yes this wasn't my first shower. We had breakfast in the restaurant and the french toast and omelet were pretty decent servings. So to management, I would just recommend to have housekeeping check all showers and have your maintenance department make proper repairs.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: piringer46
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Preferred Hotels. Never stayed there before. The accomodations were spacious and clean, well maintained. What made the experience outstanding was the encounters I hade with staff. Very proffesional, friendly , effecient. I misplaced the the stays for my shirt and the Front Office agent gave me is. Is that is not outstanding service I do not know what is. I can recommend whole heartedly

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler2012
Reviews.Content: Am new to reviews on tripadvisor-so this review is a bit old. We traveled with our 3 children to NYC 2 years ago this jan. Looked at a lot of places and chose the Alex. We lucked out!! The service was amazing-restaurant out ofhtis world. Service there was amazing as well, even paid special attention to the kids. There is an excellant market just across the street that we would frequent to get nibbles/drinks. Starbucks is a very short walk as well. I highly recommend The Alex.

Reviews.Title: “boutique luxury apartment near grand central terminal at great price!”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 adults and 2 kids) stayed at the Alex hotel during the late summer of 2011. We had planned to meet a friend to watch US open qualifiers. We were thrilled to see that the room was actually an apartment with two separate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a living room/kitchenette. The entry way was large. It looked much like their web photos do. We got a great price on this and couldn’t believe we could have so much space in the city. The smaller bedroom was quite cramped and the living/kitchen area was small too, but it was sufficient. We ended up stuck in our room because of Hurricane Irene and the hotel did everything it could to keep us updated, safe, and comfortable. They even sent up bottled water and fruit and moved us to a lower level. The internet was available for a fee, but worked well. The exercise room was fantastic! They even had fresh lemon water. The hotel’s location was also great, only a few blocks from Grand Central as well as Times Square. The staff couldn’t have been nicer or more accommodating. I should warn you of one thing - that if you come to the Alex, there will be lots of tempting and pricey treats in the kitchen that you should avoid unless you want to pay a lot more at check out!

Reviews.Title: “Great city stay”
Reviews.Author: hapyvacationer
Reviews.Content: Great Manhattan location. Short walk to Rockefeller Center and all the great nearby shopping. All types of rooms. We've stayed a few times and have been upgraded to a one bedroom with kitchen. Their regular rooms are just fine too. There is a bar and restaurant in the lobby which is convenient, as well as a diner across the street for an alternate breakfast. Whenever we stay in NYC we like to stay at this great boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Stay Here When it is in Budget!”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: This is a great, friendly, yet professional, modern boutique hotel. It is in a great location for me as it is about two blocks from the 45th street exit of Grand Central and close to a lot of my clients. Great restaurants nearby as well. Unfortunately, it is typically priced above my travel budget, but a few magical times of the year when NYC prices fall into my target area, I would stay here! Rooms are a little dated, but still modern and clean enough for me. There is even a TV in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: beinhart
Reviews.Content: We had a nice-looking apartment with everything we needed in the room. The breakfast was not completely as explained, and these days we expected for free.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel in east Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: This is now the 3rd time I've been to NY in a year and each trip I've stayed here at the Alex. The facilities are ok for a business hotel and it makes s great place for weekend sightseeing. The location is ideal. The friendly staff are a particular highlight - as are the views of the Chrysler Building and the East River

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: adam_blem
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just before Christmas and thoroughly recommend it. We (fiance and I) got a very good online deal which meant it was fantastic value for money. Hotel staff all very helpful and courteous, room very comfortable and there is good hotel bar that we took advantage of. Walking distance to 5th Avenue, Grand Central and other attractions made it a great base for us.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints; No Raves”
Reviews.Author: Eric1004
Reviews.Content: One night business trip, Location worked and rate was quite reasonable. Complimentary upgrade to 1 bdr w/kitchen (thank you!). Staff was pleasant; room clean. Decor was almost depressing in the lack of style. All beige and dated - felt dirty even though it was a clean room. Insufficient electric oulets and lighting. Shower was weird -- required instructions (helpful) but still no way to turn it on w/o getting wet. Equipped kitchen (lost on me), but no coffee maker (?). Hotel makes a big deal out of the linens. Don't know why. Bed was at best a 5 on a scale of 1-10. Didn't eat in restaurant. Went next door instead to decent pub (loud; great beer selection; food surprisingly good). I'm not disappointed with the stay, but I won't hurry back either because I can't think of a reason to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Excellent Location in New York”
Reviews.Author: liandjer2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over new years eve. We stayed in the one bedroom suite and upon check in was given a complimentary bottle of champaign on ice in our room. The room was spacious with a kitchen area and we had a decent view on the top floor (33rd) There was a few downfalls: there was work men opposite our room and we was not notified about this, we woke up in the morning to see them outside our room. The tv selection was not that good compared to other new york hotels i have stayed at. Each day we went out we always came back to a nice clean room and made up beds. Breakfast was free and tasted good,The staff in the restaurant Ringo was very friendly and of service. Overall a good stay for a good price, may stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, modern and upbeat hotel”
Reviews.Author: briank373
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small which was to be expected in Manhattan, and looked like IKEA had a garage sale, but were very clean and comfortable for a 3 day trip. Condition of the hotel was very good, rooms were clean, and common areas were very nice, modern and upbeat. Neighborhood was clean and perfect distance from the tourists in midtown to the UN building as well. You could walk within 10 minutes in everydirection and find excellent restaurant and bar choices as well as shopping. I would reccomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Definitely, a Leading Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1sandwedge
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. The well equipped kitchen is welcome if your stay is more than a day or two. Amish market across the street is convenient for stocking the fridge and pantry. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Good food in the restaurant, Ringo. Comfortable bar. Good midtown east location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great part of town.”
Reviews.Author: HarryDiggs
Reviews.Content: I checked in a few days ago and the hotel based on appearance alone is very nice. The room was a good size and they made an excellent use of space in there! The staff was very helpful. The concierge charged my iPad for me at his desk since I'd forgotten mine then let me know the nearest Apple store where I could get a replacement. The bellman, Jarod, is a really friendly cool guy as was the bartender in the lounge who's name is escaping me right now. As for the area, it's just far enough from the mayhem of Times Square for anyone looking to avoid it but close enough that you could walk there if you liked. There are some cool restaurants and bars in the area and if you don't feel like venturing out then have some food and drinks in their restaurant bar. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable short break”
Reviews.Author: steven k
Reviews.Content: Returned this week from NY after a 5 day break. This hotel is perfect in location and size. Staff are very helpful and my only negative comment is some minor decoration would benefit the overall experience but aside from this minor point this hotel is good value and good accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great restful mid-century decor”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Maam
Reviews.Content: I loved the style of this hotel - very mid-century, clean design and restful. I felt it was spacious for a hotel room in NYC; we stayed in a suite, and although there was little room right around the bed, we had plenty of room for the kitchenette, dining area, living area with sectional sofa and cocktail table. The bath was on the smaller side, but still plenty of room - and since a lot of the room was given over to the soaking tub, I was completely fine with that! In addition to the wonderfully large tub with a great shower, there is a TV screen, good bath products and good towels. I spent some precious time when I could have been out relaxing in the bath, and it was lovely. Breakfast was included in our rate, and was better than adequate. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I did notice some minor mildew on the shower curtain and mentioned it on the way out to dinner on our first night; the front desk staff person seemed genuinely embarrassed. When we returned it had been replaced. I had no other complaints, and I'm a stickler for cleanliness - it's my number 1 priority for a hotel room. The sheets were fantastic; my sister and I both agreed on the flight home that the best thing about our room was the wonderful sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for midtown”
Reviews.Author: telmacbrit
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as a last minute weekend deal. We got a small room on the 4th floor. It's clean, modern and good value for the area. It's a bit of a walk from the main sites, but nothing too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: DKEVERYDAY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our wonderful trip to New York. We were traveling with our children and we stayed at the Alex Hotel for 4 nights. We found it on Expedia for a decent price, and we thought we'd try it out. The rooms on Expedia looked quite large and comfortable for the 4 of us, with a kitchenette and a second bedroom and bathroom. When we arrived in our room, we thought they had made a mistake and given us the smaller room. When we called down to confirm, they said that we were in the right room and they didn't know why the pictures on Expedia reflected a larger room. When I asked what room they were showing, the staff looked up the pictures but weren't sure what room was being shown because we were in the largest room, other than the penthouse and the pictures were not of the penthouse. Even the beds were small. For tall people, your feet hang off the end. The next issue was the showers in the morning. We couldn't get one working and the other one's shower head fell off when we turned it on. The staff arrived immediately to fix the situation. We were disappointed that we had to pay for WIFI for each device we had. Needless to say, I made a trip to Starbucks every morning, to plot out our day. The breakfasts were decent, but quite overpriced. The best thing about this hotel was the staff, the location and the views from the hotel room. The staff were happy, accommodating, polite, pleasant and helpful. They addressed our issues professionally and promptly. The location is wonderful and the views from the windows, which are floor to ceiling, were fabulous. We were on the 30th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Suite with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: traveller999_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and booked in advance on booking.com - a one bedroom suite was cheaper than a standard room in many of the other high end hotels nearby. Our suite was great - amazing views of the Chrysler building, spacious living room/kitchen area, v comfortable bed. We ate in the restaurant one night which was good if a little pricey. Only downsides were the plastic covered sofas - not the most comfortable - also no i pod dock - bring your own. Wifi is additional $15 per day per device - however the diner opposite has free wifi and also serves a good brunch. Location good - short walk to central station and also to shops on 5th Ave and Moma. Overall would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and sophisticated choice”
Reviews.Author: BBeeps
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night but it was the first time I ever enjoyed such a quite room in NY. The room was really nice and spacious and the attention to every small detail was well thought out and executed. The cherry on the cake at the Alex was the bed, I sleep in so many hotel beds throughout the year and only very rarely can I say that the bed was really comfortable. For NY this is definitely a hotel I will select again if I manage to find a good deal, otherwise it is out of my usual budget...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: MrBenjamin
Reviews.Content: The Alex is well located on E45th Street and has plenty of shops and restaurants near by (the Japanese restaurant next door is fantastic) We stayed in NY for 5 nights and decided on an apartment for our stay. It was an excellent size and had everything we needed. The bedroom was spacious and the bed was very comfortable (5 good nights sleep) The concierge was also very helpful when one of our restaurant bookings feel through. Our stay at the Alex was expensive but the hotel overall is very good just about worth the money. Its main benefit is its location, its 10 minutes from grand central station and 15 minutes walk from 5th Avenue, so its close enough to most things, but just a little bit off the beaten track which is nice. I would recommend this hotel if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: psandps
Reviews.Content: The Alex is a good, boutique style hotel in a quiet location between Central Station and the UN. My suite on the 25th floor was huge, well decorated and very comfortable. It had a separate living room with a small kitchenette and the bathroom was a good size. The staff are very friendly and the lobby is cozy with seating, a 'real' gas fire and free coffee and papers in the morning. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel during my stay as there are plenty of good places nearby. There is a small business centre with printers above the bar and a very small gym. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NY Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: amukhe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a whole 2 weeks during my 2010 business trip to NY. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and cozy. Ideal for business trips. Ample restaurants nearby for breakfast and dinner thru the 3rd Avenue. The Grand Central station is very nearby (5 min walk), especially as it serves most of the routes that you would need for weekdays or weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks it is”
Reviews.Author: Anon487
Reviews.Content: The Alex is in a decent (mid-town) part of Manhattan. It tries to position itself as being very sleek and cool and no doubt when it opened and was new it would have carried it off. But at the moment too much of it is started to show wear and tear (see photos). The standards it boasts of - one of the Leading Hotels in the World - are simply not there. The front desk weren't that friendly when I was checking in. They had a problem swiping my credit card and when I asked they suggested it was my fault. Yet when they tried on another one of their machines it worked perfectly. No explanation or apology. The lobby is very small which is fine. It offers free wi-fi but not the room to work or check email if you planned to sit for a reasonable period of time. The bar is fine but expensive. The adjoining diner area is smallish. The breakfasts are fine but incredibly overpriced. Service is reasonable although you do have to ask a few times for things. My room was very poorly designed. No overhead lighting made it very dingey and at night-time, just dark. It was very clean and comfortable and serviced well. The bathroom was a little delapidated - see photo but spacious. Overall, I was disappointed. Would not recommend and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “The Alex Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobycheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 4 day break to New York. Hotel in excellent position, a little quieter than hotels nearer to Times Square. As a four star hotel, it wasn't cheap so only grumble is that some light bulbs did not work, robes were not in room as stated on website but staff very friendly and helpful. If you want a wholesome cheap breakfast, try the Comfort Diner just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Georges O
Reviews.Content: I was there for only one night. As I had to catch a flight early the next morning, I wished to have a wake up call... The phone was not working in my room, therefore no possibility to call the front desk to ask for a wake-up call, which I would not have received anyway since the phone was not working. Since it was 3 AM when I discovered that situation, I just had to hope that my iPhone battery would not die during the next hours and rely only on my cellphone alarm There was also in the room an alarm clock that showed the wrong hour and that I could not readjust. Moreover, they charge 15$/24h for internet access in the room. This is ridiculous. Free wi-fi is standard in most hotels. This should be included in all hotel rooms, just like cable TV.

Reviews.Title: “NICE property and GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: karajeanm
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to NY on business, and received a great rate through Hotwire. The Alex was a pleasant surprise. The location, décor, comfort, and staff won me over. This will be our 1st choice the next time we’re NY. The Alex is ideally located less than a 5 minute walk to Grand Central station. You are surrounded by restaurants (great diner for breakfast across the street), small grocery stores (Amish store a few seconds away), pharmacies (24 Duane Reed around the corner), and retail therapy is a reasonable walk to the shops on 5th Ave (it was much needed after an arduous day). So basically everything you need or want is within in grasp. The décor throughout the hotel is contemporary, practical and comfortable. We reserved a King Deluxe room, it was spotless, PLENTY of storage space, comfy beds, and more than enough space to move around. One thing I did appreciate was the lighted reversible makeup mirror. The staff was very attentive and professional. They accommodated every request we made in a timely and affable manner. Whatever the purpose of your trip, The Alex will meet your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room”
Reviews.Author: London_UKKdl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic location. We had a two bedroom suite for us and our two teenage sons, which was very roomy, had lots of clothes storage space (four wardrobes) and three TVs, including one in the bathroom! We stayed on the 23rd floor which had amazing views. We had breakfast in the hotel once, which was great, but most mornings left early to try breakfast elsewhere (Comfort Diner across the road was great). This was our second stay here, and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful Retreat in NYC”
Reviews.Author: HillTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful!The dinning room is very good. The bar is great. The rooms are spacious, immaculate and luxurious. We had a one bedroom suite and we could have moved in and lived in it! The staff was extemely helpful and far superior to most in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Justcool457
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to shopping areas, not far from grand central station, lots of eating placing around. Very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable spacious junior suite, great bathroom, comfortable beds. The breakfast at the hotel, not a lot to choose form but fulling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neebishwoman
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Alex. Their was four of us in a 2 bedroom suite. We had at times up to three visitors. The livingroom was large enough to accomdate all seven of us. Only thing missing is a coffee maker, but in the lobby you can get free coffee. The staff is very friendly. The hotel was spotless. There is a wonderful cafe accross the street. It's called The Comfort Diner. Also a market not even a block away, that you can get beer, pop and snacks very reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We hope to stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “elegant, nicely located.”
Reviews.Author: Monforte2
Reviews.Content: I had requested a Deluxe King room and was "upgraded"? to a queen room with kitchen on the 33rd floor. I hated the noise in the room though: air conditioning + air circulation + refrigerator simply killed me. And this made the price to be too high for the quality of my stay. I did not try the Alex breakfast (I believe breakfast is far too expensive in the hotels as a rule). In front of the Alex, just across the street on your left, you may wish to have a great breakfast at "Comfort Diner". A real New York breakfast experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachcove45
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend in NY with three other couples. I searched the Internet for a good deal on hotels, and a hotel with no reports of bed bugs, and found the Alex Hotel! The hotel lobby isn't very big, but the decor is modern and contemporary. Reminded me of a European type hotel. We were upgraded to a deluxe suite which included a little kitchen fully stocked with a dishwasher, refrigerator, cabinets stocked with dishes etc. The room was very clean and had a safe. My only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom, and the shower nozzle that kept turning off while showering. The only lights in the bathroom were over the sink on each side of the mirror. The lights were so close that it made a glare in the mirror so that you couldn't see what you were doing unless you put your face up close to the mirror. But other than that it was a very nice hotel at a great price for NYC! The hotel is close to the UN, and not real close to the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever...”
Reviews.Author: Tlk1997
Reviews.Content: Super cool hotel. Beautiful room. Ours was located on the 32th floor - with a view of the Chrysler Building. Large bathroom, big fridge with a lot of good stuff and a nice bed. Flatscreen tv in the bedroom and on the toilet? A bit american, but what the h*ll, you're in NY... Restaurant was a bit expensive, but the food was good. Staff was very helpfull, and very serviceminded. I would stay again, and I would't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like nothing much when you first arrive, but really, the first impression is deceptive in this case. We had a one-bedroom suite with kitchen for two nights in September and loved both the room and the hotel. Our room was very spacious and the furnishings good, with a very comfortable bed and good amenities. Staff was very friendly and housekeeping excellent. The neighbourhood is good, plenty of restaurants and bars around, and a good supermarket around the corner. Getting around is also easy, as you are just a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. We certainly will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in Midtown & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: AmityL
Reviews.Content: Can't be more centrally located than this. Very close to Grand Central. Room was actually bigger than many I have stayed in in NYC. Even had a couch. Cool lobby. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BTH1
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Grand Central, this was a great find on the east side. Reasonable rate for mid-town, efficient professional staff, and nice rooms make it a place to consider for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BigJoan66
Reviews.Content: Great sized room - we had a 1 bedroom suite. Great location - short walk to Central Station and main bus stops. Staff were warm and friendly. Restaurant and bar were convenient and food was good. Would recommend to travellers that want a more intimate hotel as opposed to the larger tourist type of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, rooms are on the small side”
Reviews.Author: BarbBoston
Reviews.Content: If I could give the hotel 3.5 stars I would. I had higher expectations and they were not met. The Alex is part of the "Leading Hotels of the World." I joined their organization (LHW) in order to receive additional amenities. I am not sure that money was well spent. I booked a two bedroom suite for my daughter's graduation from grad school. There were three people in the suite including myself, my husband and step-mother. We stayed for three nights. I called ahead of time and spoke with the Manager, Mary Lou Pollock, who assured me that we would receive excellent service. She did not follow up, nor did she make us feel welcome. At the outset, I was told that breakfast was only for two people (in our two bedroom suite with two king beds). If I had booked two separate rooms which would have cost less, I would have had breakfast for four. They did agree to include breakfast for three. There was also an issue because they wanted to charge an additional fee for the third person in the two bedroom suite. This also did not make sense to me because we had two king bedrooms. The suite was pretty stark and very small. The furniture in the living room area i was very low to the ground, not too comfortable. The beds were comfortable. The elevator system was very quirky. I found the front desk to be very snotty. They were not particularly welcoming or helpful. We were sent a lovely welcome note addressed to some other guests who were attending a VIP wedding ...which as a result all other hotel guests were ignored. The hotel services and amenities were very disappointing. There are too many hotels in NYC to bother with this hotel a second time. They do not deserve repeat business due to their lack of customer service and follow through. The upside: I thought the food at Riingo was surprisingly delicious.I also thought the service at Riingo was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly and well postioned”
Reviews.Author: Rolf02
Reviews.Content: i stayed on business arriving for the weekend. The lobby is small and they have this automatic elevator systems that doesn't always take you to right floor, but you get to know the basement quite well! The team are very helpful. The breakfasts are good if not a little late arriving but as lobby wifi is free you can always catch up on a few emails. Wifi is not free in your room which I found a bit strange. The room was big enough with a clean bathroom with plenty of towles. The shower is powered and hot. The room had a full kitchen, fridge with fully stocked minibar and a freezer. In room entertainment was pretty good. The hotel is situated on 3rd and 45th so very close to the UN and grand central. There is also a very good bar (PJ Clarkes) on 3rd and 50th which is very lively on a Saturday night. Room rate was higher than some other nice hotels i've stayed and breakfast was extra - but still a pleasent hotel. Another review by Rolfe the reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for un meetings!”
Reviews.Author: ninahje
Reviews.Content: The rooms have varied greatly in size the three times I have stayed there, but the service and location is excellent. The only drawback for me is the lack of news channels available in the room, no BBC, al jazeera etc. Bar downstairs great for a quick drink. Lunch at Amish market nearby a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible start, wonderful finish”
Reviews.Author: berneseDuluth
Reviews.Content: We booked the Alex hotel through Perfect Escapes, and I was a bit worried because of a few negative reviews. We arrived late before the start of a busy weekend, the ten year anniversary of 9/11. The first nite we were put in a smoking room that was probably a room they rarely use (hopefully). There were no amenities (no bathrobe or Dean and Deluca tray they advertise on the website). When I called the front desk they informed me they had no other rooms. It is rare to find a hotel that even allows smoking, but apparently they have a lot of European visitors that stay there and require smoking rooms. They promised to move us the next day, so we didn't even unpack (I didn't want my clothes to smell like the room). The next day we left the hotel and came back in the late afternoon, and not only had they moved us, they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite, which was wonderful. The restaurant is good and there are many other places to eat within short distances.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Judy B
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel - first two as part of a bus tour group. The other three we booked through the hotel via their website prior to departing Australia and were very happy with the price which also included a cooked breakfast. We were given a large room with very comfortable King size bed. The bathroom was small and we did not have a room with a view but that didn't bother us. Hotel and room were clean, staff were all excellent and the hotel exceeded our expectations. About a 20 minute walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCat
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family, partner and two kids stayed at the Alex for a long weekend. We arrived on Thursdasy afternoon and were checked in immediately, no delays all ran smoothly. We had booked a two room suite which to be honest was quite expensive but this is NYC.. The hotel position is absolutely perfect for seeing all the most important sities of NY so you can basically walk anywhere. A part from this I would say my only complaints were: The rooms have the usual NY windows so unable to open and I go honestly get not such a nice smell in the room. Cleaning of the room could have been better, after brushing my hair in the bathroom hairs were everywhere. On my retrun I could still see hairs on the ground. The bar is really nice but as every 5 star is really costly. We did not include breakfast in our room rate for which I am now happy as on 3rd av there is a really nice cafe' which serves a fab breakfast. On checking out we handed in our baggage ticket which was fo 7 pcs. they filled the trunk and told me all was in. True I did not check personally but on arrival at Kennedy one pcs was missing. I called the hotel and they did immediately put it in a taxi and sent it to me at Kennedy but at my expense. Absolutely my own fault for not checking but to be honest a five star should have personel that ceck the amounts of baggage on the tickets they give you to make sure they have given you all. To be honest I dont think I would go back again too expensive and a bit over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: joan4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alex Hotel for only one night. The first room that they gave us was very small and over looking a roof with noisy air conditioners. However when I called the front desk to ask for a room change they promptly changed us to a much nicer room on a higher floor which had a view of the Chrysler building. The room sizes are standard for New York. I did have to clean up some hair off the bathroom floor, but the room was clean other then that. Top of the line toiletries. And the flat screen TV in that bathroom was great. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Staff attentive. Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: 1jerseyg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location for people new to New York and people returning. The staff is very attentive and the rooms are nice. Have stayed here twice is last 2 months and will stay there again next time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mskellydenise
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night as part of his birthday celebration...I actually found the hotel through broadway.com...I purchased tickets to The Phantom of the Opera and reserved/paid for the room all through the broadway.com website. We live in Queens so we drove to the hotel and parked in the lot on the block...very short walk to the hotel...when we walked in we were greeted with smiling faces at the reception area...check-in was smooth and easy...we were in the room within 10 minutes of walking through the door...I loved the set-up of the room...very sleek and modern...loved the tv in the bathroom...lol...the bed was very comfortable. We only stayed one night so we were able to get a true experience of everything the hotel has to offer...check-out was just as smooth as checking in...we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city"”
Reviews.Author: ktharr
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Alex and we were impressed all around. After staying at other hotels in NYC with less-than-helpful employees, the Alex was a pleasant surprise. The staff is friendly, helpful, professional, and accomodating. One stood outside in the rain for 20 minutes to get us a taxi to the airport. Our studio room had a lovely view of the Chrysler building and it was very quiet --- never heard a peep at night. They have a nice bar/restaurant and there is a great pub next door. Although the decor is somewhat dated (retro, perhaps?) we enjoyed our stay and would actually come back, something we rarely do when coming to NYC. It is a little far from the Grand Central Station metro, but in nice weather it is a pleasant walk. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple visits and always great”
Reviews.Author: nictry
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to stay at The Alex on multiple occasions for business and also once with my wife for a long weekend and on ever occasion the service, room standard and overall stay has been perfect. On the occasion I stayed with my wife we were upgraded to a suite which absolutely made my wife's stay perfect as it really was a step above the usual room size etc. Beds are always comfy, TVs etc. are a nice touch (although wont comment on US TV standards!!!! Have also eaten in the adjoining Japanese restaurant which although perhaps a little pricy has great sushi and the wine selection was also more than satisfactory. I always try to stay in the Alex when I am in NYC on business and will continue to do whilsy there standards remain so high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: K W
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at The Alex from August 13-17 and loved it. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite which was very well appointed. The 2 full bathrooms came in very handy. We found all staff very professional, helpful and friendly. They were able to suggest places to eat etc. and Richard really stood out as helpful and fun! Thanks for the hair salon suggestion ;) Our suite was very clean and had all the amenities you would need - kitchen, table, living area, 3 TV's, 2 bedrooms with very comfortable beds and 2 bathrooms. The hotel is in a great location - easy access to anywhere in the city and you are treated very well by everyone. Our kids are adults and we were all very impressed by our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it, we would stay again”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreNYClover
Reviews.Content: We (mom and two teenage sons) booked through Hotwire and got this hotel on a Friday night for $154/night. The room was clean and definitely big enough for the three of us. The concierge was great, answered all of our questions with a smile. As a matter of fact, all of the staff at the front desk was upbeat and a pleasure to deal with. I loved the hotel lobby, even though it was small, there were lots of simple little white tea lights lit all around and lovely white flowers that really made a welcoming atmosphere when we walked in. Location of this hotel worked out fine for us, plenty to do in that area. We do prefer to stay downtown on the weekends where it is quiet and less crowded in the evening but the Hotwire 4-star hotel with 95% approval rating at $154/night was too good to resist.

Reviews.Title: “Better and cheaper hotels in New York.”
Reviews.Author: alex3172
Reviews.Content: We were part of a bus tour group (Insight Vacations) which used this hotel as their New York end of tour hotel. We added 2 nights to give us 4 days in New York, which i must admit is barely time to scrape the surface of this wonderful city. You really need a minimum of 1 week to get a real feel for the city. Problems started the minute we arrived with the room we were allocated being more like a dungeon on the third floor overlooking the dumpster in the back alley. We were expecting a light filled room with a view given that we were paying $400 plus for the room. We lodged a complaint given that we were staying extra nights and were allocated a dungeon on a higher floor. We decided to persist and tried again, this time requesting a higher floor and a room with a front street view. Being very specific seemed to help as we were then allocated a semi-spacious room on a high floor. Being fair, the rooms were clean with reasonable air-conditioning. From a reception service point of view it seemed to depend on the people that were on duty as to whether the service was good or poor, so overall i would classify it as mediocre. The last day topped it all off when we asked to have breakfast either slightly earlier than normal breakfast time or to have it in our room (early flight). We were advised that room service was not part of our package and that breakfast could not be served earlier in the restaurant. (mind you we had already paid for the breakfast supplement) As we were checking out we decided to create a small "scene" and were afforded a cup of coffee. Small recompense!! The hotel is not centrally located and is a few blocks from a subway station and a long walk to 5th Avenue and the shopping area around Times Square. Since arriving home, I have spoken to my brother-in-law who travels to New York regularly on business and advised me to try the Belvedere Hotel which is a beautiful hotel only 2 blocks from Times Square. What's more it is only $250 per night. Hope this helps future travelers. I know where I am going next time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.....”
Reviews.Author: tenniscarm
Reviews.Content: Loved Loved Loved this hotel and our room was awesome.. We had 2 double bed suite and the linens, cleanliness of the room was over the top. We had a corner room looking at the Chrysler Building what more can you ask for. The service was outstanding.. Great location and decent price for a weekend in New York. Would book this hotel the next time I come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jharris1313
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alex for the first time while in NYC for business. There is a manager's reception in the bar area on Wednesday evenings (I think 530-630) which offers a nice assortment of cocktail foods and drinks. While there I met both the Director of Corporate Relatiopnships and the GM- both extremely nice individuals and gracious hosts. I had a Junior Suite which is like a studio apartment- full refrigerator, microwave, stove, dishes, dishwasher, etc. Seriously, this is by far the best hotel room I have ever had in New York, and I have been to NY many times and always stay at higher end hotels. The hotel has a nice bar, it is very bright and airy, lots of windows- they also have seating on the sidewalk outside. The location is great, just a couple of blocks to Grand Central. If you're looking for a place in Midtown Manhattan, especially if you're in town for a few nights and don't want to eat out every meal, this is the place to be. You will not find a better value anywhere in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: BOUPAP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for one night.... I am a LHW member. I was very unhappy with my stay at this location The woman at the front desk upon arrival was very welcoming, very efficient and professional... My room was dirty. My TV didn t work for a while.... It was fixed later ... I love the location of this hotel but they really have to improve the quality of their service The attitude of the staff especially your concierge needs an upgrade. My breakfast experience at the lobby was a nightmare. I felt so uncomfortable that i have decided to leave upon hearing the service staff speaking amongst them selves about others guests with derogatory comments. Very disappointed with this kind of the service

Reviews.Title: “Super cool, convenient location, and good value for a suite-room”
Reviews.Author: snoozum
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the midst of the chaotic Christmas shopping season for 6 nights in mid-December in a suite room, and found the cheapest rate to be through Expedia. We personally found “The Alex” hotel to be very conveniently located (close to Grand Central Station and within a 5-10 mins walk of Times Square), but just well enough away area from the main area to be removed from the associated noise and chaos. The building itself has what I can only describe as a very cool “mob” feel to it, with it’s large fire in the entrance and 7 ft doormen, while the rooms are extremely well thought out with a fresh, airy modern feel to them. We booked a suite room (well worth it for around $100 extra p/n) which was very reasonably sized by manhatten standards. The bed had Frette linen and was gloriously comfortable, and of course there was the obligatory flat panel television, a stereo CD player with iPod dock, and a DVD player. There was also a small sofa that you could sit on to watch TV or be able to invite guests up to entertain. The designer Poggen-Pohl kitchen area contained a full-sized refrigerator with freezer / icemaker, a dishwasher, an oven, a microwave, and all of the necessary dishes/plates, glassware, pots, pans and cutlery – all of which looked virtually brand new. The bathroom was also a good size, the with Frederick Fekkai toiletries, fluffy towels and a flat screen TV built into the wall so you could watch the Simpsons in the bath – definitely some inspiration there for when I buy a new bathroom suite! The view from the room was very good, being able to see the Chrysler Building through the window. There were also plenty of deli’s and mini-marts within the vicinity where we bought cereal/milk, and a few other simple supplies while the world famous steak house Wollensky’s is literally just round the corner. We actually wondered in and managed to get a table having no idea it was so renowned, although a reservation is probably recommended. Definitely take a large appetite though as the portions are huge! The staff were friendly, although as we had very busy days we barely saw them so I can’t really comment on the service. In conclusion, The Alex is definitely somewhere I’d return to and recommend for a convenient, comfortable stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend couples getaway”
Reviews.Author: Scharfster
Reviews.Content: The location is optimal and the hotel itself is very nice and clean. Our basic room was big for NYC - with a separate sitting area and a spacious bathroom. The hotel staff were very accommodating and knowledgable. We had one meal at Riingo, the hotel restaurant - not bad at all. Overall, this is a good choice for a nice weekend in the city. The price we got on expedia was better than the hotel itself could offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in mid-town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: SerenityNow_10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Alex hotel for 3 nights. It is an easy walk to Grand Central Station and Times Square. Room (1003) was modern and basic but nicely appointed. We did not eat at the restaurant connected to this hotel simply because we looked at the prices - e.g. pancakes - $18. I would suggest walking a block or two down Third Ave. and eating at Cosi for a decent inexpensive breakfast. On the negative side you had to pay for an internet connection and wifi is not free. Also the shower flow was rather light and the bath to shower mechanism was not the easiest to operate. Room had two double beds which were comfortable and made up daily (leave the bedside info cards on top of the bed so the room cleaner does not replace the bedding unnecessarily). Very friendly staff. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure do mix”
Reviews.Author: Suzee2351
Reviews.Content: The Alex is a fantastic hotel for both business and pleasure. I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and after a long day at the office had friends up to my room to share the bottle of Veuve Cliquot that came with the room package. I had a corner room on the 29th Floor and I felt like I was entertaining friends at my home. After a few toasts to the NYC skyline we headed to the Flatiron District for dinner at GRAVY www.gravynyc.com/ It was fantastic! Dinner was followed by drinks at Gemma (The Bowery Hotel) and then back up to The Alex. Saturday morning I woke up to a fabulous view of NYC from my bedroom window and then had a scrumptious breakfast at Ringo (also part of the room package). If you want to feel like you have a home away from home in NYC (WITH A BREATHTAKING VIEW) - stay at the Alex and book a suite! Service is fantastic, the rooms are clean and well appointed AND if you get a suite you get a terrific little kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Wow must be New York's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleg
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at The Alex. I am a Leaders club member and got upgraded to a one bedroom suite. The rooms on the 32 have 180 degree views of the city including of the iconic Chrysler Building. Suites are comfortable with kitchenette all the electric mid cons except a coffee maker! Staff are superb and all so helpful. A great stay and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Great find in New York City”
Reviews.Author: NSRPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We get to New York quite often as we have family living there. In fact we also own a timeshare in New York but only have a one week contract (thanks goodness).That being said we do stay at numerous hotels around the city with The Alex now being our favorite. In short, a great location, clean and quiet rooms as well as exceptional customer service. You don't have a glitzzy lobby but instead have staff that truly knows what customer service is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, swish hotel”
Reviews.Author: worthyness
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in enough poor quality or faceless hotels in manhattan. This was a refresher. Good sized rooms, attentive staff, good location and unique enough to separate itself from the usual clone chain hotels which a lot of people seem to love. Restaurant onsite seemed a bit pricey especially when there's so much more around. It is expensive but then what hotel isn't round there? The points are knocked off for value for money. Otherwise a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Matombo
Reviews.Content: First, let’s be clear – a “suite” in Manhattan should not raise the same expectations as, say, a suite in Orlando. And a “King sized bed” in Manhattan should be referred to as a “New York King,” in contrast to a “California King.” Unless you are prepared to pay something similar to the national debt of a small country, everything in Manhattan is smaller than you might otherwise expect. London and Paris are no different. That said, The Alex is a delightful little hotel. Well-located between Grand Central Station and the United Nations, near 45th Street and Third Avenue, it is within walking distance to Times Square and the Theater District. Be prepared for Retro. Apparently, the intention is to create an oriental motif, but all I really got out of it was a stylish 1964. Think about a lot of white formica and wood with a little embellishment. The tiny sofa next to the kitchen area served little purpose and might have been better replaced by a couple of chairs. I can’t imagine trying to entertain guests there. The room was large by Manhattan standards, and I was most impressed by the accoutrements and amenities that they were able to fit into the room. I could have stayed there for three weeks if it weren’t in downtown New York and had a plethora of excellent restaurants nearby. There was a full-sized refrigerator, with freezer and icemaker, a dishwasher, a full stove, a microwave, and all of the necessary silverware, glassware, and pots and pans you might find in a small apartment. The hotel mini bar was, essentially, a full-sized stocked refrigerator. But with so many restaurants around, who wants to sit in the room and cook? The clothes and coat closet (with the now-common in-room safe) was in a partition that created a little vestibule and provided the kitchen space on the other side. There were also three intriguing cabinets along the wall opposite the bed, which made getting around the end of the bed a little crowded. One of them acted as a sometime closet, not very well designed, to complement the full closet by the door. The second contained an entertainment center with flat panel television, stereo CD player with iPod dock, and a DVD player. Instructions as to how to work it all would have been helpful for the less technically-oriented. The third contained an interesting little work station, with a fold-out desk, a multitude of little cubby-holes and drawers, and a lamp and trash basket that swung out when needed but could all be hidden behind the panels of the cabinet. Truth be told, however, the work space was not particularly practical for my purposes, and I would not really recommend the hotel for an extended business stay. Mine was short. The bathroom was comparatively large, the tub was deep, the towels were thick and oversized, and the soaps and such were very pleasant. The television and telephone in the bathroom were a nice touch if one wanted to lounge in the tub and watch a ball game. The view from the room was outstanding. It was on the 31st floor, and the windows extended around the corner, so there was a beautiful corner view of the East River at the end of 45th Street, about five blocks away, and a wonderful view of the top of the Chrysler Building from the main window. If you were so inclined, you could go to sleep watching the lights of that magnificent building from your pillow. Both check-in and check-out were smooth and efficient, the staff was pleasant. The fact that they only have about six rooms on a floor made it deliciously quiet. You could sleep the day away if you weren’t in Manhattan. What was missing? A clock, for one thing. There was an unlighted digital device that was largely useless. Meaning that I slept with my watch on. The bedside lights, on poles, were adequate but felt as though they could have been improved by a dimmer. I didn’t try the restaurant, but if you like steak, Smith and Wollensky is right around the corner. All in all, though, the Alex was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Simonadamien
Reviews.Content: positives: 1) good location, out of the way, but still close to the action 2) friendly staff 3) fair size rooms negatives: 1) some maintenance issues (phone/lamps not in proper working order) 2) overbilled on internet uss (but staff promptly credited) 3) staff forgot to follow through with one request

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is fabulous and the staff is better!!”
Reviews.Author: unclejunk
Reviews.Content: What a great find! We ended up at the Alex from a corporate travel office referral and it was a joy. The suite was well layed out, trendy, and very comfortable. Location is perfect. While the accomodations are perfect, the staff are the real gems. Each and every one were more than helpful, polite, and ready to serve. My wife and I travel to the city occassionally and the Alex will be our new home in Manhatten. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - very central”
Reviews.Author: puffo77
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite (two bedrooms and a lounge, two bathrooms) and were lucky to get one high up with a view of the Chrysler building. Perfect! The staff were friendly, the room clean and well looked after. The breakfast is really good. The only issue we had was that they charge 15 dollars a day for wifi which is fine except that when the bill came, we'd been charged for each and every device that connected i.e 4 iphones and a laptop each day instead of the "15 usd per room per day"! They corrected it immediately when we complained but for heaven's sake.. It must happen every time. Why not fix the problem once and for all or warn the guests rather than give them such an unpleasant shock on their last day!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on East 45th”
Reviews.Author: TheUglyAmerican
Reviews.Content: Travelled to NYC with my wife to visit our daughter and chose the Alex for it's midtown location close to Times Square and the theater district. After making a reservation on the web site, I signed up as an "Alex insider" to see if there were any inside deals to be had, sure enough a few days later I received an email detailing a sale on suites for "insiders". I upgraded to a one bedroom suite for practically no extra money and got free breakfasts and a bottle of champaign. When we arrived to check-in we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite with a full designer kitchen and two baths. Great service and a great hotel. The hotel restaurant, "Ringo" was excellent also. Try this hotel, but be sure to sign up as an "insider" first for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jane7127
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. We were able to get a package with free 24 hour parking saving us over $50 and they upgraded us to a suite at check-in. The room was perfect, the ammenities were great, the service was helpful. I would stay here again every time I go to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at The Alex”
Reviews.Author: travelleroneOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex for 3 nights and have nothing but praise for the hotel. It's in a great location (close to Grand Central Station and Times Square). The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was very clean. We had no problem with the shower as some previous reports have mentioned. The elevator was easy to use and always arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Alex”
Reviews.Author: Paigeturner2
Reviews.Content: After spending more than $1,100 for two nights at the Alex, including a huge daily car parking charge, my car was delivered back to me at checkout by the hotel valet complete with a flat tire, which the car didn't have when I handed the car over to the hotel two days before. After an hour of "not our problem" from the icy front desk (which never asked at checkout how our stay had been), hotel security came to tell me the same thing, after which I was told by yet another Alex staffer that I couldn't change the tire myself because they needed the curb space for new check-ins. I had to beg for help, explaining repeatedly that I was a woman traveling alone with two young daughters. Eventually, the valet parking garage guys helped me out, changing my tire for $100. Apparently, the Alex smiles nicely when you check in, but after that you're on your own, even for $1,100 in two days. The front desk refused even to cash a check for me so I could give the garage guys that sudden $100. They sent me up the street and around the corner to an ATM. The only bright spot was Brian, head of security, who made that second call to the garage for me after I begged him for help. But no one -- not a single person at the Alex -- lifted a finger to assist me with that flat tire, even though under bailment law it's their responsibility. They even had to think about my request to allow my daughters to sit in their lobby safely while I went to the garage with the car to change the tire.

Reviews.Title: “More like a leading roadside motel, not one of The Leading Hotels of the World”
Reviews.Author: alsreg
Reviews.Content: This was our first and last stay at the Alex Hotel. The website trumpets it's affiliation with The Leading Hotels of the World, a collection of unique, boutique hotels. We've had the pleasure in staying in many of them and have never been disappointed. The hotel had a few strange quirks we could live with: - The room we had (1603) was spacious and had a built in kitchen. But the bathroom was so small you could barely turn around. And the unit had no table. What is the point of a full kitchen if you have no where to sit down and eat? - The elevator system is downright confusing. Enter your floor, then wait for a car. But we experienced a few things in our one-night stay that were downright unacceptable: - The platform bed was the most uncomfortable thing I've ever slept on. I've slept more soundly on sleeper sofas. Not to mention the headboard protruded into the bed a good six inches. So this six footer's feet were dangling over the edge of the bed all night... - The building's air conditioning system was not operating on the night of our stay. Our room was over 80 degrees when we checked in. The friendly bellhop graciously turned on the air conditioning to cool the room. When we returned later in the evening, our room was up to 85 degrees, as even thought he put the thermostat on A/C, heat was coming into the room. The hotel manager's solution: Open the window (which only opened 3 inches wide) and the room will cool down quickly. Well, all that did was let in TONS of NYC noise. We woke multiple times during the night to sirens, cars and other city noises. But most of all, I have never stayed in a hotel with a non-functioning shower. We used the shower two times a piece during our stay, and neither one of us got more than 30 seconds until the water pressure dropped, resulting in the "rainfall" showerhead stopping and the water coming out of the tub spout. Despite a terrific location, friendly bellhops and a killer breakfast (included) the next morning we won't be staying at The Alex again. - The water pressure was so bad, the shower would stop flowing every few minutes, forcing you to fumble for the switch to get it flowing again

Reviews.Title: “As a member of the Leading Hotel of the World it lack glamour...”
Reviews.Author: Italian_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February 2011. Got a double upgrade to a very spacious suite. The view however was not great. And the location of the hotel in Manhattan is far from ideal. Overall, everything was OK but it lacked excitement and glamour: the entrance lobby is cramped and freezing and looks like a 3-star hotel, there is no sauna or swimming pool, there is nobody to help you with luggage when you arrive, etc. The same applies to the room: very modern but rather dull (unlike the newly opened Setai, where modernism meets design sexiness). I booked a very good rate online so at least it was god value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Blend of Service, Style and Substance”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really like the Alex Hotel. Having lived for a while in NYC, and now coming back for short (generally business) stays, I've searched for the proper property within higher-end hotels which is not over-the-top in terms of "special treatment" (and expected return payment) or massively indifferent to the needs of its guests. The Alex is a wonderful balance; if you need assistance navigating anything in the region, they are terrific in terms of help - if you wish to be left alone to enjoy your space, they are respectful. Its location is great, neither crammed into the surreal fantasy land of the crowded destination spots teeming with confused tourists, nor isolated in a corporate canyon. Rather, you're welcomed to discover the turtle bay neighborhood or drop over to the center core of midtown, all with relative walkable ease. Lastly, the building itself is just about right in terms of public and guest rooms; the kitchenettes are certainly different, but it doesn't take too long to appreciate the benefits of a handy Thermador refrigerator for those timeout times in the big city.....

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Megmono
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was skeptical about the hotel we booked. Loved loved the staff, great locations and fabulous bath products. Anyone who says they had a bad stay, clearly expected the four seasons. Fabulous studios for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: LadySkyRose
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the Alex but we had a great time! Good location, great breakfast, with fresh, clean and attractive rooms.
