Dennis Young and Analdous (spelling?) were absolutely wonderful and so helpful with recommendations, directions and just good conversation. Our only recommendation would be for the hotel to provide free WiFi rather than charge for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but rooms (908) need work.”
Reviews.Author: Zinnia3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 908 at The Alex last night. The staff was exceptional--friendly, courteous, professional. The bathroom soaps and "rain" showerhead were lovely. However, this is not a economy hotel and my room was not up to snuff. The bathroom had water marks on the marble countertop and a bit of (somebody elses) toothpaste on the faucet. There was a hole in my sheets and something (?) on the curtains. For one night it wasn't anything worth complaining about--but for $400 a night I expected a bit more care taken with the room's cleanliness and upkeep. That said, I would give it another chance--the staff is so nice and I liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “Alex Hotel was chic, clean and well appointed with great staff”
Reviews.Author: SandBCanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and had a short walk to the subway and all attractions in Manhatten. The breakfast sandwiches around the corner were grest. The staff was friendly and helpful. The business room was well appointed and the rooms were quiet, modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “More like an apartment building”
Reviews.Author: SLOPHIL375
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5 nights at The Alex. Two main disappointments. No free WiFi, I went to the Perfect Pint Pub next door (for free wifi and 20 beers on tap). Furniture is somewhat worn. Bathroom had some spots from toothpaste left on counters of sink for the entire week we were there. People were nice, but we paid a lot for our room (upgraded to one bedroom like I think everyone is), but the hotel seemed more like an apartment building. No real lobby. We had breakfast included and it was good and could order whatever you wanted. Location a little out of the way for our taste, but 2 blocks from Grand Central, so good for subway and trains. Lacks "atmosphere" very basic.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: dwainlondon
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to NYC on business and moved from a large corporate hotel to this unique property. Upon checking in and checking out the local neighborhood, I discovered the amazing Amish Market across the street. This came in very handy as the one bedroom suite I was staying in had a full kitchenette and dining table where I could enjoy a meal in my room overlooking beautiful Manhattan and the Chrysler Building. This location was perfect for getting around town, near Grand Central station and some of the best shopping in the city. The staff were professional and attentive without being overbearing, they always remembered my name and provided some of the best recommendations for local meals and attractions to visit. The staff were respectful and provided a level of service I have not encountered in many of the larger hotel chains. The lobby was full of beautiful people, but also a charming mix of business people and tourists taking advantage of the location and amenities of the hotel. I will be staying there again and I hope to get another one of the one bedroom apartment styled room on my next visit. Enjoy a drink or a meal at the bar, the service will turn you into a fan of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyD81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex for 7 nights over the Christmas holidays. The staff were very accomodating and we were upgraded to a room with a view of the Chrysler building! The rooms were very spacious and had everything one could ask for including windscreen TV's in both the bedroom and bathroom, excellent shower and music system. The bar was very reasonably priced and had a great selection of food and drinks available in the happy hour offers (of which all were deliciious!) Whilst we were staying there I hurt my back and wasn't able to leave the rrom for a few days as I was in so much pain, the staff were very helpful to both myself and my husband, and even let us stay in the room after checkout on the last day until our airport transfer arrived. The staff remembered us by name and were very sympathetic. Overall an excellent stay, I would recommend anyone to stay there and I'm sure I will stay again myslef someday.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel near grand central station.”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days travelling with two small kids. The hotel had been so kind as to upgrade us significantly to a two bedroom “apartment” which included a small living and dining room. It was so big that we never even used the one bedroom as our kids preferred to stay in our bedroom. The living room was in the corner of the high rise building thus providing magnificent view of the city which we enjoyed much when the kids had been put to bed. The Alex hotel provides all the amenities that you should expect of a five star hotel. Only negative comment would be that some of the furniture seemed a bit worn and did not actually fit into the apartment. Still, definitely an overall five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: turista030
Reviews.Content: I love the Alex Hotel. Stayed there for a week in March, the weather was dreadful and it was raining all the time. However the Alex was the perfect retreat from all the noise and bustle in the streets of N.Y. I instantly got an upgrade for my room by arrival and a minute later I found myself in an 2 bedroom apartment with kitchen on the 14th floor. I felt like Carrie Bradshaw. Staff was very friendly and I was warmly welcomed every evening. I never had breakfast there cause I love the Deli on Central Station but was told that the restaurant (ringo) is supposed to be very good. I can highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: penelopelittle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Alex Hotel for 4 nights for a business trip. The room was excellent - very big, clean and modern. The location is perfect too.

Reviews.Title: “Penthouse heaven”
Reviews.Author: 23weasels
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel with my wife for our 25th wedding anniversary. Good location, near Grand Central Station. We stayed on the top floor in a suite with dining/living area, kitchenette and large, spacious bedroom. Very quiet, with height above ground and glazing keeping out all the street noise and effective A/C maening the rooms were a comfortable temperature amid the heatwave outside. Bed very comfy, bathroom with rain shower pretty good, though shower power on the low side and had an annoying habit of turning the water flow into the bathtub mid shower. TV reception was a bit poor on some of the channels. Kitchen facility was useful for simple/ready meals, and although there were pots & utensils there was no kettle, toaster etc. Big fridge was great for ice making however and the Amish market further down E45th street was useful for supplies. We didn't use the restaurant, and enjoyed our own breakfasts in the room, usually dining out in the evening. Staff were friendly & helpful. Business centre was often full - free computer use but only 3 terminals... Views over the East River and Chrysler building were fab.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Alex”
Reviews.Author: Stephans01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex Hotel for one day in June. As Leaders Club members we're upgraded to a spacious one bedroom suite on the 29th floor. The room was great with a full kitchen which we unfortunately didn't use due to our short stay. Overall a very nice hotel with wonderful views of the Chrysler Building and I wouldn't hesitate staying at The Alex again

Reviews.Title: “rescued by the alex during volcanic ash delay”
Reviews.Author: gurneyfan
Reviews.Content: we were stuck in new York for a week by the ash but found a great deal on expedia for theAlex: suite with breakfast and free bottle of champagne, It was our second stay and we loved it; some great staff, esp waitress at happy hour..half price cocktails. Huge room, great bathroom and a FREE INTERNET in business room which let my wife do 5 hours work a day while we waited for our flight. And thanks to our HSBC insurance we even got our money back!! To thank the Alex we have booked for anothe 4 nights for 2011. great location with lovely Amish food market across street. wanted taxi to JFK but they had a driver outside at a good price who was very helpful. Check out the suite/ breakfast deal on expedia...good value over ordinary rooms

Reviews.Title: “not 5* good location though”
Reviews.Author: jamesmcn
Reviews.Content: travelled with my partner and another couple at the alex for 5 nights hotel staff were friendly enough and door staff were always helpfull. wouldn't recommend using the room telephone though as it is very expensive my girlfriend used it a couple of times to call back home and was only on for about 2 minutes tops and we were hit with a bill of nearly $300 that was took out of my card just afore we checked out. so on our departure when we tried to explain to the fella in charge at the front desk that we hadn't used the phone and that it was charging $30 for it only going on to the answering machine when trying to call back home he said this was a common problem and that the money would be put back into my account so when i checked my statement when i got back home it did show that the money had been transfered back into my account so we were happy enough at that and left for the airport alough when i have just checked my statement it has shown that they had just took it back out again later on that day! i have only just realised this when i have checked my statement there so i haven't had a chance to contact the hotel yet to try and resolve the problem. apart from this the hotel is in a good location and has very comfy beds overall i would say that it is a good hotel but defenetly wouldn't say it was a 5* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: DCMex
Reviews.Content: We travel very often yo NYC, and since our children were born (now 3 and 1) we have looked into suite options for the convenience of a separate living area and kitchenettes. So far our options had been hotels from the Affinia chain, but the Alex hotel was a great option as well. The room was clean and although having a tight space a crib fit perfectly. The refrigerator was useful for milk and snaks for the children, 3 TVs, enough room for clothing. The service was friendly and nice. Bottom line, I would stay at the hotel again, but only if we get the special rate again. As some people mentioned, not worth the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “The J's visit to NYC.”
Reviews.Author: Jujster
Reviews.Content: We picked this Hotel as it was rated 4.5* to 5* in several web sites. We stayed 4 nights (Monday/Friday). I will say the staff was very friendly and accomodating, but our room was not ready when we arrived and ended up getting a smaller room than the one we reserved as it was going to take a while. There was no floormat in the bathroom nor wash cloths or hand towels. The A/C night must of been master controlled at night as it got very warm although we set the temp. to 68. We literrally had to take off the blankets. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there. Great location. Would stay again but definately not pay the hefty price.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, modern, friendly”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located for midtown access, a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Room was compact but the furniture made the most of the space, with an immense and extremely comfortable bed making the stay a real treat. Cocktails in the bar were good. One of the best mid-town stays I've had. Value at rack rate wouldn't be great, but on a deal via Amex it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless small city hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Toolbag
Reviews.Content: ,located on quiet street, making ideal for collecting zzzz'd. Stayed in one of the standard rooms. Note that this is a appartment hotel so rooms come with a kitchen on one of the bedroom Walls, not much use to many people, and not overly attactive. Bathroom tight, shower in bath (

Reviews.Title: “Amid NYC chaos, good choice.”
Reviews.Author: PaintTheCity
Reviews.Content: Because I had a 7 night stay in NY, I needed a larger room - picked the Alex mostly for that reason. I had their Executive 1-Bedroom Suite for the week, here's the good and bad about the room and my experience: - The suite was like an apartment with separate bedroom, office area, living room and small kitchenette. The fridge was a huge asset, ice maker meant you didn't have to fetch your bucket of ice. A couple of roomy closets to get your luggage out of the way. The bad features - the bathroom plumbing was confusing, poorly designed and not user-friendly. The shower was probably the worst I've ever experienced in any hotel, anywhere. You must get in first, then turn on the water, which flows from hot to cold, backwards from any shower I've ever used. That means hot is the lower pressure. There's a metal pull-tab coming out of the wall to engage the shower head, which is tough to pull and kicked back to the faucet numerous times while taking a shower. Totally unacceptable, but the management should address the issue and I can only hope they fix it. Housekeeping was problematic and inconsistent, management got word and followed up. - The majority of the staff was excellent, with respect to their generosity and assistance when needed. - The location is great, near Grand Central, midtown conveniences - somewhat quiet at night depending on the rooftop bar action next door - generally a peaceful retreat. - Internet access is $15/day, worked seamlessly, but I think it's overpriced and should always be free to guests in any hotel. - The Perfect Pint next door was the best meal I had all week. The Amish Market down the street was perfect for me, I prefer quick, ready-made meals and snacks - all could be stored in the fridge all week. Big plus. I sense this hotel is best for business travelers, overall it worked very well for me except for the cockamamee plumbing.

Reviews.Title: “Good midtown location w/o midtown noise.”
Reviews.Author: guoning
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Alex a week for work. First the good, I like the location, it's not too far from grand central, midtown restaurants, shops and my office of course. The room is modern, furniture are well designed and laid out, even though it's kinda small. it has a small kitchen area, where you can cook, the kitchen as everything one need to cook and serve. There is also a good sized refrigerator. The bathroom has rain shower and a TV, agian a bit small. Now the thing I don't like about the hotel, the lobby is very small, it gets very crowded at times when there are people checking in and out and people waiting for restaurants. There are only two elevators, it gets slow in the morning when i try to leave for work. The furniture in the room are a bit worn, especially the small dinning table in my room. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to people who are looking for somewhere quieter but still want to be close to everything Midtown can offer. I found it in a pretty central location, less than 20 bucks cab rides from Columbia if no traffic, also easy commute to union square/downtown as well.

Reviews.Title: “Generous, fabulous”
Reviews.Author: yogadocmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The staff is very accommodating. The rooms have kitchen facilities hidden behind beautiful wall units. Great to have your own bottle of Champagne. Great views of the East River and Chrysler Building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PabloLH
Reviews.Content: Since our arrival, everything about this hotel was fantastic. We stayed in a suite will all necessary appliances and amenities. There was even a TV in the Bathroom (not necessary but an example of how complete it was). The room was excellent. The service was perfect and very kind. The location is very very good as you have access to all Midtown quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “Dennis for P.M.”
Reviews.Author: CaznTrevNorthEast
Reviews.Content: My sister and I landed in New York 23rd April for 5 girlie days and after a week thinking we may not make it doe to the volcanic ash, got to this fabulous hotel, tired and not a little emotional ( free drinks from BA - thanks) to be greeted by Dennis the Concierge! He without doubt was the best sight for sore eyes! This man deserves a medal for putting up with us, and our daft questions, he made us laugh out loud each time we came and went from the hotel, and we were gutted each time he was not on duty. That's not to say the other staff were not friendly and helpful, because they were fantastic, all of them ( Carlos deserves a mention too) We had come, in part, to celebrate a big birthday, and my little sis had asked for a bottle of something nice for me. The Alex did me proud, thank you sooooooo much. The rooms are not the biggest in the world, and the view was not the best, but who cares? We were hardly in the room. and when we were we were more than comfortable, we loved the turn down service. We ate Sushi at Riingo for supper the 1st night, sitting outside in the warm evening,and Linda fell in love with the Shiraz, declaring it the best she'd ever tasted, and boy has she tasted some! Food was lovely, service great, but expensive. It was a bit of a relief when it poured down for the rest of our break, as we could not have afforded to eat there too often, and we would have been tempted if we'd seen diners outside on our way in or out! Next door, The Perfect Pint, offered us just that. The food was good too. Happy Hour was a special bonus. Along the way was the Amish Market, I want to shop there every day!! We tried a few places recommended by TA but by far the best was Scottys Diner. Go for Scottys Brunch if you're there over the week-end! If not, go there and ask Nora what she suggests. She is the best waitress in the whole world. It's a chance to eat breakfast like a local. Brilliant! Some more suggestions: Chinese at Chin Chins, Margheritas at Dallas BBQ ( really!!) Harlem Gospel brunch at B.B.Kings ( food not so good, but the "show" fabulous) P.J.Clarkes do great food, but be sure to tip twice the tax, or the waitress will let you, and anyone else in earshot ,know you did not tip enough ( nearly died from shame ha ha) - We had been told to try Smith and Wolenskys Grill, but the crowd in there were SO loud, we had to leave, but DO try. We did the downtown bus tour, and laughed all the way round, great fun, if you get a boring guide, get off and get on the next bus! We did not make as much as we could have with the NYC Pass, and if going again, I would not bother. Freestyle is the way to go.Just GO! And say hello to Dennis!

Reviews.Title: “Who Cares about the Lobby ?”
Reviews.Author: TourDoctor
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Stayed there for business during summer 2009. Close to Grand Central. Very convenient. Indeed, the remark posted here that the lobby does not provide the feeling of a "Leading Hotel" is correct. Lobby of the Hyatt at Grand Central is much more impressive. But who cares? Instead, my room in the 31st floor was absolutely impressive. Nice view, enough space - for NY : a lot of space - quiet, wonderful interior. Housekeeping excellent. Service generally very good - with one exception : it took them more than 40 minutes to serve me a rather ordinary breakfast (in their restaurant, not room service). Thus, if you are in a hurry eat somewhere else in the morning. Otherwise, flawless stay and service.

Reviews.Title: “Commendable”
Reviews.Author: eugene712
Reviews.Content: I had taken a package from my favorite website and was wary of the hotel because of the reviews. But as soon as we checked in, we were upgraded to a corner suite. With a big room divided into a workplace, a living room with TV and a dining set for four, a bedroom with TV and a bathroom with TV. The room was impeccably clean and well furnished that my wife and daughter were impressed. (Daddy makes points!!) The shower was great. Modern shower head, strong water pressure and the use of Fekkai products for bath purposes. Because of the early check in and late checkout package, we managed to pull off visiting Two Museums in a overnight stay. (Museum of Natural History and Metropolitan Museum of Art. Food is nearby if one does not wish to dine on Riingo (their restaurant on premises). We did have breakfast in our package so we did sample the Omelettes which we liked. Down the road along 45th is a very small japanese restaurant called Riki (very authentic - their Katsudon is excellent) and an Italian Restaurant. If you head east along 45th is the Amish Grocery for fresh produce and in the morning, one can go make a left on 3rd Ave and by the corner is a bagel and coffee store called Pinnacle open early in the morning. Overall....my wife and daughter agreed with me that staying in the Alex was an excellent hotel experience expecially with the upgrade. By the way, the view out the window was of another building but that did not bother me since we weren't cooped up in the room anyway. Pictures to follow

Reviews.Title: “Alex Hotel's Great Staff Comes to My Rescue”
Reviews.Author: TravelCUE
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Alex started with the lovely news that I was receiving an upgrade to a wonderful suite - full kitchen, office, living room, walk in closet, TV in the bathroom--a luxurious treat. But when I fell ill with what turned out to be a urinary tract infection the hotel staff really came to my assistance. They got me in touch with the house physician, info on local walk-in clinic, assistance with directions, menus from local take-a-ways, and one even ran to the local deli to get me a sandwich for dinner. On my return from the clinic I was shaky and exhausted. The bellman gathered my medicine and grocery bag and insisted on taking me up to my room. As a single traveler I experienced what we all fear getting really sick far from home. The staff at the Alex stepped up and helped me and I really appreciated their help.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable hotel in midtown”
Reviews.Author: ParisKat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alex for a long weekend this March. I had stayed at the hotel myself a few years ago, really liked it, and booked it for this trip after finding a very good deal on Expedia. For a total of 3 nights, we paid approximately $700, which includes all taxes and fees. First, the location of the hotel makes it a great base. It's very near the 6 subway line and to Grand Central Station. Second, the amenities are very nice. The toiletries are Fredick Fekkai, the sheets Frette, the robes Frette, the snack Dean & Deluca, and there are two TVs, one in the bedroom, one in the bathroom. Some posters have mentioned that the rooms are small. Well, maybe if you compare to a Midwest hotel room, but for New York, they are quite spacious. One thing that I have to mention is the hair dryer. I almost never trust the hotel hair dryer to be anything other than some teeny, tiny low-wattage thing. The hair dryer here is the same mega wattage that the one I have at home is. I liked the robes, slippers and hair dryers so much from my previous stay that I didn't feel the need to bring my own, which is very rare for me. I wanted to bring only a carry-on, so I was trying to save space. As for breakfast, I didn't eat at the hotel. On the same block as the hotel is a market called the Amish market, which stocks anything you might need for breakfast (there's a small buffet) or a carry out lunch. Very, very nice place. I would certainly stay at the Alex again. The windows block out most of the sound, but we did have an issue when some people near the hotel were trying to make "music" by pounding on tables and the bottoms of metal trash cans. Nothing that Ambien and earplugs can't cure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, perfect proposal”
Reviews.Author: edinslb
Reviews.Content: My now husband took me to New York as a surprise to propose to me. he picked the Alex with help from his friend and I am so pleased with them! We arrived tired and grumpy after a massive 6 hour delay at Heathrow so we were desperate to get to sleep. We checked in and went straight to our room. It was beautiful but i quickly heard something that didnt impress me. There was an awfull amount of noise when the room next door used their shower. My husband went straight down stairs to complain, to be honest we probably wouldnt have been so affected by it if it if we werent so tired!!! they apologised profusely and when he explained he just wanted everyting to be perfect as he was going to propose they upgraded our room to a suite on a much higher floor which was perfect in every way. The bed was super comfortable, the furnishings were plush and the toiletries were brilliant, none of the generic cheap stuff, they had Frederick Fekkai products which are fantastic. The hotel was fantastically situated and surprisingly quiet. I can still remember what I had for breakfast every morning - means I LOVED it. Give the Alex a go - we did and couldnt be happier that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - will be returning!!”
Reviews.Author: K_travellerEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alex Hotel for 5 days over New Year as a present from my parents for my 21st birthday!! As soon as we got there, the doormen were there to help and were very friendly and always smiling, as they always did during our entire visit. On finding out that it was for my 21st birthday, we were given a free upgrade to a gorgeous suite, I had a one bedroom suite to myself and my parents had another one. We were located on the 24th floor and I had amazing views of the Chrysler building right outside the huge windows. I had 3 wardrobes, a gorgeous bathroom, a large comfortable bed, brilliant kitchen and living room. The room was a brilliant size and the heating (which you can control yourself for both the living room and bedroom) was fantastic as it was beyond freezing outside. I could have stayed so much longer. The food in the restaurant is a little expensive, particularly in the evenings but it is definitely worth the money..the breakfast was gorgeous! All of the staff that we met, doormen, waiters/waitresses, receptionists and cleaners could not do enough for you, were always friendly and always willing to sit and talk with you. I stayed at the Wellington Hotel on a previous visit to New York and I would never go back there if you paid me..it was awful! The Alex however is a must-see and I will definitely be returning and I would recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Management”
Reviews.Author: telhado1951
Reviews.Content: I have stayed again in this hotel for six nights and every time is a perfect experience thanks to the General Manager, Mrs. Pollack, and her professional staff, especially at the front desk and the door men who are always smilig, giving to Clients a warm welcome. I wish all the best to this property and I will certanly go back again. I will honestly recommend the Alex to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Does not match LHW standards...”
Reviews.Author: ac2010
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to NYC before so felt slightly at a loss as to where and what kind of hotel I should book. I had given the trip to my mum, so I wanted a hotel of higher standard. I have made plenty of good experience with hotels which are part of the "leading hotels of the world" group so when I found a nice offer from The Alex and kind of liked to pics, I went for it. Prior to the trip, the first "hickup" was that when I asked for what transfer options they had I received a really poorly drafted word document ... I was close to doubting the sender's sincerity! Shortly prior to the trip I received a very friendly email from the manager, telling us we had been upgraded to a suite - lovely of course - and asking for further wishes. Good start! Once there, however I was disappointed from the start. Checkin was far from smooth and rather businesslike, not too friendly. We disliked the interieur, but well, that's individual tastes... looked rather worn even though I do not think the hotel is very old. The suite had a "fully equipped" (well...) kitchenette, a sofa that looked as if it was cheapest plastic ever and a TV. The fridge was so loud that it was unbelievably annoying. The suite had a huge balcony with a view over the Chrysler building, of course, in summer that could be a real asset. Bathroom very small but okay, bedroom too. In-room safe unusable. However, the thing I disliked most was the service - eg we are checked in as two people, but the turn-down service persistently only but one pair of slippers and one bathing robe on the bed. It's just not first class. Light bulbs were broken, TV remotes did hardly work etc ... Also, both the service in the restaurant, where we had breakfast (which could be chosen a la carte up to a certain value and was okay, but not great) nor the front desk or other people were too forthcoming. Am used different from other LHW hotels. And when I asked for a cab to leave the airport, we were provided with a town car - not much more expensive than a cab, but driver went via I don't know which mini roads to avoid tolls ... in 5pm traffic. Really annoying. Granted, the hotel is very well situated. But if I had not booked at this special rate, I would have been very upset about my choice. A pity!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, big price!”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because it was 50 meters away from a building where I had meetings. But it was a mistake. Price was very high for the smallest room I ever saw with a view to backyard storage (I was on a lower floor). Room was so small that I hardly managed to open my suitcase. Lady on the reception was very very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a "Leading Hotel of the World": mediocrity for a premium price”
Reviews.Author: sebgoes
Reviews.Content: The hotel website promises much - urban chic, modernity and a high level of comfort and service. But it is tired, tired, tired - and way overpriced. The hotel is not atrocious but it laughable that with so many basic errors it can be classed as "a leading hotel of the world". This umbrella organization really needs to re-examined the standard required for admission to its club. We booked a suite with a kitchen as we had two young children, but the kitchen was not equipped with any of the basis necessities required to cook: no cutting knives or boards, no toaster, or utensils of any kind. Eventually, we got the basics but we had to ask. The furniture in our room was tired and chipped. The DVD player on one of the TVs was not hooked up and two blown bulbs had not been replaced. Room service had a habit of taking things away but not replacing them: by the end of our stay most of the glasses had gone, and the bathrobes had disappeared. On three of the five nights, the kitchen garbage bin was emptied but no new liner inserted. And the final insult was to be overcharged by over $3100 due to a human error. The amount was refunded when we spotted the error on our credit card bill, but with no gesture or hint of apology. The public spaces are spartan and small. Nowhere is there a feeling of luxury, or of the extra mile that one would expect at this price level. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CrisBLondon
Reviews.Content: Just spent the days upto and including New Year in New York at the Alex. Great Hotel they couldn't do enough to make our stay the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alrsp13
Reviews.Content: Staff were so helpful...kindly upgraded us to a superior suite for the sum of $4 tax extra. The suite was fantastic with everything you could possibly want including a tv in the bathroom. A short walk from central station and not too far from Times Square. We loved this hotel and would use again on our next visit to NY

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: brad201
Reviews.Content: The Alex is in a great location but I would say that the hotel wants to be a 5 star and charge like one but operates more like a 3 star. I had a suite room with a kitchenette. One problem, no coffee maker in the suite. They want you to have to call room service every day and pay $12 to get coffee and wait for it. First time in any hotel except Vegas with this issue. I asked the staff at the front desk and they said they would send one up but never did. Later I found out that they never intended to and do not have any. This is inexcusable. The rooms are nice and the hotel is clean, food is good also. But I agree with the previous review that the staff is only so, so and the elevator situation is not great. This hotel is ok but overpriced for what you get. Things like free internet and coffee in a suite are expected.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE ALEX”
Reviews.Author: HCABraz
Reviews.Content: I´ve been in NY more than 10 times... And every single time I stay in a different hotel to get different experiences. This time, although a friend of mine warned me about The Alex Hotel, I did like the site and the price (for the best room available) and I booked. Well, what can I say? It´s a 2 star hotel charging as a 5 star hotel. They do pretend to be a 5 star hotel, charging really high prices for the breakfast and for everything else you need. They do have good amenities (such as great brand of shampoo and lcd tv at the small, REALLY small bathroom) and.... That´s it. The staff are friendly (until you complain about something... After that you´ll feel their anger) and the entrance hall and elevators (lifts) are a joke! And talking about the staff, it´s too small. After two days, I gave up, lost some money (no, they didn´t give my money back) and moved to other hotel (The Pierre, not excellent, but 100 times better than The Alex...). Even the location of The Alex is not that good (The Wellington Hotel, chargind much more reasonable prices and much better than the Alex is much better located). If you´re thinking in staying at The Alex, save some money and just pick a 2 or 3 star hotel... It will, for sure, be better. Horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: NyLc
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom suite and was amazed to find our room had views of both the Chrysler Bldg AND the water from the living room windows. The suite itself, was large, modern, well planned and well appointed. The bedroom was quite comfortable, the bathroom was typically small but well designed. The rainshower took some reading of directions to figure out - but not TOO difficult. The Frederic Fekkai bath products were wonderful. The kitchen was well stocked with expensive treats - but no coffee maker?? That was my only head scratcher... and really, when you're in the middle of Manhattan, you are never too far away from coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not a "Leading Hotel of the World"”
Reviews.Author: MarVaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely not a luxury hotel but if you can get a good price for it it is decent, in a good location, clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. We paid 300 USD for our room which I found expensive for what's on offer. Rooms are very small (at least our two double-bed twin room was) and bathrooms are small and slightly run down. I agree with other reviews that rooms are noisy (soundproofing is poor both between rooms and in relation to street noise) and we had various faults such as - central heating not working -, remote control not working, one phone not working in the room. Conclusion: if you can get a good price the hotel is fine but its probably closer to a 3-star than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. a real gem in the heart of ny”
Reviews.Author: DARACork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel on expedia after reading the reviews. they seem to have an upgrade policy where possible and we were upgraded. even still this is great hotel in a v good location. bar closes a bit early but there is a good bar (called perfect pint) right next door. benedict and bill were excellent at the front desk and recommended a fab restaurant "buddakan" in the meat packing district. by the way the people who complained about the linen and the beds etc were staying in a different hotel (or planet!). the alex was faultless in this regard as all others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service; Noisy; Indifferent Management”
Reviews.Author: EmgeeNewYork
Reviews.Content: I booked a night at The Alex Hotel with my daughter to celebrate a special birthday. When booking the reservation (at full price through the hotel Web site), I asked for a high floor with a view. When we arrived, someone was checking in next to us, and was told by the reservation agent that there were many rooms available that night. Imagine my surprise, then, when I arrived at our room to find it was on the lowest guest floor of the hotel (4th) overlooking a parking garage. I went back to the front desk and was told that no other rooms were available. The non-insulated windows let in traffic noise all evening, including a garbage truck that spent about 25 minutes compacting hotel trash in the middle of the night. When we checked out the next day, my daughter asked the front-door desk clerk if she could have a hotel pen as a souvenir of her stay, as it was her birthday. He smiled and said "No." That seemed to be a good summary of how guests are treated at the Alex -- more as intruders than valued customers. I should also mention that my daughter had four insect bites on her arm when we left the hotel. I asked the front desk for the email of the manager of the hotel and was given a general "info" email number for Mary Lou Pollack. I sent her a polite email with my comments about the hotel. When she didn't reply, I called her office. She did not return the phone call. A week later, my husband called her office. She said, in a brusque voice, that she had "forwarded" the email somewhere. My husband asked her for the name of the company that owns the Alex Hotel. She said "I will not tell you." So there you have it. If you're looking to be treated poorly in a substandard hotel -- where poor service seems to be a management prerequisite from the top down -- The Alex should be your choice. If not, choose any other hotel in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VCruz27
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with a contemporary flair. The staff were very friendly and the doorman remembered my name for the length of my stay. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Without a Service Elevator? NOT”
Reviews.Author: CALIorNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was spartan but fine, however, I honestly do not understand how a highrise hotel can operate with service carts and personnel constantly tieing up the elevators? On more than one occasion it took over 10 minutes to reach the lobby from the 25th floor, literally

Reviews.Title: “sub-standard”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: If it was billed as a generic two to three star hotel for travelling salesmen, this would be a perfectly fine place. But since it is supposed to be an upscale hotel, I was suprised to find pretty much every single piece of furniture in the room severely chipped, the soap holder in the chipped bathtub consisting of loose wires, the remote controls held together with plastic tape and crusted with dirt and hair, more hair in the bathtub and sink, layers of dust on the tissue dispenser and the TV, curtains torn and marked with ballpoint pen ink, hotel directory with coffee stains and torn edges, artwork peeling off the walls, two non-functioning lightbulbs, a stained carpet, and an overall less-than-classy atmosphere. The tiny "lobby" is mostly used by staff members to congregate and chat, undeterred by guests. The only positive things to say are that at least the staff is friendly and the beds are comfortable. But from a "Leading Hotel of the World" in this price range, I would expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: qreply
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work trip. I didn't spend a ton of time there due to the nature of the work I had to do but it was a nice place to come back to to recover. The room I was in was on the 6th floor. This particular room didn't have much of a view but it was comfortable and clean. The bathtubs are deep, and great for soaking after a long day of working then walking all around Midtown. The room was small but had almost everything you would need. Every staff member I met was always polite and very helpful. Pros: In room safe. Comfortable and clean. TV on the bathroom wall. Great Staff Location - just blocks from the UN and Grand Central Cons Small room (but that should be expected in this part of NYC) Internet Access is $15.00 a day

Reviews.Title: “Non comparison excellence”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasKenNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel and the staff were absolutely splended. We could not have asked for anything better. The concierge, housekeeping, the doormen, even the staff in the restaurant exceeded our expectations. This will be my home away from home everytime I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex”
Reviews.Author: Marw00d
Reviews.Content: We arrived bedraggled from London, NorthWest Airlines having misplaced our luggage, on our honeymoon, offering this tale of woe. Seconds later, we had toothbrushes, toothpaste, deodorants, NYC guides and an upgrade to the penthouse suite. And the service never became any less friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was necessarily large, so I can't vouch for others tales, but we loved the place and its staff. If we can ever afford another NYC trip, we'll be staying at the Alex. (And we won't be traveling with NorthWest Airlines.)

Reviews.Title: “'Super' Comfy Bed/Pillows & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SAReviews
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay, the bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable. Hotel is modern and elegant. A little small for a suite, but hotel reviews prepared me to expect small rooms in new york. Suite had it's own kitchen and even a full size fridge/freezer, very nice. Location was really good, only a few blocks away from Time Square which was probably a 10-15 minute walk. We did alot of walking and it was very easy to find our way back to the hotel. Try some beautiful pizza at 'Little Italy' which is on the same street as the hotel, but 2 or 3 blocks up heading towards Time Square. I would most definately recommend this hotel, expecially to a first time traveller to New York (like me).

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Stay at the Alex Hotel - Great Staff and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: msjeannettea
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay at the Alex Hotel. I got a superb rate for the weekend of 7/31-8/2 and they upgraded me to the 1 Bedroom Suite. Which was huge, looked like a 1 bdrm NY Apartment. Not sure what the other reviewer was talking about. There was plenty of seating in the living room, plus a dining room table, a Sub Zero Fridge/Freezer, Stove, dishwasher including Pots & Pans. Plenty of amentities! It's New York, why would you stay cooped up in your room!? What I like about the Alex is that the floors only have 4 other rooms which makes for a really quiet stay. You can't go wrong with the Alex. It's 2 blocks from Grand Central station, it's easy to get a cab and travel back to your hotel late a night with safety.

Reviews.Title: “A dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: macappin
Reviews.Content: I was dissappointed I booked this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews. Hotel was stylish but that was at the expense of substance. We had a one bedroom suite with a full Kitchen. The seating area was small and uncomfortable the very upmarket kitchen was for show not use. Ventilation was a real problem we just could not get the room cool. On the plus side the staff were great and the price was competitive but the hotel was not the best placed for sightseeing with a long walk to the subway. I would not pick it as a my choice again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to Look at but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: WatsonTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Alex Hotel to celebrate our 4th anniversary. Everything looked nice and the staff was very friendly checking our luggage for us since the room was not available and showing us the ins and outs of our room later. I was also impressed with the hotel honored a NYCGO discount rate for the sunday night portion of our stay. Other hotels refused this deal. The king-sized bed was terribly uncomfortable for 2 tall people. The headboard cuts into the top of the bed making it the shortest king sized bed I've ever seen which made for a very uncomfortable nights sleep. Additionally, I was bitten my bed bugs every night and once killed a spider in our bed. I contacted the hotel about the problem and they made no effort to even respond about my concern. We ate the overpriced breakfast every morning and had drinks in the hotel bar one evening. The service there was definitely lacking. The hotel was in Midtown which we thought would be more centrally located than it was. End of story, if you are looking for a romantic tourist trip to NYC, I am sure there are much better suited hotels for such a jaunt.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and trendy”
Reviews.Author: capitol_couple
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotel website and got not only a decent rate ($200), but an upgraded suite upon arrival. That seems to be a trend with other reviewers. Overall, we were very happy with our stay. I will note that the only things that did not completely meet my expectations were the furniture (small and modern like Ikea, looks like leather but feels like plastic) and the lack of hypoallergenic bedding if you are allergic to down. The location is good - there are several Irish pubs in the area, some great Italian restaurants, and a quick walk to Grand Central Station with market (not to be missed), wine-store, and food court. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go including Radio City, Central Park, .

Reviews.Title: “It was ok....”
Reviews.Author: hunnygrl420
Reviews.Content: I was pretty satisfied with most aspects of the room, except the fact that it was EXTREMELY small. I only had a view of the ally out back, but hey, you win some you lose some. The view just depends on what side of the building they have an available room on, so you can't be mad at that... Cleanliness: can't complain about that. But there was one small thing that was kind of annoying. The shower doors leaked at the bottom and no matter what I did there was always a large pool of water on the bathroom floor after showering. Then I would have to put towels down to soak it up and hence always had wet towels on the floor until the room was serviced again... Not a huge deal, but a bit annoying. Service: great, very friendly and knowledgable staff and doormen. Location: EXCELLENT! Right in midtown east, just 2 block from grand central, and you can get anywhere from there so in essence, it was close to everything. Value: We reserved our room when there were having some kind of special, so we got a great deal and were very happy with the price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely moment of peace in the city that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: Miek17
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Well taken care of. Very modern as well. The room I stayed in was rather large. It had all the luxury on needs in a thriving city. Television, a good, large bed, a proper bathroom with a television! The staff leaves you in peace but is there when you need them. They are kind to help you on reservations and the cleaning was all right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Korbanleelumo
Reviews.Content: The price we paid for the room was a great value for a hotel in Manhattan. And the size of the room was big compared to other trendy hotels in NYC. Great location, friendly staff, clean room. The only issue we had was we couldn't get the room any colder then 74 degrees. It wasn't hot, but it wasn't very comfortable for us. We did not complain about this to the staff since it was a short stay only.

Reviews.Title: “The Alex is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: rickmars
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex 5 nights. This is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite on arrival; although the bedroom and bathroom were still on the small side, the are huge by New York standards. If you book, take the option that includes breakfast. The rate was $20 more, but a $50 value. The staff is overly friendly, helpful, and an absolute pleasure every day. The rooms are cleaned twice a day; the maid would come every night and ask if we wanted more towels. The hotel is extremely quiet, and the beds wonderful to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a ‘Leading Hotel of the World’ !!!”
Reviews.Author: bushinesu
Reviews.Content: The Alex Hotel is a member of ‘The Leading Hotels of the World’ but as soon as you see the rooms you really have to wonder why (see negative points) >> Positive: - friendly and helpful staff at the door and the reception desk - good location in Midtown Manhattan (close to the U.N. / 5th Avenue / Central Park) - nice view from the room (Chrysler Building) - Starbucks and good Amish-Supermarket in close walking distance - Comfortable (but short) bed Negative: - Overall: room looked very used - dirty carpet - damaged furniture - dirty and damaged wallpaper - dirty and damaged bathroom: you should not look behind the TV in the bathroom. It was dusty and dirty and obviously has not been cleaned since the opening of the hotel / the little shelf in the shower was damaged / stones in the bathroom were moldy!!! / shower pressure was very low - two of three lamps in the room did not work - room service was very bad: on two of the four days we had no bathmat although we complained about it at the reception desk / no new shampoo and toiletries etc. during the whole stay although you pay the same price for the room every night / no bathrobes and slippers in the room / cleaning staff threw away all of our shopping bags without asking!! Conclusion: This Hotel is definitely NOT a ‘Leading Hotel of the World’ and the member group should consider excluding this hotel from the club of perfect hotels!!! If you stay there do not pay the official price of the room because this would be more than overpriced for the quality and services they offer. Our Room-Number #906

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean”
Reviews.Author: flintstone6263
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, which is expected. For the price we paid, it wasn't bad. The sheets, however, were not great. All kinds of hair are found on them, and they are not ours. When I said "hair", I don't mean the ones on someone's head. We found them the first night before going to bed. We didn't check-in until 5pm, even though we got there at 10am. They staff must be a bit rushed.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: amcellig
Reviews.Content: very good hotel. friendly, efficient staff. i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but so-so location”
Reviews.Author: jrp9f
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alex for two weeks in late April/early May for work as it's one of our work approved hotels and I'd certainly come back if it was in a better location. Personally, I'm not a huge fan of Midtown and Midtown East is pretty dreary in my opinion. But location aside, the Alex is a great hotel. The service is great and the room is very comfortable (the bed is super cozy!). I had a corner room that had a separate living area which was nice since I was there for so long. My only mild complaints were that the tv's they have are a terribly quality (bad reception so that there were lines all across the screen on most channels) and the heat wasn't working so it was pretty cold at night (which I called about multiple times but they didn't fix). But that aside, really very comfortable and I love the Frederic Fekkai toiletries!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: Frank1001_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited NYC for our anniversary, and choose The Alex. Upon arrival,we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite on the 19th floor that had a great view. Christina, the desk clerk greeted us and volunteered helpful information to improve our stay. In addition, it must be noted that the staff was friendly and polite. Our room was very comfortable and boasted of kitchen facilities; though the furniture was dated and in need of refurbishing. Hygiene was questionnable, as the duvet had washed out urine stains on it. Needless to say, it was changed promptly. We were offered apologies and another upgrade but declined as we were settled in and wished to avoid the hassel of moving. The Alex is in a quiet and safe area, centrally located and within walking distance of important points of interest and eateries. Times Square is about a twenty minute walk. Besides our little glitch, our overall experience was great and we would consider staying there again if the rates were affordable.

Reviews.Title: “nicely situated”
Reviews.Author: SGarl
Reviews.Content: Situated in a nice area, not too busy and noisy, but within easy reach of the Chrysler building and grand central station for the subway, 15-20 mins walk to Times Square & Broadway. Staff were extremely helpful, lobby is very small, but functional, rooms adequately sized with good storage solutions, modern bathroom, with TV in it!!. Internet isn't free currently $15 day, the gym is nice - if you get time! Would recommend the diner across the road for breakfast and the Irish bar next door serves good food (try the sweet potato fries, they're delicious). Lots of Irish bars in the vicinity and a range of restaurants and the Amish deli is very much worth a visit. Hotel Restaurant is bigger than it looks although have to confess we didn't eat there. Be careful of some of the corner mobile stores and such as the horse carriage drives around central park as they will try and charge you an elevated price if you don't keep your wits about you. remember to take some visitor ID such as passport or new York pass to the visitor centre before you shop in Macey's to get 11% discount, & if you use the subway more than 1 person can use the same card, so get a day pass or 3/7 day pass as it's good value for money, $2 per journey - don't bother with the single pass. i do recommend seeing Mamma mia -it was fantastic Above all enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, spacious rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pinky4Surrey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel having got a fantastic deal for 4 nights for the price of 3. The hotel was very clean, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the rroms were very spacious and light!! We went with friends to celebrate their Birthday's so we had 2 rooms between us all and both were great. Even though we didn't get an upgrade, our room was still fantastic and had views of the Crysler building. The Perfect Pint Irish bar next door is a real treat. They serve good food and beer, have 3 indoor floors and an excellent roof top terrace where you can have a drink in the sun!! We ate at a nearby restaurant which was amazing and very reasonably priced - The Dos Caminos 3rd Avenue is a mexican restaurant which serves the tasty food like you've never had. The waiter we had was really helpful explaining the menu to us and the food was to die for!! Another tip is to head for the Rainbow room bar at the top of the Rockafella centre. We went there to have cocktails which were cheaper than paying to go to the look out deck only 5 floors above. We watched the sun go down from here which was fantastic. The waiter there also gave us free servings of deserts, even though we didn't order any food! Overall, the hotel is in an excellent location close enough to the metro and many key sights and buildings, but off the main strip to be quiet enough to relax in. We used the business centre once to check in for our return flight. The internet acces was free and we had no problem accessing the computer or printers.

Reviews.Title: “Solid location, big room, needs updating really bad”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have stayed at the Alex when it first opened about 5 years ago. We paid $225 a night. If you decide to stay make sure you shop around. I have seen it for less. We were upgraded to a suite. Full kitchen, with king bed, kitchen, and living room. The living room was not worth it. The furniture was in bad shape and uncomfortable. The bedroom was clean and nice. Bathroom was small and shower/tub was nice size. You could watch TV from the shower. The shower kept turning off due to water pressure issues. Location - We did a lot of stuff in SOHO,NOHO, and Flatiron. $7 cab ride was not bad. I would opt to stay in that area next trip. The neighborhood is pretty cool. Several deli's in the area. The Amish store is across the street, and shoe repair(I needed to get my shoes put back together) around the corner. There are many hotels in NYC and the next time I head to NYC I am going to try SOHO Grand, or Gramercy Park. TIPS for this area and hotel - Don't pay for breakfast or coffee at the hotel, walk outside and experience the deli's or markets nearby. They are very inexpensive. Internet- $15 a day is steep. The business center on the 3rd floor is nice and they printers. We had a suite and were able to buy water and drinks for the room. Found all nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stripy242
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the city for our anniversary, and choose The Alex. When we got there, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite on the 24th floor that had a grerat view. The desk staff were very nice, and offerd us some great restaurants to try out. The beds were very comfortable. Only downfall was that the room service was extremely overpriced for what we recieved. There is a great diner across the street for a good breakfast. Overall wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 0NamesLeft
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex for 4 nights over the Easter weekend. It was a great hotel for a great price. We managed to get a great package rate that included valet parking, full breakfast and an upgrade to a Deluxe suite with a kitchenette. The room was located on the 26th floor and quite spacious (for NYC standards). The following is worth noting: - internet is not free and the business centre is a small converted bedroom with 3 computers. The room is often full. - the elevators are slow. - the noise from the hallways. We heard clearly our neighbours going in and out of their room. Otherwise, it was quiet. - the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Grand Central and 15 minutes to Times Square and otherwise not close to anything. - the breakfast is yummy. Even better when it's included in the rate. I still crave the granola! - a small problem with the bill was rectified immediately.

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous new york city stay - a very well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMae57
Reviews.Content: The Alex Hotel must be mid-town Manhattan'sbest kept secret at 205 east 45 street. we booked a one bedroom site at expedia for eight nights, costing $4000 aus including taxes and charges. the suite was superb, furnished beautifully with a balcony, and also a full kitchen. we were about 200 metres from the amish market where you could buy anthing needed for the kitchen. The Alex is also very close to Grand Central, within a 5 minute walk. Staff at the Alex were very helpful. Our thanks to Christina and Dennis. If you are looking for top quality accommodation and first class service, you will do no better than The Alex. Can't wait to get back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money! I would not recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: pillo123
Reviews.Content: We stay at The Alex for 4 nights. The location is good. The lobby is terribly small and often overcrowded (especially on weekends when people are coming and leaving). They upgrade you to a junior suite, but the only difference is the kitchen in the entrance corridor. The prices of the food&drinks in the room are insane (15 USD for a nuts box from Dean&Deluca - same boy i the shop for 4 USD). The room was not properly equipped: shampoo was missing, we had to ask how to use the shower, and when we asked for a power converter (to recharged our laptop) we found on our invoice a charging of 25 USD!!!!!!!!!. Internet in the room is 15 USD / Day and what the call Business center is a small room with 3 computers and a printer. Attention: The restaurant is not nice, very small. Breakfast is not recommended. No Buffet. Only A la Carte and very expansive, poor quality. The staff was ok. It is not a Design hotel at all, there is no care for details, and little style. (only a lot of flat Tv everywhere and a fireplace in the lobby)

Reviews.Title: “Called it 'Home' for the weekend...”
Reviews.Author: smileydvl
Reviews.Content: After moving out of the City a few years ago, it is always a treat to play a 'New Yorker' again when I get the chance. Not only was the Alex Hotel the perfect stop to do that, but the suite was so amazing that my boyfriend and I wanted to call it 'home'. (Needless to say it far surpassed my previous humble abode!) The lobby is clean and simple - minimalist, far more important in my opinion to concentrate on the rooms - which they do. The suite is large, comfortable and made for entertaining either with friends, family or just the two of you. With a full kitchen, living room/dining room combo with a flat screen TV, a large bedroom with flat screen and a bathroom with TV (much more appropriate than a phone - never quite understood that one) - this place had it all. The Alex was perfectly located for us - close to Grand Central and lots of great bars and restaurants in walking distance, and after just two nights it was so hard for us to leave. We will be back, though, and will go through PerfectEscapes again. As a 'New Yorker' (my boyfriend is cringing), I always search for the deal to get the best for the best price, and they didn't do us wrong! Hope you enjoy our 'home' as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Greta Hotel, Location and People”
Reviews.Author: CJLondonUxbridge
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Alex for 3 nights mid March. The lobby was pretty small as many have suggested although while we were there, it was not once crowded with no queues for check in etc. It was cosy and the fire centre piece looked welcoming. The check in staff were great and told us that we had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite much to our delight. We went to our room which was very modern, incredibly clean and perfect for our stay. The bedroom and bathroom were quite small but we had plenty of room in the living/kitchen area and hwho needs a huge bedroom in NYC when you're out and about most of the time so this was not an issue in the slightest. The doormen were nice although not overly chatty/freindy as others have ecperienced although very professional. Maybe we didn't try hard enough to talk to them! The Irish bar right next door is really great with a good atmosphere and great food. Shows all sports that you could ever want to watch and is fairly reasonable. There is also a coffee shop called Macchiatos a couple of streets down towards Grand Central which did great coffee and hot croissants & bagels (amongst other more healthy options!) made to order at very reasonable prices, perfect for breakfast. All-in-all our stay at the Alex was absolutely perfect and value for money too! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. The only regret i have is that we did not get a moment to eat in the restaurant which everyone who had eaten there were raving about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLisaUk
Reviews.Content: The Alex Hotel had mixed reviews but decided to stay and see for myself, I'm very glad I did. I have never written a review before but felt compelled to do so because of the excellent stay we had. I booked this trip to New York for 5 nights as a surprise for my husband's 40th and he loved The Alex (and he is very fussy, as am I!!). We both like modern and clean and this is exactly what we got. I booked a standard room and early check-in, we got neither. When we arrived the room was not ready, the staff were extremely apologetic and asked if we would mind going for a bite to eat which we did as it was just after lunch and we hadn't eaten. When we returned we were surprised and delighted to be upgraded to a two bed, two bathroom corner suite with kitchen and views of the Chrysler Building. The room was fantastic and huge. We didn't eat in the hotel but The Comfort Diner across the street does excellent food and we ate breakfast there most mornings. I checked out loads of hotels before I booked The Alex and I can absolutely say that I booked the best hotel, it is within easy walking distance to all the main attractions that New York has to offer ie, 10 minutes walk to Times Square, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue etc etc. We had a fabulous time and can't wait to return. If in doubt just book The Alex Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't bother again”
Reviews.Author: KazLondon
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews prior to staying at the Alex, I was rather disappointed. My room was on the 9th floor at the front of the hotel, which meant it was very noisy (distcart came round every morning at 3.30am!! and stayed at least half an hour emptying the dustbins from the offices across the road!) My room had obviously sustained a water leak at some point, and the wall and curtains still had water marks on them - not very professional for this level on hotel. The TV remote control also didn't work properly (but that was a major problem for me as I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel). On the plus side, it does have a very good gym and bath accessories are lovely, but personally I would stay at or recommend anyone else to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelHag
Reviews.Content: Had a killer AAA deal directly through the hotel website which included breakfast and overnight parking. We had a double deluxe room and because the hotel was not full, we were able to check in at 8:00am (we took a red-eye from SLC) and we even got a late check-out. Breakfast was great at Ringo ( $25.00 per person to spend with the rate) specifically the attentive service and the yummy eggs benedict with chipotle hollandaise and prosciutto! Actually every employee that we encountered at the Alex always had a smile on their face and went out of their way to make each encounter a positive experience! Our room was adequately furnished, beds were super comfy, but the bathroom small with a TV embedded in the wall! The rainshower was also alittle tricky. But I did love the Frederic Fekkai products and the housekeeping staff was very generous with extras! The location was also great - just steps away from Grand Central Station, Times Square, the UN, 5th ave, etc. The lobby is very small and the hotel is very much a boutique sized hotel that is very understated. I would definitely stay at The Alex again, however they should provide free WI-FI!

Reviews.Title: “Good size room for NYC, great modern bathroom and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: bermudagirl_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very centrally located and close to what we needed. Room was a good size and smartly designed - quite chich. Bathroom was the biggest we've had in NYC thus far, very modern, clean and complete with amazing frederic fekkai bath products and rain shower. Front desk and door staff were very attentive (overly so which is nice when you actually need some help!!) and knowledgable. Weren't affraid to consult the Zagatt which I loved - afterall it is NYC with a million restaurants to choose from - who can remember them all!??? Not sure what normal rates are as we got a deal on expedia but if affordable I would't think twice about staying here again. p.s. great bar next door called the Perfect Pint

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Fantastic Staff, Beautiful & immaculate rooms”
Reviews.Author: taztrip
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff were so helpful and friendly. The decor was the right mix of funky and beautiful. We were only on a short weekend break so didn't spend that much time in the hotel but whenever we were there, we were able to relax and enjoy ourselves. One of the highlights was the Fekkai toiletries which were provided!! There were proper wine glasses provided and space in the fridge for your own bits which was useful. It was located only a few blocks from 5th Avenue which made it a brilliant base for exploring the city but it was far enough away to be a bit quiter than staying right in the center of things. There was a lovely looking Japanese restaurant attached to the restaurant but didn't go there simply becuase we ran out of time but did manage to sneak in one of their brilliant cocktails! There was a fantastic diner across the way which served proper American breakfast which set us up for a days walking. Loved it and would highly recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Holly86London
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at The Alex for 5 days at the beginning of feb. We were upgraded to a suite on the 32nd floor-one floor below the penthouse with the most amazing view of the chrysler building and the east river. The staff couldn't have done enough for us-they were all so friendly and very helpful. We were really jet-lagged on our first night so the concierge sorted out ordering the biggest takeaway pizzas (17"!) from Angelos for us which was just a nice little touch. Grand central station is just two blocks away, and everything is within walking distance. We only ate at the Riingo once, which was quite small but a fantastic dinner- definitely worthy of it's michelin star, but also with a michelin star price tag! The room's are very modern, cosy and comfortable. I can't compare the size of the suite to a standard room but it was generous for Manhattan. The bathroom had a flat screen tv on the wall which was great! This is the best hotel we have stayed at in New York and we'll definitely be returning on our next visit. Thanks to everyone at The Alex!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: splatnz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 2bdrm suite for 4 nights in November. Overall definitely enjoyed the stay and we thought the staff were excellent. Likes - good location, near Main Station and Chrysler Building. - a la carte breakfast at the restaurant came with the room. Try the chilli spiced hollandaise eggs benedict! - you can get real coffee in the bar, not the usual stuff you get in America. - good size room (for Manhattan), with good amenities and technology - free internet Dislikes - the shower head over the bath kept on switching itself back to the bath head - charging for small things like bottled water Overall enjoyed the stay and would stay here again. Not so passionate though that I wouldn't stay somewhere else if I could find a good deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some minor kinks”
Reviews.Author: Ljanie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Fantastic location. You really can't beat the location if you are going to be spending most of your time in midtown. Grand Central station is right around the corner. Staff were super friendly. We were upgraded to a free suite. We had dinner in the restaurant one night and it was great. The suite was large, plenty of space for storage. Large flat screen tv in which you could rent movies if you wanted a lazy night in. Bed was super comfortable. Loved having the refrigerator if only to store snacks for midnight munchies. Most of the guests staying at the hotel appeared to be European. A new irish pub opened up a few weeks ago right next door to the hotel. The pub was large, 3 floors, clean and the staff friendly. There were 3 other Irish pubs right in the area of the hotel. Not sure why so many!! Negative The back of the remote control in the bathroom was broken. Instead of fixing properly, it had black tape on it to hold the batteries in. Very cheap looking. Heating did NOT work properly. The heating had 2 settings - on at 75 degrees or off. 75 was too warm, even during the winter. When we asked to have it fixed someone came up to the room, they turned it off and opened the window. LOL. So basically, we slept with the windows open to get some air circulating in the room. We asked to have feather pillows swapped out for foam ones due to an allergy I have. They brought up foam pillows while we were out but left the feather ones:) Given it was a suite, I'd expect a bigger bathroom, with a larger tub and more space on the bathroom sink are to put "things". Overall, a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Alex was great!”
Reviews.Author: kingmikey
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Great Location without being in too touristy location *Easily accessible to subways *Very sheik modern designed rooms with TVs in the bathroom *Tons of Parking available in the area. Cons: *Like every decent hotel in NY it could be pricey if you don't look for great deals or wait to the last minute to get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: arthurelliot
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Alex. We booked our room at a great rate using Hotels.com. The room itself was on the small side, though for the price I suppose it was to be expected for a NYC hotel room. For that price I've definitely seen smaller rooms (The Hudson) and larger rooms (The Omni Birkshire) I will say that, even though it was small, the room had very nice ammenities and was organized in such a way that it was very efficient. It had a nice flat-screen tv, decent size closet, mini bar, etc. The location of the hotel was good. We walked to the shopping areas on 5th Ave, Rockafeller Center, etc. Overall the staff were friendly and helpful. The lobby is small and does tend to get chaotic at certain times of the day. Other than that I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: hesasmartguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when they ran the fantastic 1928 promotion and this hotel pulls out all the stops for their guests. Everyone makes you feel welcome, the decor is incredible and the location is great. One member of staff in particular, Hillen was lovely who helped us a lot. Would come back for sure. Thank you The Alex!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MMMDublin
Reviews.Content: I had booked a one-bedroom room at the Alex. I had requested early check-in and a high floor. When I checked in at 12:30, my room was ready, on the 33rd floor, and I had received a complimentary upgrade. However, the room was quite warm, and the AC unit was tempermental. When I contacted reception, I was moved to another room immediately - a two-bedroom suite. Kudos to Dennis at reception who handled this and all matters so efficiently and professionally. While the above does lead to biased judgement, I cannot praise this hotel enough. Location, room size, servicing and staff quality were second to none. I did not eat in the hotel, but you are in the midst of midtown - walk to Ess-a-Bagel - 5 blocks away on 53rd and 3rd for a real NY experience and a world class breakfast. Ditto dinner - Sparks, Arva, Docks, Maloney & Porcelli, Smith & Wollenskey and the eateries at Grand Central are less than a 5 minute stroll away. I will be back.!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jktravelbug
Reviews.Content: Very Attentive staff. Comfortable beds. They upgraded us to a 2 bedroom apartment for no additional charge. Didn't want to leave the room but who can ignore New York City....Would definetly stay here again. Special thanks to Dennis at the front desk. He was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: kite2live
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York for business several times a year. The Alex Hotel is by far the best place I have ever stayed. Rooms are amazing, service is beyond excellent, location is ideal. I really just can't think of a single bad thing to say. No complaints whatsoever, and trust me, I am VERY picky.

Reviews.Title: “Compact and friendly stay at the Alex”
Reviews.Author: simonblyth
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on their own web site and trip advisor reviews. Located in a very good part of mid town NYC, near Grand Central station. Plenty food, bars, shops, sites very close by etc etc. Amish market in same street was just amazing........ Inital reaction on arrival was lobby area felt very small. On really looking, it 'was' small but making best use of space. Not a grand traditional enterence some may expect from a "better" hotel. Front desk staff very helpful and friendly on arrival however check in time of 4pm being stuck too was disappointing. However, the stored bags fine and gave a number to phone after three to see if room was ready... We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was plenty room for a short trip to NYC. Bathroom was small and dark but clean, very functional and shower was great. All it probably needed was a few extra bright downlighters and white paint and we would never have noticed. The bedroom was a perfect size for a couple with 4 cases to fill and the plasma TV was fully sufficient with the 40 or so free US trash tv channels and news. The living area in the suite was the only small let down. It was a little shabby and just needed freshed up. On reflection, we probably did not need this space, however, may not have thought this if we have got a smaller cheaper room. Dont know how pokey these are!......The suite did have a full kitchen and fridge though. We never used the kitchen but fridge and freezer came in handy for our market bought refreshments and ice cream!!! One good thing about the suite was that we were on the 31st out of 33 floors. What a view and quieter up there !!. See photos we took from the room. Chrysler building right outside our bedroom window and we could be the manhattan water way from living room. Did not use the hotel gym so cannot say how good it was however the business centre (one room on third floor with PC's and printers) was very handy to use free internet plus also check in and print boarding passes when going home. The area this hotel was in really suited us given most sites, shops etc (Macy's, Grand Central, Chrysler, Times SQ, Central Park, Blooms, Empire) were are within walking distance. We had a great long weekend of weather and walked everywhere. We did not sample any of the hotel food/bar etc so cannot comment on this however there was so much close by it just did not matter. I would say we bumped into one of the room service staff in the lift one night and she did show us the dish, it looked fab and smelled excellent so all looked ok there. To sum up, expensive mid town location however to be expected.
