Location excellent, lobby at let down, very comfortable and plenty of services, may need a wee freshen up in places, all staff very helpfull. Would we go back ?? Possibly but for what we paid, I would look around for all options and consider trying another hotel depending on price and room type. All in all, above average for NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DolceVita_8
Reviews.Content: The Alex is wonderful! From the lovely people at the check in to the beautifully appointed rooms the experience is truly boutique and special. The rooms, while small, are immaculate with the lush Frette linens and wonderful Frederick Fekkai soaps and shampoos in the very chic bathrooms. I highly recommend the Alex as I frequently stay there while in NYC. It is in a great location, convenient to all, but truly best of all is the great service and the welcoming rooms. A boutique hotel in very sense!

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Alex Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendavey
Reviews.Content: We found the Alex to be a good hotel for a week long trip to New York in August. Couldn't fault the hotel or the staff who were without exception friendly and helpful. In hindsight it proved to be a little further away from the hustle and bustle of Broadway and Central Park then we would have ideally liked, but it was certainly within walking distance of most popular areas of interest and very close to Grand Central and the subway. If you want peace and quite, this is a the place for you. Didn't eat at the hotel - but we found a lack of reasonable restaurants in the near vicinity and often walked up to Bryant Park or nearby to eat. Likes - clean rooms, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Disliked - having to pay for internet access in the room. In this day and age this should really be free.

Reviews.Title: “Smart upscale boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anfield_8
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in New York many times on business over the last 10 years The Alex is a real find. Clean, minimalist, with stunning views of the Chrysler Building from the E45th street side ... a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Being slightly offf the track on E45th & 3rd it may not come into the consideration set of most business travellers or holiday makers, but it should, as it is cheaper with bigger rooms than many of its competitior boutique set, Also handy for local delis, diners and smarter restarants. Grand Central is but a few blocks away. The staff are very obliging, friendly and helpful. Ask for a higher floor to minimise Manhattans traffic noise. Book through Hotels.com as the rates are much less than those offered by the hotel. Otherwise another hotel on my New York hit list.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Alex Hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: ronikcohn
Reviews.Content: I just want everyone to know how much we enjoyed staying at The Alex Hotel in Manhattan. The room was perfectly appointed and the staff was delightful. From the front desk receptionist to the valet it was a perfect experience. It is the first time that I stayed in New York and actually loved it! The suite is not a tiny box and contains everything one could possibly need. We loved the location too! It was really easy to get to everything. The Riingo restaurant in the hotel was also outstanding! Please know that this is the first time I felt compelled to write a review! Enjoy! Roni and Lenny Cohn

Reviews.Title: “Great Base In New York & Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: travellad
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 night stay in The Alex a few weeks ago in the Executive Suite and it was excellent. Great sized rooms especially for meetings as the separate lounge is perfect as is the kitchen although having no coffee machine is a pain. No real problem as the diner over the road serves great food at very reasonable prices. Cant remember the name of the diner but if you walk out of the hotel and look over the road to the left it is right there. Staff are great also and if you talk to Alfonso he very helpful. Dont dip into the mini bar though instead opt for the store on the corner about 30 paces from the hotel which has everything you will need. Highly recommend this hotel and although its a bit on the expensive side you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdrath
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent hotel with good rates. We read to ask for a front facing room and that is what we did. We were not disapointed. Really great size... nice style. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Only one complaint with the room... The toilet... Not the bathroom... Specificaly the toilet. The flush button was recessed in the wall and was cumbersome to push. (It looked like the backup flusher on an automatic toilet.) And when you did flush it was VERY loud. But hey... if that is the worst problem... I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and Clean but Lacking Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MariL
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Alex on business while in NYC. This is a good, clean, accessible hotel, however I won't stay here again. Although in a good location it is lacking any form of atmosphere. There is no wireless internet access and you are charged $15 per 24 hours to use a cable? The gym is also pretty old fashioned. The staff were very pleasant, attentive and helpful. However there was constantly people knocking on my door - not allowing me any peace. Trying to give me ice, sort my phone..? None of which I had issues with. I also had to tell 3 cleaners that I had a late check-out. If you want clean, simple with good food then this is your hotel, however if you are looking for peace, comfort or business I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms in the Big Apple...”
Reviews.Author: HLS1974
Reviews.Content: The Alex is in a great location a couple of blocks away from Grand Central Station. The rooms are spacious and light.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrMarkini
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alex on one of the hottest weekends of the summer, and enjoyed it immensely. The rooms are very nice and appropriately sized - what you see on the Web is indeed what you get. Though we got a very good rate off an Internet web site, the level of service and amenities is what you get for 1-200$ more a night - turndown service, for example. The bed was the comfiest platform I've ever slept on; the bathroom was superlative. Had lunch in the restaurant, which was perfectly satisfactory, but not memorable; everything else about the hotel is eminently memorable. The only thing keeping me from making this my 'go to' hotel all the time in NYC is the Murray Hill location is a bit off the beaten path (or my beaten path) -- you're two blocks from the UN and Grand Central, but the trek (in the heat) to midtown is something I'd rather do in spring or fall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseRose
Reviews.Content: I recently took my granddaughter to NYC for her first time and it was her choice to stay at The Alex Hotel. We loved it! The staff could not have been better in any aspect, and took care of each of our needs quickly and efficiently. They graciously upgraded us to a suite and the added space, full kitchen, and spa bathroom were nicely appointed. Starburst candies in the room and warm chocolate chip cookies and milk from room service were also a hit (especially to a 7 year old). We were 2 blocks from Grand Central Station (subway and train service) and from the United Nations, and taxis were readily available to take us where we needed to go. The best part was that it was quiet (a true luxury in NYC) and the room was exceedingly comfortable. This is a boutique hotel and appears to have an international clientele. There is also a very nice organic market just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TriciaRitsema
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from New York and had a wonderful stay in The Alex. The staff are all exremely friendly and helpful and made the visit all the more enjoyable. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (we had a view of the Chrysler Building). We did not eat in the hotel so cant comment on that. But found that Amish Market down the road to have a really noce breakfast. The only negative comment would be that the bathroom was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cambridgeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alex for two nights as part of a business/pleasure trip. Booked a Studio Suite and asked in the booking for a high floor with view of the Chrysler Building. Guess what...I got a room on a high floor (22nd) with a view of the Chrysler Building. Staff are very helpful and accomodating. The room that I had was not bad at all although it is not as expansive as it looks on their website. Overall a decent hotel in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “...it all depends on the room they give you”
Reviews.Author: toomanynights
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a typical boutique hotel... IE: high on style, relatively low oN convenience. First of all, ask for a room facing the FRONT of the building. They are MUCH larger than those facing the back or the "lightwell" (the smallest room I've seen in a long time!). Front desk staff excellent overall. No complaints. Courteous staff. Great "operator" at all times called. Restaurant expensive and a bit full of itself but "pan asian" food well prepared. Room... i had one of the small rooms facing the back, my colleague had one of the large rooms facing the front - same price (!!!) and entirely DIFFERENT experiences. Small room: ridiculously small, poorly laid out, silly bed (I'm only 5'-9" and my feet hung out over the edge!), odd closets / millwork. My colleague's bigger room: the opposite of above... spacious, lovely, great bed, etc. All rooms: excellent bedding. Great pillows. good towels. Bathroom: shower didn't work properly and nobody took care of it over a 3 day stay. Great Frederik Fekkai toiletries though! Some lights in room didn't work. Thermostat completely hidden by a closet unit... impossible to see what temperature you were setting it at. Sticky floor at room entrance upon check-in... not well cleaned. Rooms clean enough though... and I always check bedding, condition of mattress, dust behind bed, etc., and all was A-OK. Very good AV equipment in room. Quiet enough (although larger rooms facing front are noisier). Very good gym for a hotel this size. Lots of equipment and machines. Location is excellent if your business is on Madison avenue / Lex avenue... but so-so if anywhere else (although taxis were relatively easy to find) Room service expensive but incredibly quick (too quick... would have liked to get through my morning shower before the doorbell rang!). AVOID ROOMS ON 3RD FLOOR... NOISY NEXT TO GYM! Overall... not a bad place to stay - but will definitely ask for one of the rooms facing front next stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, with great prices.”
Reviews.Author: bucko_globetrotters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on a business trip during February, having booked it through Expedia where we got an amazing rate (circa £150 per night). For the money, given that hotels in New York can be expensive, this was a bargain. The hotel is nice, with recently decorated contemporary rooms and a boutique feel. Whilst my room was a little cramped, there was still enough space for a king sized bed and sofa, and New York being the city that it is you don't tend to spend much time in your room anyway. The hotel was clean, staff helpful, and breakfast was nice. And the hotel is well located within Midtown, near Grand Central and a steady stream of cabs so getting around is easy enough. Recommended, especially at the price we paid, its possibly unbeatable for value.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful alex”
Reviews.Author: gfgoxford
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently returned from a fabulous shopping trip to New York. We stayed at the Alex in a two bedroomed suite on the 12th floor.A simply fabulous experience.Wonderful room with a great view of the Chrysler Building. Super helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble and the wonderful concierge Bill who heiped us to get tickets for Hairspray. The beds were really comfortable and the linen devine. I thoroughly recommend this hotel,it is a great location for sightseeing(close to subway at Grand Central Station). A must do is brunch at the Comfort Diner opposite the hotel as well as cocktails at the View on the 48th floor of the Marriott Marquis in Times Square. Brooklyn is also worth a visit. Hope we get to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bombayflash
Reviews.Content: What a nice tranquil oasis in mid town manhatten. Stayed in a One bedroom suite for 3 nights. A full kitchen with a sub zero fridge , stove , microwave , plates, spoons etc... Free T1 internet, ( bring a long cable). Wood floors. My only fuss would be the bathroom. It is tiny. 24hr room service ( this is a must for me) Room service was excellent and quick . Got my meals within 15min on three different occcasions. Very friendly staff. Small and quite( this is a must as well) Will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RingadingRingading
Reviews.Content: On a recent weekend trip to NY we stayed at the Alex Hotel at 205 East 45th Street, New York, New York 10017. They were having a special that weekend so the rate was just under $300 a night. I know that may sound pricey but for a high-end hotel in NY it was one of the cheapest we could find. The hotel, located just a few blocks from Grand Central Station, is very modern and elegant. When booking the hotel online, I mentioned that it was my birthday weekend and that we'd love a room on a high floor. Upon check-in, they told us that they had upgraded us from a King room to a Studio suite on the 30th floor FOR FREE. Our room was huge! There was a full kitchen in the room, (not that we ever used it) which seemed like a quite a luxury for NY. The view from our room was incredible, we could actually see the Chrysler building. The staff were super nice and helpful. One might expect to get attitude at a hip hotel in NY but all of the people working there were very friendly. We didn't explore the neighborhood that much since we were often meeting friends in other parts of the city. I found it to be a pretty convenient location however, easy to walk to Times Square or Madison Ave and the subway was just a few blocks away at Grand Central. I would definitely recommend The Alex Hotel for a special getaway to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be something it ain't”
Reviews.Author: pippywee
Reviews.Content: Couple of problems with this hotel. One, it is expensive for what you get anwyay, and the fact that they wouldn't allow us a late check-out (wanted to leave around nine pm) was bad. Don't mind paying something, but they insisted on a full night's cost. Other thing, we were in the bar late with clients and around ten pm asked for something to eat. The kitchen was closed, so nothing -- and no one there suggested the obvious, use the 24 hour room service, but get it delivered to the bar. Shocking customer service really. If you can stretch to it, go to the W, this is trying to be a W but failing.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ant0725
Reviews.Content: Re: a previous reviewers comment on the Studio Suite being the smallest. Absolutely no way! The Studio Suite is one of the larger rooms. I stayed in a standard room. It was small, in my opinion. Just enough room for 2 beds. I got bruises on both legs bumping into the wood bed platform. I've stayed in New York a few times, and much prefer Times Square - so convenient. The Alex employees are great when it comes to service, especially the doormen. Fitness center was nice. There are 3 deli's along the block - which is nice if you're in a suite and can store food. The standard rooms - no way. The first room we stayed in - hard to flush toilet, and 2 lamps bulbs were burnt out. Second room - much better (a suite at twice the price of the first room) , still had 1 lamp burnt out, and items weren't always replaced (dish detergent, kitchen wash rag, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Always like staying at the Alex”
Reviews.Author: jjservices
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Alex and once again really enjoyed my stay. This is not a hotel for everyone..its very modern and location is not as central as other hotels. The staff over all is great..doorman and Bellman make this hotel...Richard--Alberto and Perry are all great, helpful and just nice people. After a week we really felt part of the family. I do not find the front desk staff helpful and they never say hello when going in and out..that is the hotels only downfall. Houskeeping is great and they really clean well and are flexibile with cleaning ours. Rooms are very comfy..as well as beds.Only thing would take off is green wall paper on the closets...its ugly and useless. Bathrooms although not huge are modern and clean..and the flat screen in the bathroom is a nice amenity. I can not comment on the restaurant as never ate there as not a Sushi fan.Amish market across the street is the best

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Rooms, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jeffruddle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alex Hotel for 5 nights over New Year 2007. Don't know what all the comments about small rooms are about as we stayed in the "Studio Suite", apparently the smallest size room and found it more than big enough! Great location just round the corner from grand central station and only 15ish mins walk from Times Square/Broadway/Fifth Avenue. Staff were very pleasent and helpful, hotel was always clean and tidy. Amish market across the road is great for breakfast, good coffee and muffins (can't believe they are fat free as they claim to be) All in all the Alex Hotel contributed to a fantatic few days in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex”
Reviews.Author: DZA_A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August. My husband and I were traveling with our son who was 8 at the time, so we booked a 1 bedroom suite. We arrived at the hotel and were very pleasantly greeted by the outstanding doormen who very quickly unloaded our luggage and made sure we didn't have to do anything but make our way to the front desk. Which we did, only to be greeted by incredibly, enthusiastically friendly staff at the front desk. (It was a breath of fresh air after spending 3 and a half weeks in Italy where 'great' 5 star service doesn't even come close to that of the USA). We were given an upgrade to a 2 bedroom 2 bath suite plus breakfast thrown in. A very nice surprise. They told us where local restaurants and shops were located and offered to make a dinner reservation for us at any restaurant we would like. The staff were all very very friendly. All of the housekeeping staff to the elevator assistant, front desk, doormen and the Town-car drivers that the doormen organize. The front desk staff greeted us by name every time they saw us. They organized tickets for us at the last minute on a show that was sold out. The concierge was great and extremely helpful. As was Mel (Melanie??) at the front desk. Really lovely and always very friendly. The room was fantastic. The beds were incredibly comfortable. The main bathroom, located in the main bedroom, was large and very roomy (yes, the shower was tricky and cut out a couple of times mid rinsing hair, annoying, but you get over that, just turn it back on). The 2nd bathroom was smaller, and looked like the photos on the website as well as other reviewers photos. We never once ran out of towels as others complained about. In fact, we had 2 showers a day and still never got thru all the towels provided. We could see the Chrysler building from every window in the room (both bedrooms and the kitchen and living area). The room was certainly roomy enough for the 3 of us. I would not say it was "sumptuous" luxury, but it was modern luxury and very comfortable. If you are looking for a grand, stately hotel, this is not the place for you. But if you want a modern and sleek hotel with it's own personality and flare, this is a great place. It is comfortable, you don't feel like you have to 'wear a tie' to breakfast, but, due to the price tag, the hotel maintains a higher standard of clientele. Liked having the kitchen. We didn't cook of course, but we stocked up on fruit and snacks at the Amish Market down the street. It's a FANTASTIC gourmet deli. We actually shopped there a few times. We had a coffee maker/pot in our room from memory. Other reviewers complained of walls being paper thin, but we did not once hear our neighbors. One day we stopped back into our room at about 2pm to drop off shopping bags and to make a snack and I did hear a phone ringing and ringing. It was a little annoying so I walked out into the hallway to see if I could determine what room it was coming from and found it was actually the hallway/corridor house phone ringing. So, I just answered it. Turned out, it was housekeeping, looking for another housekeeping staff member whom she thought was on that floor. She was very apologetic and by the sound of her voice, absolutely mortified that a guest answered the phone. It stopped ringing after that. Others also complained that hotel staff, housekeeping etc use the elevators, which is true, but we found that if a staff member was waiting for the elevator and we walked up, they ALWAYS insisted that WE take the elevator and they would wait for the next round. They would not ride with us, as they didn't want to make us uncomfortable. A couple times though, we insisted they ride with us. We had breakfast at Ringo's daily. The first day for breakfast we had a waiter that was obviously having a bad day. He was very preoccupied and didn't give a rats about serving us. We were kind to him regardless, and the next day he was like a different person. Very very friendly, gave our son a hot chocolate (on the house, as it was not included in the free breakfast). I think he may have recognized that the day before he had been a little grumpy. He remembered what we ordered the day before and for the remainder of our stay we almost didn't have to give our orders, he remembered. One note though, we tried one morning to eat in the area outside. We could not do it, ended up moving back indoors. The sounds of New York are great, but not during breakfast. It was very noisy with the sound of traffic, horns, big trucks and also, NOT something you want to do when it is rubbish/trash collection day. The smell was a little overwhelming. The location is good, it is in a commercial area. The only better place to stay in terms of a 'nicer' location in our opinion is the upper east side which is more of an upmarket, quiet residential area. Alternatively, if you like a trendy, hip location, then Soho might be it. Great place. Would definitely stay there again. In fact, look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “the alex was great!!”
Reviews.Author: mikenpaula
Reviews.Content: We have mostly all good to say about the alex. The only complaint we had is they forgot to give us our wake up call which made us rush around like lunatics so that we could check out in time. The room was wonderful. A king bedroom suite.Seperate living room area with dining table and a full kitchen. Very nice. Three flat screens in the room. One in the bedroom, living room & bathroom. Wonderful rainfall shower. Comfy bed. Just really great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren83
Reviews.Content: We went to New York last year as a xmas treat and after seeing how run down some of the hotels are we decided to take no chances!! The Alex is a gorgeous hotel, its so modern yet cosy. Yes its a bit compact but we are in New York city!! The bed was to die for as was the views!! We could see the Crysler building in clear veiw from our window and it was an amazing sight to wake up too!! The bathroom was lovely!! A huge deep lime stone bath which is a fab treat to soak in after a busy day!! Not to mention the rain fall shower and all the freebies. The room was kept spotless and the fresh orchids really set it off alongside the flat screen tvs!! Even one in the bathroom which made my fiances day!! The room was so quiet it was hard to believe we was in New York!! There is also a selection of sweets in the room you can buy and a mini bar stocked full!! We love the Alex it made our stay magical!!! Would return in a instant!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Julesee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. I found the hotel build tinny so you could hear a lot that was happening in the building. Personally I'm not too keen on the modern furnishings - there was a cheapness about them. Not bad, but not great either....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Alex!!!”
Reviews.Author: Baldwingirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two wonderful nights at the Alex. The staff was warm and helpful and we were extremely comfortable. We had a one-bedroom suite and it was a soothing oasis from the city. The bathroom was a bit compact, but well-designed, and we loved the rain shower and flat-screen tv. The location was very central for our weekend plans and nothing was more than a $12 cab ride away. I was surprised to read a complaint about noise, as our room was very quiet. The bed was one of the best hotel beds we have ever slept in and the room service food was delicious and prompt. My husband gobbled the Dean and Deluca truffle candies and declared them worth the price. I loved the Fekkai amenities and the mat and slippers laid out bedside each night. We are luxury hotel junkies and very picky and we could not find fault with anything... would definitely recommend and we will return! It's a special place.

Reviews.Title: “The Alex Hotel: Great room, great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mickah_Wallace
Reviews.Content: The location is superb for some of the best steakhouses (Smith & Wollensky's / Sparks) not to mention a few superb Chinese restaurants (Chin Chin / Tse Yang's). It’s close to Grand Central and a couple of blocks from 5th Ave (approx 20 minute walk to Central Park). Check out the Amish market across the street - it's excellent. It’s also very quiet, unlike some of the hotels that little bit further west. We stayed in a studio (junior) suite. My only criticism of the room was that the bed could have been a little bigger. I'm 6ft plus and felt the bed to be a little on the small side. However, it was extremely comfortable. Other than that, the room was faultless and we had a fantastic view of the Chrysler building. We booked on Expedia and requested a room with a view, so thanks very much for accommodating us. Having the kitchen (fridge etc) gave us additional flexibility and the seating area was comfortable. Having a television in the bathroom was a nice touch! Some nice Frederik Fekkai toilettries for the wife. Mini bar was well stocked, if a little overpriced (I'm sure The Alex isn't the only hotel that does this). Likewise the Dean & Deluca snack tray! Oh, and don't even think about using the phone. A 5 minute call to a UK landline on a Saturday afternoon = $47! Yikes!! As said above, though, I am sure The Alex isn't the only hotel that does this so buy a phone card and use a payphone....

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: neilburns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading many positive reviews - how misguided was I! This place has unfriendly and unhelpful staff, paper thin walls mean you hear your neighbours every move and it would have been quicker to walk than use the lift as it took forever - mainly due to the fact that the cleaners and other staff used them and held them on floors while working! Not worth the visit to be honest and you'd be better spening your money and staying in one of the 'chain' hotels such as hilton, westin, farimont...

Reviews.Title: “A web site Con! This place is Cramped, ordinary, in a busy dirty street”
Reviews.Author: skibuff1
Reviews.Content: This is a web site con! A genius web photographer makes it look like an "Uber Cool " hotel. It is nothing of the sort , and how the reviews that praise it come to their praise worthy conclusion is beyond me. The hotel is very cramped, and the photos of an out door terrace turn out to be a few pavement chairs on a grubby dirty street. The lobby is miniscule, and the rooms are ok, but not designer status as they allude to. Other reviewers comment on its proximity to United Nations Building - So what - ? Why would you stay here just because of that? Likewise its proximity to Grand Central Staion,- Unless you want to take a train to get away from the place- understandable- what is the special about that either?? In short the location is in a not particularly clean, nice, nor fashionable part of Manhattan, The bar is ordinary, Breakfast is served in the bar - at tables that are too small, the patio is a street pavement - the bedrooms are dull, and the place is Naff. Try Chambers , off 5th Avenue, Morgans, or many otyhers for a decent experience..

Reviews.Title: “The Alex is Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingmaniacNy
Reviews.Content: I didn't know that to expect from a Leding Hotel that has such a modern decor, but we loved it! The food was delicious and the staff at the hotel were friendly and extra accomodating. Not to mention that the room made me feel at home, they have a living room and a kitchen, and they are super clean! I definetely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: England_1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Alex with my wife and six year old son, we also got upgraded to a 1 bed suite with a good view of the Chrysler building and complete kitchen and lounge / dining area (useful because there is a great Amish Deli just across the street). All the staff (including those at Ringo's) were really friendly and cheerful, I couldn't praise them enough. The hotel is on East 45th street about a 10 minute walk from the UN building in one direction and Grand Central station in the other, it's very cool and stylish throughout but still very welcoming. We all loved New York and are returning in December, I would definetely recommend The Alex.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JonMoss
Reviews.Content: The "nightmare" of getting a good, and reasonable hotel in NY surfaced once again. After consulting Tripadvisor and looking at a number of hotels, I chose the Hotel Alex - good reviews, good location (5 minutes walk from Grand Central Station) in Midtown and not TOO expensive, but hey, we are in NY, right? After flying into Newark (would go to JFK next time as I have done previously - and if you can afford it, use US Helicopters to fly straight to Manhattan = awesome!), it was on the train and then a taxi to the Hotel Alex. Impressions were immediately excellent after being greeted with those wonderful words - "Mr Moss, we have a beautiful upgrade for you". I am nobody special and did not ask nor expect this, but it was very welcome. The staff were friendly and efficient, and to be honest, this was my experience throughout my 4 day stay. My room, a King suite was clean, huge and well appointed. No view but did I say it was big?! I had a kitchen area, lounge, bathroom and bedroom. Excellent beds and Frette linen, reasonably fast internet access (a must for me) but no wireless in the rooms themselves (there is in the lobby/lounge). I had an American breakfast thrown in as part of my deal and I had this on two occasions - very nice, seemed very fresh and one day I rocked up with minutes to spare and they accommodated me with a smile. Beyonce's entourage was also staying whilst I was there, so if they were there, then hey, who am I to complain?! Finally, I was granted a late check out with not too much hassle, and they booked a car for me to go to the airport. So, in review: - a stylish, cool and well appointed hotel - friendly staff who really were very helpful - top location - Grand Central in 5 minutes and another subway about 10 minutes away. Would I stay there again? Yes I would, I had a great time and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bistro Hotel Bust”
Reviews.Author: darlinbeck
Reviews.Content: The Alex is located in Mid-town at 205 E. 45th St. Don't be fooled by the on-line picture of the lobby. In actuality, it is very small and crowded. There is hardly passing room between the desk and the elevators. The rooms are pleasantly arranged but my daughter and I had the feeling we were suspended in some sort of IKEA or Pottery Barn ad. Everything is modular. I suppose that's to give it a trendy look. There are flat screen TVs in the bedroom and bath, if you can figure out how to use the 3 remote controls on the one in the bedroom. Good luck in getting the shower to come on even with the written instructions that were provided. Why should you have to provide instructions for turning on the shower? One of the phones did not work and they had to supply you with cables if you wanted to use your computer. We never received ice in the evening turn-down as stated in the brochure and it was nowhere to be found on the floor. My main complaint was the total lack of soundproofing. I could hear the phone ringing in the adjacent room as well as conversations. The staff were nice and friendly and the concierge was helpful. They do have a restaurant and bar with sidewalk seating which we did not patronize. The staff was very helpful in arranging for cars and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: ALYsandiego
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and great service. My family was traveling through NYC and we chose The Alex Hotel based on many positive reviews on this and other sites. We found hotel to be clean and comfortable, as we would expect from a 4 star establishment. What was really impressive, was willingness of the front desk staff to put extra effort in order to accommodate my family's requests. A++ service. Than you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, will definitely go back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle55
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Alex from May 17-20, 2007. After reading some of the reviews posted on here I was a little worried that it may not be a great choice but we booked anyway. All I have to say is that anyone who posts a negative review of this hotel is obviously someone who is VERY hard to please. I have no complaints whatsoever. The staff was exceptionally friendly and even went out of their way several times to assist us with things such as booking a show, tour. The doormen were pleasant and so were the cleaning staff. We had absolutely no complaints with the room as well. We stayed in a studio suite and there was more than enough room for us. We had a kitchen which came in handy, a seating area, an LCD flat screen in the room as well as another LCD in the washroom. We had no problems with the water, our rooms were cleaned everyday and we had more than enough towels. We used their business centre a few times and they have free internet access as well as a printer. My boyfriend used the gym everyday and it was a great looking gym with updated equipment, and televisions on all of the cardio machines. As well, there was fresh lemonade and fresh fruits available to the patrons of the gym. All in all, it was a great hotel and we would definitely go back. We were impressed and as I indicated above, you can't please everyone but the people who have posted negative reviews on this hotel obviously either had a bad day or are people who obviously will never be happy with any place they stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In NYC”
Reviews.Author: PSTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom suite on expedia.com. When we arrived the bellmen and front desk personnel were all very friendly and helpful. Our request for a high floor was given. The room was perfect for us. Modern, comfortable, small kitchen, small living area, two bedrooms and two bathrooms. We had a view of NYC and the Chrysler bldg. The hotel was very quiet and clean. The location was great for us - close enough to walk to theater district but far away from touristy times square. The subway was close as well. The bedrooms are a little on the small side but the overall room was large for NYC. We can't say enough good things about the Alex - comfortable, quiet, good location, friendly staff, modern and clean. A good value for the price we paid on expedia. We travel to NYC often and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great actually...”
Reviews.Author: zippycat57
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to go to another hotel but it was full, so we booked this one 'blind' via Expedia - and after reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor and Expedia. All in all we were very happy with the Alex - room was a good size, nice comfy bed with lovely bedding, good kitchen (large fridge, microwave, cooker hob, dishwasher) and bathroom (flat screen TV, nice fluffy towels, nice toiletries), and flat screen TV and sofa in the bedroom. However, there are some downsides. There's no coffeemaker or kettle.... though there is a large saucepan you can use to boil water. No mugs, but teacups. We asked for a coffeemaker and were told no, there wasn't one available, we'd have to use room service. Room service was of course very expensive... we reckoned about 12 dollars for 2 coffees. The Comfort Diner over the road was excellent, with delicious food, large portions (by English standards!) and very reasonably-priced - about 30 dollars for breakfast for 2, including tip. Other downsides to the Alex - room was a bit hot despite the AC, shower difficult to use but very good, no shower cap. Well-stocked minibar, plus chocolates etc, but very expensive. We found the staff to be friendly and courteous BUT we didn't ask them any questions. Check-in and check-out very speedy. Great location, close to Grand Central where you can get a NY Airport Service bus to JFK for 15 dollars per person, runs every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Small and very overrated...”
Reviews.Author: cancercaregiver
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews - so I won't go on and on about how small and strange this hotel is. We went to NYC for 4 nights for the Auto Show. We were booked in a "deluxe 2 bedroom suite" for $675 a night. We were extremely disappointed with the room. The bedrooms were almost too small for 2 adults to walk around at the same time. Bathroom tub constantly flooded and we ran out of towels every day. Frederic Frekkai products were a nice touch but not worth the extra money. Furniture was extremely modern and uncomfortable. The L-shaped "couch" in the living room was 2 small for my 2 boys to sit on and stretch out together on. It was low and felt like a bench with a pad on it. Room service was outrageously expensive - $221.00 for dinner for 2 adults and 2 kids. Some of the food was just terrible. We got chinese takeout a couple nights and stocked up on snacks and drinks at the nearby Duane store. The refridgerator in the kitchen was filled with "mini bar" items - $4.00 for a 10 oz. bottle of coke. Kitchen was sort of useless as it didn't have a coffee maker, or kettle...nice with the microwave though. Front desk and doorman were basically useless as well. They had no idea how to get ANYWHERE. It was very frustrating to say the least. They answered "I don't know" to almost every question. I had to get on my laptop to get directions to local attractions and restaurants. Not helpful at all. The front desk staff acted like a chatty bunch of high schoolers and would blatantly ingnore customers while they chatted about plans for the night, their ailments, etc. They all need to be retrained in "service" skills if they hope to make this hotel a top hotel. Out of all the hotels that you can choose from in the city - I would choose a Courtyard or Embassy Suites over this. Half the price and better, more functional, rooms. Housekeeping did not clean our room for 2 out of the 4 days that we were there. Were rude when we needed to request bedding and towels. All in all it was a very expensive disaster. Don't be fooled by the website photos - the rooms are SMALL. The only good thing about this hotel, in my opinion, was the view from the large windows.

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: BrWo
Reviews.Content: First of all, give a bg bonus to whoever did the website photos of the rooms--they are true artists! The spaces--including our deluxe one bedroom suite--are very compact. The bathroom, in partricular, to anyone except a single man with a toiletry bag! One sink, no counter, no space. Bad planning. The bedroom is fien but very dark--and a makeup mirror is provided but no place to set it up or plug it in. The worst problem? The staff are not ready fro prime time. They laugh and talk to each other at the front deask, but pay little attention to guests. They did not know the addresses of major NYC restaurants, could not get a cab, were unresponsive. Even a Holiday Inn could remove feather pillows with less than 4 phone calls--or bring wash clothes without three calls. Also, a kitchen is great--one without a toaster, kettle or coffee maker is useless!

Reviews.Title: “no hot water...no towels”
Reviews.Author: nigamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alex for a Friday/Saturday night in Manhattan. We had fine service when we checked in...friendly as you would expect. Our room was tiny..but I expected that in the city. However, I didn't expect the following: 1) beat up furniture 2) no washclothes or hand towels in the bathroom 3) shower that didn't drain...flooding bathroom 4) no counter in bathroom at all...no place to plug in hair dryer, etc. 5) no hot water on Sunday morning when went to take a shower Overall - very disappointed in the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms & terrible service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ms711
Reviews.Content: $400 for a room as big as my closet! We stayed here for one night this weekend on our way back from a wedding in CT. Can I say that I was completely disappointed from the moment I walked in. First, the front desk (Melinda or Melissa) didn't bother to look up from the desk while she asked me for my license. Afterwards, had the nerve to ask me if me and my brother needed seperate beds! No, he is not my brother he is my husband, She would have recoginzed this if she looked up from her computer for one second to take a look at us! She did not even apologize! What a [--]! She just chuckled and went on checking me in like nothing happenned! I was clearly annoyed and became more annoyed when I realized that I was paying $400 for a tiny box with Frette sheets and Fredrick Fekkai shampoo with a blow dryer that doesn't work. Worst of all I asked the front desk, (another genius) directions to Little Italy, she sent me to Brooklyn!!! By the way the N doesn't go to Grand Ave, PLEASE TAKE NOTE!!!! Clearly exhausted and utterly disappointed I will never recommend this hotel to anyone in California!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and a WONDERFUL Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly530
Reviews.Content: This is long overdue as I stayed there a year ago, but it left such a wonderful impression that I just had to review it as soon as I signed onto TripAdvisor! My boyfriend and I spent one night at the Alex Hotel - New Year's Day. When we arrived and checked in, the staff could not have been nicer! Even though we were there early they let us check in AND they upgraded us to a suite at no additional charge! We were thrilled. They offered to help us arrange dinner plans (we already had them) and provided us with a map of the NYC area, along with recommendations. Our room had an amazing view - we were on the 26th floor of the hotel and the snapshot of the Chrysler Building was taken from our bedroom. The living room afforded the same spectacular view, and we felt like we were living it up the entire time we were there! They even put little Starburst candies on the plates in the dining room - a funky but memorable touch. The bedroom was comfortable and we had a flat-screen television in our room. The bathroom was so clean, which makes me very happy when I'm in a hotel! It also had a smaller flat-screen television, which was great to have on while I was getting ready. There was another flat screen television in our living room - a very high tech room! The hotel is conveniently located near so many attractions - we walked to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and the Empire State Building in our afternoon. It goes without saying that, at the holidays, one MUST stop by and see Rockefeller Center - it was absolutely magical! Cabs were in abundance, obviously, and we never had a problem getting one to go to dinner, the bars, or up to Central Park. I only wish we'd had more than one day there. Also, as an aside - if you're in NYC for a romantic weekend, I'd highly recommend dinner at Tavern on the Green. It costs an arm and a leg, but my boyfriend and I went there and had the most wonderful time. The food was quite good (which was a pleasant surprise, since I'd heard it was mediocre) and I've never experienced a more romantic environment. My boyfriend somehow got us hooked up with a private tour of the facility by the Maitre D', so we learned the history of the restaurant and saw all six dining rooms. Like I said - it cost an arm and a leg, but it is worth it as we still talk about our quick getaway to New York and I often refer to it as my "Bachelor Dream Date" because I felt like our time in NYC was something I'd have seen on "The Bachelor." Loved the Alex and wouldn't stay anyplace else when I go back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the doormen”
Reviews.Author: Annoula68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alex for 4 nights at the beginnging of March 2007. Check in was awful - they had written the dates wrongly in their reservation system (my confirmation had the right dates on) but the, rather superior young receptionist, kept insisting my information was wrong - until she looked at their paper records and found out they were wrong. No apology and it took almost 30 mins to sort out - not what you expect from a 5 star hotel. I arrived early so not many rooms available. I was on the 4th floor - facing 45th st, so lots of traffic noise, but if you looked up you could get some idea of a view. Bed comfortable but if you were expecting to work whils the internet connection was good (and in room 404 you can pick up the wifi), there is no real desk space. Room suprisingly large by NYC standards, though bathroom was compact. Shower not so easy to operate, but great once it did. Walls are very thin however and so I knew whenever my neighbours had their tv on or were using the shower. Now getting to the title of this review - all the bell hops and doormen were great - friendly and helpful -and 2 of them stood outside for ages in the snow to make sure I got a cab when I had to leave. I guess I would go back to the hotel again, but for the price I paid there are other hotels equally as good if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex!”
Reviews.Author: adkhills
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there First weekend in March, great location, extremely friendly staff, delicious sushi!!!! The room we had was small but very well appointed. No traffic noise!!!! Overall terrific place and I would recommend staying at this lovely boutique hotel. Booked through ---.com which is a split off of expedia and got a great price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect NYC hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JPAngel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Alex for 3 nights at the end of Feb/beginning of March, and we both thought it was brilliant! Ok, so in the UK were not used to the extremely friendly levels of service, but every single member of staff I met - from doormen and receptionists, to cleaners and concierges - were so very welcoming, almost unbelievably so! Nothing was too much to ask and all were glad to chat and help in any way that they could. We had a suite on one of the higher floors, with its own immaculate kitchen, and whilst the view wasn't great and the air-con needed to be a degree or 2 lower, I can't really have any complaints at all. The bathroom (especially the shower) was fantastic, the bed comfortable, the space was more than adequate and the tv just enormous. There's a couple of stores just at the end of the street on 3rd, which we used to buy provisions, meaning we didn't have to resort to the room service/mini-bar. That said, the mini-bar was very well stocked and not grossly over priced. The location is also pretty good - we walked from downtown one day, and up to central park on another (both trips took about about hour), but taxis were plentiful and Grand Central is no more than 10mins away. A good bar is PJ Clarke's on the corner of 3rd and 55th (15mins walk) or for a good steak try Bar Americain on West 52nd ($10 in a taxi). 5th and Times Square are only about 25mins away on foot. I'll be recommending The Alex to anyone I know going to New York for a short stay, and if you can avoid booking until about 2 weeks before you go then Expedia were offering 20% off....

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to really enjoy NYC”
Reviews.Author: mspiddles
Reviews.Content: The Alex Hotel was a really good experience. The hotel was clean , The room was beautiful with Down pillows on the bed. The bedding was clean and housekeeping did bring extra pillows. The bed was very comfortable. They have a great room service menu. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is located close to shopping . Also the gym was nice. Updated equipment. I had a nice stay. It is expensive , but it is so nice to treat yourself sometimes to a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “With all the choices in NYC, I'm glad I made this choice”
Reviews.Author: MRS_MMB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last minute booking for me. I canceled another reservation for New Years Eve and luckily The Alex had a room available. I was extremely happy with this choice. There are so many hotels in NYC to pick, they all claim to have excellent customer service, etc, etc... this hotel delivers on all fronts. My main concerns in a hotel room are cleanliness, comfort, and high speed wireless internet (complimentary) and this hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly, helpful, and very knowledgeable on the area which was great considering this was only my second visit to NYC. The room didn't have a great view, but I wasn't really expecting that on New Year's Eve with a last minute booking but I did have a decent view. The only drawback to this area is that it's not convenient to subways and to catch a cab you either need to get the concierge to do it (which they do quickly with a tip of course), or head a few yards to 3rd Avenue. Bus stops aren't far, but it's not really my preferred method of travel. It is not a far walk to Times Square or theaters or 5th Ave shopping, about a mile for each but it was raining when we arrived so we chose a cab. The room was wonderful and tastefully decorated, bathroom was well done although a tad small (you can only enter tub from one side and it's awkward to adjust the water temp or stop the drain) but all is forgiven when you get in the most excellent rainfall shower. All necessities were in mini kitchen including fridge, freezer, stove, microwave, and cooking utensils in the off chance you want to cook instead of go to a fabulous NYC restaurant. The beds are super comfortable, down comforters, and nice sheets - I slept well and didn't feel the compelling need as I usually do to check every inch of the sheets - they were obviously clean and new. There is also a desk in case you need to work and flat screen TV's (one in the bathroom as well) are great with DVD player included if you happen to pick up any movies in Chinatown ;-). The room was larger than I expected, larger than any in this price range I've toured while "interviewing" other hotels. Overall I was very satisfied and would stay again... and probably will on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Prettyshoes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Alex for 6 nights over Christmas. We were booked into a Delux non-smoking but asked to change to a smoking so we were upgraded to a one bed suite, unlike British hotels who tend to down-grade you if you require a smoking room. The room was gorgeous, huge comfy bed, 3 TV's, 4 telephones, lovely toiletries. We had a balcony and a view of The Chrysler Building from our Kitchen window. The shower was pretty hard to work as it kept cutting out but it was a small price to pay for such a lovely hotel. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The refreshments in the room were overpriced, as are any hotel but, with a huge fridge and microwave and a supermarket nearby you didn't need to eat/drink anything from the room. We didn't have a meal in the hotel but then we didn't go to New York for Christmas to spend all our time in one place. There was a decent diner about 5 minutes walk up the road to get the day started and everywhere was within walking distance. It was a lovely holiday in a top class hotel and we would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the alex in December 2006”
Reviews.Author: cmorgan1000
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four-night stay at the Alex. I really enjoyed this hotel. I was traveling on business, and stayed in one of their suites on the 18th floor, with a balcony and a view of the Chrysler building. Nice and quiet bedroom and ample space in the adjoining room to get work done (also has a fridge/stove, etc. if you want to bring food in). The only thing that was funky was the few accessible outlets for plugging in blackberries, cell phones, etc. I found myself plugging my phone into the bathroom outlet (nothing was accessible in the bedroom area). Also, the sink/shower layout in the bathroom is weird - the sink is in the way of you stepping into the shower. Finally, I would avoid the restaurant in the hotel - pricey and not great. Try Dona restaurant nearby (East 51st, or somewhere in that range). The food there was excellent and less expensive than the Alex's restaurant Riingo. Other than that, this was a great place to stay, and because it's not right on Lexington, it's nice and quiet. I will definitely stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “This is not what you want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveslibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alex Hotel in NYC for a Saturday night with my college friends and their husbands. We were looking for a small, fun, hotel with nice service as we all travel and some of us practically live in hotels because of business. We live just outside of NYC and arrived first around 12:30, dropped off our bags and went to meet our friends. Since we couldn't check in until 4PM, they held our bags and we were told that our bags would be in our room after 4. We came back to the Alex around 5, stopped in the bar for a drink and encountered our first problem with the service. They had run out of the house wine and refused to open another bottle..we were told we could buy a full bottle of something else, but we could not order a glass of house wine. The waitress was very sweet and managed to get them to serve a substitute wine. The second problem was that our luggage had never been sent to our room and we had to wait 20 minutes more for our bags after they had been sitting around all day. We had to rush to get ready and this almost made us late for our dinner reservation. As we left for the evening, the doorman led us to a waiting car which took us uptown 40 blocks to the tune of $50. This was our own fault for not asking but the hotel was certainly not looking out for us as they really steered us to this "service". The final blow came upon checkout when we had to lug our bags to our car because no one was around to help us. Was it all worth it? Well, if you only are looking for good quality sheets, comfortable beds, cool electronics and good shower products then this is the hotel for you! It's small, has an attitude, and fell very short on service. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnyUK
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with the studio room, and the staff were very friendly. Would stay again, if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “A week in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Cara
Reviews.Content: My company put my partner and I up at the Alex for a week. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite on the 16th floor. The suite was great, although there were some "flaws". There was not a lot of dresser space. Although their was a lot of closet space. One of the closet doors would not close due to being to close to the wall. Loved the room, Loved the big bathroom, loved the maid service and over all staff. Was not so fond of the front desk staff. One major draw back was that they wanted to put a 5,000 hold on my credit card. When I told them my co. was picking up every thing, they said they would not put a charge on my card. When I did check out, I found that they had put a 4,000 hold on my card. They did not seem to care to much about it when I asked them about it. I would only stay there again if my co was paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home in a big city”
Reviews.Author: naladoodle
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to The Alex (the first was in March 06). The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel is very clean and very modern. On both of our stays we choose the 2 bedroom suite which has a wonderful view, plenty of space for 4 people with a full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. If there is anything you desire, everyone from the front desk to the doormen will jump to make it happen. The bar is a great spot for pre-dinner drinks. The restaurant is not something I would do again but the bar appertizers were wonderful. This hotel is a bit off the regular path of tourists but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Alex!”
Reviews.Author: Qubana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Alex. The staff was so friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was spacious (very difficult to find in NY city) and it was also very clean and modern. It's located about 2 blocks from Grand Central Station where it was very easy to catch the subway. Also, it's within walking distance to lots of great shopping and restaurants. We can't wait to go back to the Alex! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Alex- great sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: skidog88
Reviews.Content: After an exhausting search of NYC hotels, I decided to try something new having always stayed at The Benjamin,The Carlyle and The Plaza( no longer an option). The Alex is none of these. It is at best a 3-4 star hotel in a 2-3 star neigborhood , with not much going on. The hotel itself was fine, the rooms were more than adequate for NYC. The suite was large and very quiet. The best part of my stay was the size of the 1BR suite with the living room and bedroom being seperate. A great set up for someone travelling with a child or teenager. I never heard the NYC street noise or the tv from the LR. I would agree with one other review in that the hotel is not set up for business travel. There is no wireless in the rooms (absurd in 2006) so you have to go to the small lobby. Lights were not adequate to do work and 2 bulbs were out. Not set up for business. Not a magazine in sight either. I loved the kithcen with full size frig, ice maker and stove. No coffee maker but I called housekeeping and they brought one right up. Beds were to die for. AC did not cool the rooms enough. The hotel staff seemed self indulgent at times , but overall ok. Not very helpful so I was glad to be familiar with the city. On a positive, they were able to honor my late check out time which was very helpful. Sam, the doorman was the nicest guy -5 stars for him! The front desk said they were careful about security but I passed through the lobby and upstairs without any ?'s at all times. I was hoping they would ask for my key as I had a teenage daughter with me and wanted tighter security. Anyone could go up the elevators. Overall a good choice for location and room size. Would I stay here again, maybe. It is a hotel trying to be hip but has long way to go for the prices they charge. If you can get a 1 BR suite for under $350, go for it. Forget the regular rooms. For NYC, The Alex can be a good deal for size of rooms, kitchen and location to Times Sq without the noise.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BHTexas
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel. In hotel food and drinks are very pricey. But there are plently of resturants, Deli's and Bars within 1 block in any direction. The Alex is very nice and quiet. Bed's are very comfortable. We had 3 flat screen TV's in our 1 bedroom suite. Very Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: liborman
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights in a one bedroom suite in the Alex Hotel. This hotel had a good location, with proximity to all of my meetings, but really disappointed me interms of service and amenities. For $600/night, I would expect that I could open the bathroom door without hitting the toilet! The room was not functional at all for work- the internet connection was across the room from the only usable table, and the "desk" space barely had room for a pad and a calculator. Several of the light bulbs were out, the paint was chipped all over, and the mirror was cracked. Additionally, the staff seemed more concerned with their own activities than with taking care of the guests. This hotel is a member of LHW, but really doesn't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Well Designed but Nothin Special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very hip looking. A gorgeous but tiny bar area in the lobby, the food was delicious and the staff was very professional and helpful. Now the nitty gritty. There are LCD TVs in the rooms BUT, the software that they have running on them to support pay-per-view movies and surfing the internet was buggy, crashed on me, and doesn't allow rewinding the movie I paid for. Then, and maybe I'm asking too much but, it was April and the evenings were warm - however, the hotel didn't have the air cond turned on. So I opened my window, but at 6am, the street noise became extreme with jackhammering, etc. My 2c.

Reviews.Title: “Alex...overall a great hotel...with weird quirks”
Reviews.Author: ashbyelkins
Reviews.Content: By far, this was THE fanciest and most expensive hotel room that I have ever, and probably WILL ever stay in. We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite on one of the upper floors. I was staying with a VERY nit-picky guest... but I, mostly, enjoyed the Alex and it's great location to the Grand Central Terminal. The suite had magnificent floor to ceiling windows on two FULL walls...that had a FabULous view of the Chrysler building. Also, after reading several reviews about the upper floors of the hotel...I am now realizing that it WAS extrememly QUIET for NYC... The suite also had a small kitchen with a fridge, but the ice maker didn't work (as with many other guests that have reviewed the hotel). The decor was simple and comtemportary, and felt calming and clean. I adored the clean frette linens on the beds...and lush robes in the bathroom. The one complaint I have...which is incredibly bizzarre, but quite explains a lot about how we were treated at The Alex during our stay... In the room there was a checkerboard/ottoman. However, NO checkers. So, we called the front desk to inquire about where to find them...and (here's the weird part)... In our $620/night room (more than my MONTHLY rent), you had to Pay A $30.00 DEPOSIT IN ORDER TO CHECK OUT CHECKERS FROM THE FRONT DESK!... No, the checkers were not made of gold...they were just plain old checkers. Weird. A little too penny-pinchy in bizzarre areas of running a hotel...SUPER pricey drinks and snacks (ie 10.00 bottle of Evian), a 30.00 deposit on a box of checkers...etc. Overall: Great hotel...weird personality quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but not worth the cash!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I write this review actually sitting in my hotel room on my last night in New York city before heading home to the United Kingdom. Some would say this is quite sad - surely I should be out enjoying my last night in the Big Apple. If I thought it possible, I would. Now, as this is a hotel review, I'll start with that first. The Alex Hotel is located just off 3rd Avenue on East 45th Street, about 10 minutes walk from Grand Central Station. An ideal location for exploring Manhattan. However, the hotel has failed to live up to my expectations. Ever since arriving, I've been made to feel like a second-class guest. Placed on one of the lower floors at the front of the hotel, I experience all the noise and bustle of 45th street, including noise from the office block opposite the hotel which has a shredding lorry pick up their paper - at 1am every morning - and shred their paper!! You would think that this is a common occurence and an apology would be forthcoming - hah!, you should be so lucky. The room itself is OK, but lacks certain things that a business man in NY needs - like a desk. All the furniture is modular and "trendy", meaning that there is no real space to work. In addition, the wallpaper is peeling off the wall and the furniture is stained with God knows what. Finally, the price of food and drink at the hotel is a disgrace. A beer costs $9 (£6) and a two course meal with water set me back $90 (£60). Without wanting to labour the point too much, The Alex has a great location, but service and atmosphere, like New York city itself, is sterile, unfriendly and stale.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex”
Reviews.Author: rbeneke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. There are fresh orchid flowers floating in water in each room. My room had two flat screen TVs, one in the main room and one small one in the bathroom. The bath products are amazing, and the sheets on the bed were to die for. The bedding is all white clean cotton and there is no ugly bedspread that you need to pull back. The staff was very attentive and helpful, helping me with my luggage and walking me up to my room. For a New York City boutique hotel the room was quite large. I was very pleased with the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money! BAD service! Read below!”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluvpets
Reviews.Content: The place looks nice. The rooms are on the smaller side. It looks like IKEA was thier decorator! the staff and service was horrible- a nightmare! We went out at night to find someone had come in our room and drank half of one of the waters they charge for and stole the cashews and gummy bears. Then while I was shaving the next night I cut myself very badly with the razor they gave me and I called screaming and crying for bandages. It took me and my fiancé 4 calls before they came up, where they saw 3 white towels soaking in blood. No apologies for the amount of time they took. Then when we left, I called down to get my car at 12:10pm. We were told 20 minutes. We went down at 12:35, no car. We spoke up when 12:50 came around and still no car! The car didn't come for an hour and 10 minutes from when I called! We missed out 1:30 appointment downtown. Do not stay here, go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TheBlueRhaj
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed at The Alex at least 10 times (on business, we have a rate); The Good: - Teriffic location.A couple of blocks to Grand Central Station, easy 15 minute walk to Times Square/Broadway Theatre District, same for 5th Avenue, NYC Public Library, The UN, etc. The close proximity of th UN gives the neighborhood a very international feel, many countries UN Missions (embassys) are located in the area. Muarry Hill area and 2nd Avenue have some great restaurants and bars. O'Neil's, just around the corner on 3rd Ave. is a great typical NYC Irish bar, the big screen comes down for sports events, food is good and reasonably priced, the crowd is local, friendly, and very outgoing, the barmen are all Irish. - As stated in earlier reviews, The Alex truly does have some of the best Doormen in NYC. Very friendly, very helpful, funny, and willing to go out of their way to help you. I've stayed at many of the top hotels in NYC, these guys really are the best. I don't know why, but tthey are. - Liberal upgrade policy. It is not unusal to get upgraded to a one or two bedroom suite (more about those below). - Beds are quite comfortable, clean high quality linens. The rooms are clean, good amenities in the bathrooms. In the suites, the kitchens are fantastic, high quality full size refridgerators and oven/stoves, microwave, dishes etc. The Bad; - The reception always leaves something to be desired. There are only two stations, and if it is at all busy the waits can be tiresome. As stated in earlier reviews, unlike the Doormen, the reception staff can have a bit of an attitude, and often leave you feeling like you have been processed rather than welcomed. - The hotel bar. This is obviously a very subjective area. I find it to be cold, sterile, and uncomfortable. - The rooms are generally spacious, and well appointed, butr the choice of furniture is not very comfortable. The suites have plasma screens in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom, but the only really comfortable place to watch is from bed. The rooms have DVD and CD players as well, and all good quality. They did not scrimp as on amenities, everything is excellent quality, it is more a question of design and choice. The Awful: - There is no service elevator, so in the mornings you are competing with guests, housekeeping, and room service for the 3 elevators. Often houskeeping will lock one of them off, making waits even longer. I once had to wait ten minutes for an elevator (only once, but still...) - The room temprature. Previous reviewers are correct. This is a major issue. - Room service is overpriced even for room service, and not very good. - Internet access can be an issue (this may have been corrected). All in all, not a bad place to stay, you take the good with the bad. For myself, I prefer to stay at The W Court, a few blocks down at 37th and Lexington. More expensive, but more my kind of place. Hope this helps! Enjoy the City That Never Sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Baskaat
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, but starting to show signs of wear and tear. Staff was nice and friendly , but we had to ask them twice for any requests. It was definitely not a 4 star experience, more like 3 and half. Bed was very comfortable, and the traffic noise was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Alex for 3 nights, April 7-10. We booked a one bedroom suite and it was fantastic. We arrived a little early and were allowed to go ahead and check in without any issues. Klawson loaded up our luggage and took us up to our suite. He showed us all the ins and outs of the suite and how to use everything. He was extremely nice and helpful and provided us with great service from the first moment we arrived. The suite was extremely spacious, especially for NYC. The bed linens were absolutely fantastic. The hotel provided a nightly turn down service that was a nice touch as well. The bath products were Frederic Fekkai and were also very nice. The kitchen was great although we didnt use much of it. It was fully equipped with silverware and cuisinart cookware. Again, Klawson was great, he gave us a few recommendations on eating and various other things. He turned us on to an Omish Market just down the street that was great for snacks, hand tossed made while you wait pizzas etc. He went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. He remembered our name every time he saw us and spoke each time. There were several others who were very good as well, Chris and Alberto (I think). All these guys worked very hard and you could tell that just by watching and speaking to them. I must say, our last night there, Klawson knocks at the door and was bringing us a vase with some fresh flowers in it. Nothing we asked for, just following up on the great service. Our suite had a great view of the East River and Queens on one side and we could see the Chrysler Building out the other side. I can't say enough about how nice we were treated and what a nice experience we had during our stay there. As to the other reviews complaining about various things: I think in alot of cases some are just looking for something to complain about. The toilet is not difficult to flush, you do have to push a button to flush and it is not loose, but it is not bad at all. Now, I can only comment on the room temp. during our stay, and it was fine. There were 2 thermostats, one in the bedroom and one in the living area. We like to have it as cold as it will get, and while it wasn't as cold as many we have stayed in, it was in the mid 60's our entire stay....more than comfortable enough. You do have to re-pull the shower switch once or twice during your shower, but big deal! I suppose it is their way to try and save water. Certainly nothing to complain about. The hotel stored our luggage as our flight out was not until that afternoon...no charge for that. Without question, we would stay there again, and no doubt will.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the photos, only a bit smaller”
Reviews.Author: clempit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alex hotel from a Friday night to a Sunday night, 24 - 27th March 2006. Don’t panic if you have already booked, it gets four stars because of some minor points, I couldn’t give it five stars, though I would have liked to. We chose this hotel from TripAdvisor reviews as the best 4 star hotel we could afford, and got a reasonable deal on expedia. (Last time I stayed in the Milton Plaza near Times Sq and I vowed never again, it was horrible and far too busy.) Location is great, a good trade-off between city buzz versus noise. If you are fit you can walk everywhere, closest subway is nearby at Grand Central, with another line at 51st St and Lexington. 45th was a one-way street, with parked cars both sides and only one lane free for traffic, so quieter than the avenues. It was a weekend though, traffic noise was slightly worse on the Monday. We took earplugs just in case, but didn’t use them, I was so tired I was out like a light anyway though my partner wasn’t so lucky. Reception was always courteous and welcoming, there always seemed to be plenty of suited guys nearby the desk to assist and we never had a problem waiting for the lifts. The doormen always ran over to push-start the revolving door and asked if they could get us a cab. Unfortunately we got a room which faced over the back, so no Chrysler building view for us. In fact you could see a partial view from the hallway windows (yes, daylight and a view in the hotel corridor!!) I did go back down to ask if we could change, firstly to a view of the Chrysler building and if that wasn’t possible, then to a room higher up on the front, but although the receptionist was friendly and receptive about my request, she did say we were on the highest floor for our room type (10th floor, normal room not suite) and my partner thought she was hoping we would pay for an upgrade to a suite. The room was smaller than we anticipated, on the floor plan we seemed to have the narrowest room on the floor, (room 1002) but as a bonus we were at the end of the corridor, so only one set of neighbours. The photos on the website are accurate, although as I said, we had a much narrower room (only about 18 inches clearance at the end of the bed when cupboards were open) Also our room was longer than everyone else’s inside as the bathroom wall jutted back out into the hallway instead of taking floor space out of the main room. Having said that, the bathroom was quite small (but perfectly adequate) I had to take my photo standing inside the bath! The bath is not real limestone, it is a normal bath with a nice limestone tile surround, ditto the sink. Also if you wanted to watch TV from the bath, you would have to look sideways and halfway up the wall, it isn’t right at the end of the bath like I imagined!! It is a lovely touch though, quite easy to see from the shower, and we enjoyed having it there. The bed linen was crisp and white and the room was spotlessly clean when we arrived. Our bed was kingsize and lovely and comfortable. The carpet looked brand new and was still slightly ‘spongy’ underfoot from the underlay, lovely and soft on barefeet. The cupboards, TV, curtains and sofa-couch thing were exactly as pictured on the websites. Didn't eat from the minibar or snack tray so can't comment. We had plenty of fresh towels, with robes and slippers, however my robe was supplied clean but badly frayed, and I should probably have asked for a new one! The toiletries were classier looking than I’ve seen in other hotels, but who is Frederic Fekkai anyway? Didn’t use the shampoo and conditioner but face soap, body wash and lotion were fine. So, why only four stars? Well, along with the tatty robe, there was a coat hook (at least I think it was that) just hanging off the wall, and one of the light fixtures at the bed had two screws missing so that it kind of hung down. Our room windows were absolutely filthy (not that we had anything to look at) and one of the stick-on pictures on the wardrobe was peeling off. All of which would be easy to fix, but spoiled the room slightly. Also, a couple of things were annoying and the result of bad planning: the light switch couldn’t be reached easily from the bed, and the alarm clock was smart but useless, it had a black display on black. It had a button to illuminate the display, but how do you find it in the dark in an unfamiliar hotel room? The temperature control for the heat/a.c. was in a two inch gap down the side of the wardrobe, impossible to reach, but luckily the temp was fine. Our bin was inside a cupboard and was not emptied on the third day, so we had old rubbish and juice staring at us when we were watching TV, another thing we perhaps should have phoned reception for (we were just too darn tired!!) The hotel looks great, with stone effect tiles on floor and walls, but has no sound-deadening furnishings or carpets in the hallways and we heard people come and go all night. I have no idea why people can’t move around quietly in a hotel, instead of leaving doors open and shouting to their friend down the hall. Although this is not the hotel’s fault, it is likely you will experience some hallway noise while you stay there, just from people coming and going. My partner had to stick his head out and complain to the room across the hall as they seemed to be having a party in the hallway. Also, the TV has a super woofer speaker thing, and it seems to boom out even when you turn the volume low. We had thought the soundproofing between rooms was fine, but then realised we must have had no neighbour the first night, and I don’t think their TV was even that loud!
