Also, when I asked the concierge Flo if she knew of a “Clinique bonus” (free skincare stuff, for all you gents) she insisted it was in Bloomingdales, even though I said I had already checked there and it wasn‘t. The reason for her certainty became apparent when she gave me a card with her name on it “to get an exclusive discount for Alex hotel guests“ but obviously also earned her something for referral. Her discount would have been nice, but I would have been annoyed if I had made a special trip. Later I found the bonus in Macy’s, perhaps Flo doesn‘t get a reward there. If they don’t pay attention to the little things in a few years this nice hotel might get shabby, but for now we felt it was still worth our money as any complaints were only minor and we didn‘t take them up at reception, our loss. If you got a better-maintained room, (or were better than us at complaining about it!), you will be very pleased with the Alex! Thanks to Trip Advisor reviewer who recommended “Comfort Diner” just across from the hotel, it was great and the waitress didn’t treat us any different when she realized we were tourists (unlike the Pershing Diner at Grand Central, the waitress couldn’t care less, didn’t bring things, forgot to come back, overcharged us(deliberately?) yet couldn’t have been nicer or more attentive to native diners at the next table). For a good breakfast try “Café Bully” one block down and one block west, $4-6, the cheapest we found nearby.

Reviews.Title: “HMMMMMMM.........”
Reviews.Author: ladytravelsagian
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival in my car the front doorman, "Chris", was exceptional. He was very helpful and made us feel welcome. He took care of the bags and car for us. Very Friendly! At Check-in the woman was very friendly, almost too so-like when you are on an airplane and someone talks to you to distract you from noticing the turburlance. But friendly still and always smiling. The lobby was a bit on the small side. The room was nice, clean, seemed on the small side for a 700 sq ft one bedroom suite. Kitchen was immaculate-very clean. The bathroom was the same. In fact the whole room was very clean. Orhcid on table was a nice touch. Towels were not Frette as advertised but Anichini - still nice. The amenities were great-Fredik Ferkai. The TV sets were awesome. On the down side - The room was very warm. we could not adjust the heat for anything. The next morining we asked to have it fixed - we were asked if we wanted a fan. I politely told the man-no- I wanted to be able to adjust the room temp. When we arrived back late afternoon. THe room windows were open and the curtians tied around the lamps. This is not 4 star service. The refridgerator with mini bar items never got cool. The woman working as the concierge was always too busy and always answering the phone when she was servicing other customers. I found that the only way to get her was to call from the room. Unfortunate, because she seemed good at her job. But it is rude to answer the phone when she has a guest in her presence. They should provide additional assistance. The maids in the hallways were always pleasant,smiled and greeted us and made eye contact. When I wanted to have the car brought around I was told that I would have to wait a half hour. Or if I preferred I could walk around the corner and get it. When I went around to get it, they would not release the car to me. They called the hotel and they were informed no. When I went back to the hotel, they said that the parking attendant said I wanted to check out. This was not true as I was standing there when the parking valet called the hotel. He never said I wanted to check out. "Heath" curtly told me I could now go and get it. This is not 4 star service, I asked him to have it brought around. The two men at the front desk were not friendly at all. They did not smile, except when laughing and joking with other staff members. Overall this left me with a bad impression. Parking is $47 per day-we were not there two full days but they charged us double. There is a great restaurant across the street,The Comfort Diner. EXCELLANT! There is also a great store across the street - the amish market. Both are great and alot less than room service. The Dean and Deluca basket in the room is not free as sort of indicated in the description. MAny staff were very friendly and courteous,but there were some that you felt were husltling for tips. Overall it is a nice hotel,more like a very good 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave The Alex”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research, we chose the Alex for our elopement to NYC. It was predominantly for the size and price of a one bedroom suite. The rooms are just gorgeous, like a little apartment. We couldn't have loved it more. The design is very modern and luxurious. The service was outstanding. The guys out the front are amazing. The front desk staff are just great. In a city where everything seems like a hassle, nothing was too much trouble for these guys. We ended up cancelling at 100% charge the next place we were due to stay as we couldn't bring ourselves to leave the Alex.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle61
Reviews.Content: For the price, we were totally disappointed. It's extremely stylish and extremely un-user-friendly. They missed the little things. In our suite, the furniture was arranged so you couldn't sit in front of the TV in the living room. No toaster in kitchen. The sink in the bathroom stood out so far that if you wear glasses, you couldn't see to put on your make up or shave. The place where they had set up a make up mirror in the bedroom didn't have any light near it. The couches were uncomfortable. There are many other options in the same neighborhood for the same kind of money that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Meets Luxury at The Alex”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I knew I was going to like The Alex as soon as I walked through the door. The cozy fireplace and aroma of orchids provided a perfect balance to the minimalistic lobby. The staff, from doorman to front desk to housekeeping was wonderful. Welcoming and helpful not to mention they all remembered my name whenever I passed. The penthouse has incredible views of the Chrysler building and East River. Despite staying out very late, I was still compelled to go onto the terrace to watch the sunrise. Much like the hotel itself, it was a beautiful and serene escape from the hustle that can embody NYC. Nothing was overlooked when planning the suite. Space is used efficiently and I easily found everything I needed for my stay. The location was very convenient for arriving in the city and was a quick trip to and from my downtown activities. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Alex Hotel is simply beautiful. It is a quaint and trendy hotel all in one. Not only are the rooms clean, well kept and in working order; the staff goes above and beyond the call of duty. The Alex Hotel provides the BEST service in the city by far!!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place does have some heating system problems. From what other reviewers have stated, the problem is apparently chronic. My fiancee and I stayed for 2 nights and had to mess with the thermostat frequently and needed to call the engineer to come check out the room. He was friendly and so I didn't mind the intrustion too much. Staff are professional. The room itself was nicely appointed and the bathroom amenities are terrific. Our room was a bit larger than the standard and had 2 flat screen TVs. Not necessary but for some reason it felt nice. There was no view from our room, which was at midlevel; regardless, this is not a part of town that is particularly attractive unless high up. All in all the stay was pleasant but not worth a large sum of money. I had a deal for fairly reasonable rate. I'd say that the hotel is probably more a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our Mississippi Gulf Coast Convention & Visitors conducts a sales mission to New York annually to contact the national media, receptive tour operators, meeting planners, and others. By pure luck through hotels.com, we found the Alex. Not only is it conveniently located, thoroughly modern, and intimate enough to be completely comfortable, but the service, friendliness, and personalization meets the standards I would normally expect from top hotels in Europe and Asia. The Alex is now our home, more so than any other hotel we've ever used anywhere...providing the prices stay competitive, as we are a government entity.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Alex on a business trip and knew at check in that I was in for problems. The desk staff person was not at all friendly. I requested as non-smoking room. When i arrived at the room,it smelled like someone had just finished a cigarette. I called down to the front desk and was told that I was in a non-smoking room, ON A SMOKING FLOOR. Obviously, that didn't work. So, they agreed to move me. The new room was larger and upon my arrival, 78 degrees. The bellman showed me how to work the A/C, but I woke up at 2 am and the temperature hadn't gone down. It was not a pleasant night of sleep...the air conditioner was not on in the facility at all. The next day, I flew to Boston for a meeting but had to drive back due to weather at the NYC airports. The following morning, which was the day I was checking out, I awoke with a horrible stomach flu. I was virtually unable to get out of bed. I called the front desk and asked if I could have an extra hour or 2 to check out since i was extremely ill and flying out at 4 pm. (check out was at noon-a car was picking me up at 2 pm to go to LGA) I asked for the manager and explained my situation, the fact that i was very sick, and if i could have another hour to sleep. He was indifferent, and said he could do nothing. I was in such pain that I couldn't get out of bed. Incredibly, he forced me to leave in my condition. I considered going to a hospital. I have never experienced such a lack of compassion from any person in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown Cool!”
Reviews.Author: UKChaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Alex for 5 nights over Christmas to celebrate our son's 21st birthday. What a cool place this is! Clear minimalist / hi tech feel to the whole place. The staff were helpful and attentive and the door staff exemplary, the rooms were perfect and the location ideal. The deal was a particularly favourable one and I've not seen it bettered since making the initial booking 10 months earlier. Room service was quick and housekeeping outstanding. The hotel doesn't really have a lobby for meeting up but hey! - The bar is only a few steps away! If I find rooms at the same price again (or cheaper)- I'd come back here! TIPS - Don't make any long distance phone calls - unless you have money to burn! - Visit Amish Fine Food Market 50m up the street AND the deli on the corner of 45th & 3rd! - Take breakfast at PK diner on 46th street - perfection for under $5!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mcd095
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay after disembarking the QM2 from a trans-Atlantic crossing. Chances are we were spoiled from the ship, but the Alex seemed to be a big comedown after the crossing. We couldn't get anyone to come near us to assist with our bags on arrival, the front desk staff were indifferent. The room was extremely small and cramped, with wall storage units that were great to look at, useless in terms of actually storing anything. Our view was of a skanky and noisy airshaft. The tony bathroom needed some simple repairs which I did myself (tightening towel racks on the shower doors). We won't be back, having had a much nicer and less costly stay at the W Tuscany about two years previously. A traveller from Calgary Canada

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had very poor stay at the Alex. Though it is pleasantly designed, it has some major problems. The Alex Hotel has radiant heat, which is a nice feature, but you can't control the level of the heat. My room was a too toasty 82 degrees for most of my stay. Two engineers visited but admitted that all they could do was have me open my window (which made the room very noisy) Beyond that, the high-speed internet access did not work and the front desk managed to lose a package that was sent to me (they eventually found it 5 hours after I had inquired about it). Given the price of the Alex and the number of hotels in NYC, I can't imagine going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with The Alex”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: I originally booked The Alex because they offered a 2 bedroom suite (not that common in New York) and as the weekend break was a 21st birthday present for my partner's son the accomodation was important. I checked on Tripadvisor and took notice of previous comments (I even took gaffer tape for the shower which appeared to be a problem) and I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised. We went on Thanksgiving weekend and as such expected the elevators to be very busy and slow (another earlier complaint on Tripadvisor) but found no problem at all. Both showers worked perfectly (following the instructions properly always helps!) and although there was no kettle in the room when we asked a coffee maker was delivered straight away. We had a minor problem with the heating and an engineer was sent up to deal with it within 10 minutes. The hotel was spotless and the beds lovely, every member of staff that we encountered was very courteous a couldn't do enough for you. The reception area is quite small and the restaurant an odd shape but the room was spacious with a wonderful view of The Chrysler Building. I can't recommend The Alex highly enough and will certainly stay there again on our next visit to The Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Not as accommodating as I would've liked.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJayhawk
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to check in I am informed that they are all out of the room type I had reserved. They tell me that they are going to "upgrade" me to a studio. I soon come to find out that this supposed upgrade is about 1/3 of the side of the normal room, with additional furniture. Then I come to learn that the internet in my room is not working. I inform the concierge and a technician is sent to my room but is unable to resolve the problem. I'm stuck working in the business center all night long, which is a gutted normal room with 3 computers on a very noisy hall and courtyard. Only 1 of the three printers is functioning properly, so myself along with the other 2 businessmen are trading computers constantly. The following morning I wake up to shower...and the showerhead is not working. When I leave in the morning, I ask the front desk to see to it that the internet and shower issues are resolved while I am away. We agree that if they're not able to be corrected, another room should be flagged for my stay. I come home that evening and the Internet technician hasn't even been to the room, however the showerhead is working tempermentally (with a massive dirty bootprint in the tub). I call down and speak with the manager about the situation. Again, they're out of rooms despite the assurance I would be moved should things not be working properly. More than an hour later they once again attempted to correct the internet issue with a different technician and then it worked for a few hours before dying out again. Room service was quick but the food was so-so. For this place to truly live up to its name and reputation, it needs to get its ammenities in order and live up to its promises.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, Over Rated, Poorly designed and a little scary and inept”
Reviews.Author: DrRoy52
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the (pricey) and well reviewed Alex Hotel. It is located between 2nd and 3rd avenue, convenient to Grand Central and possessing a fine restaurant Ringo -the Japanese word for apple and not the 4th beatle. From check in to check out it was a strange experience and I am a seasoned traveler. First, you are "greeted" or better yet confronted by half a dozen macho guys with matching near shaved heads and blue blazers who intercept you at the entrance. At every moment you are expecting a south beach shoot-out or east side west side hit. They require more ID's than young men from Saudi Arabia who arrive at JFK without luggage and a one way ticket. In fact, few elevator rides to the room are unaccompanied by either a guard or a cleaning woman. The rooms are pricey, pushing four digits for a faux suite. The design, while aesthetically appealing is poorly executed and the materials cheap. The light bulb, identified by the bell person as defective, was never fixed and the "rainforest shower" exuded a steady stream of ---water---nothing special. An attempt to get the concierge to pick up the phone - 3 times -was met with - he has stepped away and my one reservation at dinner attempt was rewarded with a "I tried to make an appointment for dinner at 8 but they dont take them but here is their number". The positives - the fitness center was adequate with lots of flat screen tv's - an alex signature - and Ringo was nicely designed with excellent food. There are no perks like coffee, no lobby, and not enough attitude even to command these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimlibin
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old daughter and I spent a lovely week at the Alex in October. Although this was "high" season and the hotel was fully booked, we never had anything less than instant service. The room was spotless with twice daily maid service, beautifully decorated, spacious and comfortable with the best beds and sheets I have ever slept on! In spite of the heavy doors, I could hear my floor mates coming and going (at all hours!) but nothing once they were inside their rooms. We ate at the restaurant a few times and had great food, however, a market across the street sells complete meals and snacks. As far as I could tell, there were no other children staying at the hotel at the same time as we were. Some hotels make a fuss over children to make them feel special - this one did not. The concierge was not particularily helpfull although I suspect they were quite busy. The lobby lacks a spot to rest/socialize before heading back up to your room. The Alex is a great hotel for an extended stay but lacks social space.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: sueellenmishke
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a one bedroom suite at this hotel. It is a great deal in comparison to other suites in NYC. You get a lot of square footage for your $. THE PROS: * The suite is large, more like a small modern apartment * Full kitchen (stove, dishwasher, refrigerator, freezer, stocked with dishes and utensils) * 3 flat screens (in the bathroom, living room and bedroom) * Stereo & DVD in bedroom and living room * Large bedroom with a very comfy bed THE CONS: * I also had to fight w/ the shower to get it to work--pushing the button in about 20x because it kept reverting to the bath spout. There must have been some pressure issues because I heard loud popping sounds coming from the shower all night * Newspaper not delivered to room as promised (had to ask them to bring it up) * No counter space in bathroom - awkward shower entrance * No coffee maker * Modern couches in LV not comfortable * Maid service started knocking on my door at 9am the day of my check out (despite the do not disturb sign) - kept coming back despite my request for a later check out that was approved (disconnect btwn staff) * Upon checking out extra taxes were added to my bill. I had booked on line via their website which states the price is inclusive of all state and city taxes. I even confirmed the total upon my check in. HOWEVER, when I received the bill under my door - it was more. I spoke with the manager asking him if he could honor the total I had booked on line through their website and he said NO. I told him I thought it was misleading to charge extra fees and then he proceeded to tell me that I should take them to small claims court if I wanted to resolve it. HE WAS VERY RUDE - VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM THE HOTEL MANAGER. I will not return to this hotel. There are many other hotels in the city that offer excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alex! Great Staff, Great Rooms, Great Price too!”
Reviews.Author: Bob90024
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Alex for a weekend, and I have to say I was pleasntly surprised by how enjoyable my stay was. The building is really nice, the lobby is small but well decorated. My check-in experience was fine. They did not give me the room I wanted and instead gave me one with two beds, but that wasn't such a big deal. The entire staff during my stay was extremely friendly and helpful, a big difference from many hotels in NYC. They didn't have an attitude, and were very willing to help or just be social. The room was very nice, quite large for NYC standards and very fresh. The beds were comfortable, 4 pillows on each. There was a large LCD TV and entertainment center in the bedroom and an additional small LCD in the bathroom. There was two closets, a dressing area, minibar, and several nighstands. The only problem was that there really isn't a desk. There is a large piece of furniute which has three sections, one being a closet, the second being the TV cabinet, and the third is a desk, however it is so incredibly tiny that it's less deep than an airplane tray table. Other than that, the room's great. Also, the hotel is very quiet, I was on a really low floor and didn't hear any outside noise. I didn't eat in the restaurant, it looked like it would be pretty nice, although I was there Friday and Saturday night and I never saw it busy when passing by. Another great ammenity is the business center. They took a guest room and converted it to the center, however I still loved it. It has hardwood floors and three large contemporary desks. Each desk has a Dell computer and HP laser printer. There is no charge for using the center (or the high-speed internet in the rooms) which is really really nice. It's all self-service, so you don't have to sign in, pay anything, you just sit down, use the computer, and print stuff if you like. There was a sign indicating that copy and fax services were available at the front desk. There is a fitness center in the hotel, however I did not use or see it. Overall, I was really impressed with the Alex, I would defiantely go back, especially if they're offering competitive rates (which they definately were when I was there).

Reviews.Title: “All We Could Ask For at The Alex”
Reviews.Author: It_happened
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a great 3 nights in NY this past weekend, if you are looking for a trendy high end 4* botique hotel in Midtown we can strongly recommend The Alex, rooms are spotless, turn down service at night, beautiful toiletries, friendly staff, there is a tv in the bedroom and another in the bathroom and the Comfort Diner is across the street. We got a good deal on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: LUBO
Reviews.Content: We give it a 3.5. What we liked about the hotel took care of the cons--though none of the free upgrades that everyone had told us about were offered and it was our honeymoon. Still, this king bed was the most comfortable we've ever slept in. The rooms are a little small but cozy and nicely outfitted. Bathroom counters lack space for make-up and toiletries but the shampoo and other items provided were outstanding. Satelite pay per view was out all week but the flat screen televisions in the room and bathroom were very nice. The location was great--very convenient to many restaurants and Grand Central and mostly quite for NYC. It was just our dumb luck but the restaurant began remodeling the day we arrived and wrapped up the day we left--we were very disappointed and would have not chosen the hotel for our trip if we had been informed. Luckily the doorman had a couple of cocktail and snack alternatives closeby that made it all better. The Pinnacle deli is very good--have a homemade bagel for breakfast that's as good as any in the City. Our favorite Alex Staffer-- The Concierge Flo--Outstanding knowledge and service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Alex for more than two months, and I have to say I'm not quite satisfied. The good: rooms are clean and nice, refrigerator is large and with plenty of space to put your own stuff, the tv in the bathroom is great, the bed is comfortable. The bad: housekeeping, never forget to hang the DND sign, I forgot once and they started banging at my door on a Saturday at 8am, yelling "housekeeping good morning!!" The next day I remembered to put the sign, but anyway they woke me up yelling to the poor guy in the next room. The room TV is bad, the on demand service to buy movies results in a low quality image. In one of the rooms I stayed after a quick trip to my country, the TV had its original remote (not the on demand remote), I couldnt buy movies but the image quality was great. Finally, what is wrong with the elevators?? please, sometimes you have to wait up to 10 minutes to get an elevator! they are used by the staff, that makes them very uncomfortable. I'd suggest seeing other hotels before spending $300 or more at the Alex.

Reviews.Title: “Miss the old staff”
Reviews.Author: MSLI155019
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Alex hotel this year and what a turn for the worst. The staff is all new and have no idea what services is all about. Matthew Slpoy the old Front Desk Manager was the most polite manager I have ever seen at a hotel. When I asked where he went the Front Desk told me that he was no longer with the company. How do you let someone like him go. The first time I stayed at the hotel i had major problems with my room (heat,shower,t.v,telephone) and Matthew personaly came to deal with the situation. He offered me to change rooms which I did not want to do so Matthew stayed with me in the room untill each problem had been fixed by engeneirring. This is truly what service is all about. I have since found out where Mr. Slpoy works and made a point of going to see him and thank him for all he has done. He mentioned to me that he was fired from the Alex. Any hotel that can not realize what good staff do for them does not deserve the good staff. It is real sad because the Alex is a very nice hotel with very nice rooms. BRING BACK THE OLD STAFF and you will suceed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in @ 4:00pm, and had to come back and check in again because room was not ready. Elevators are used by everyone including staff which slows the system. Ringo Restaurant is very good (love the food) but a bit expensive. Room alarm clock needs to be replaced, although front desk can give you a wake up call. TV in the bathroom was clearer than bedroom TV. Had to change rooms due to internet not working, manager did upgrade but internet still does not work. Doorman sets me up to go to the airport via blackcar and driver overcharge me and states he is intimidated by doorman size. Should have taken a cab which were available. Will advise company to deal with another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's not exactly paradise”
Reviews.Author: lucksfalling
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Alex Hotel, on 45th and 3rd, for the better part of the past five months (since March 2005). I travel to New York on business and the company I work for has a corporate rate there. I have become quite familiar with the Alex, given the fact that I check-in and check-out every week. So, here's what I think of this "great" and "terrible" (previous reviewer's comments) hotel: - the good: it's a clean hotel, I believe it's only a year or so old, and the rooms feel pretty new - the bad: apparently, they're still working on their service - one reviewer said that the staff was "indifferent" - I'd say the majority of them are snobby and some of them down-right rude - their attitude seems to be, "we're a high-class boutique hotel and you're just a lowly traveler - you should be thanking us for letting you stay here" (yes, that's probably exaggerated, but as most of you will find, not terribly so) - the good: rainfall shower (note: i do not call this a "good" feature of the hotel, but apparently, everyone else enjoys a rainfall shower) - the bad: interesting shower to operate. first, you have to hold out the little knob below the big on/off knob. then you have to turn the water on while continuing to hold the little knob. all good and fine - i usually turn it on from the outside, adjust the temperature and then step in (sometimes difficult as the bathrooms can be quite cramped and you can get your arm wet). the PROBLEM being the shower is set on some sort of timer (if you read the hotel's note, it has an automatic shut-off to help conserve water). to alleviate the shock of the water suddenly shutting off, stick one of the soap bars between the wall and the edge of the knob - this keeps the steady pressure so that it won't pop back in - the good: they have a flat-screen TV in the bathroom, a flat-screen TV in front of your bed (for a deluxe room, two if you have a corner deluxe room - rooms ending in -07 below the 10th floor, two if you have a one-bedroom), a DVD player and a stereo system - the bad: these great gadgets don't necessarily work. the big flat-screen in front of your bed is of fuzzy-quality and sometimes the sound won't come on - same for the stereo. if you are deeply concerned about your quality-tv time, make sure to turn everything on and off and flip a few channels to ensure that they are operating correctly and call the front desk immediatly to remedy if they are not working properly - this may turn into consistent pestering as they may not be interested at that particular moment to care for your needs - the good: your own thermostat - the bad: also may not operate correctly, follow the above procedures for the tv and stereo - the good: their 24-hour fitness center and business center, you just need to swipe your card-key. the fitness center has the regular fan-fare - treadmill, elliptical, recline bike-machines, weights and some weight machines, as well as the big exercise balls - the bad: if you are having a really bad day and end up with a room on the third floor - these rooms are very noisy as you can hear all the traffic passing on 45th as well as the other guests utilizing the business center and the fitness center Conclusion: the hotel still has that new and clean feeling, but it's starting to show signs of use/age because some of the walls and ceilings have stains or peelage. for a weekend, all the bads from above may be tolerable, but i personally feel the regular prices are intolerable, unless you are able to book through one of the discount websites.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Car0lynP
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our four day stay at the Alex. The studio suite we had was very nice with little extras like robes, slippers, comfy bed linens and nice quality TV. We did not have much use for the kitchen area (except the fridge), but it was nice to have nonetheless. Kudos to the concierge for figuring out the restaurant we wanted from just a description of the food and general location because we forgot the name/address. And, double kudos to the IT guy who figured out how to get the internet working on my husband's lap top. Sorry I can't remember your names but if you were working on May 27th (IT guy) and 29th (concierge), you know who you are. Staff was all very friendly. Door men always greeted us with a smile and got us cabs very quickly. The gals who cleaned our room (we were on the 30th floor), were very friendly and did a great job. We'd come back to the room in the afternoon and it would be clean. We'd come back late at night and the bed was turned down and slippers and robes ready to go. Avoid the mini bar and room service unless you enjoy outrageous prices. (industry standard, but I just can't stand it getting ripped off with the so-called "convenience fee") There are some markets in the area, so grab some soda, water, etc and stick it in the fridge if you have one in the room you choose. We were concerned about a few of the reviews about problems with hot water. The water was hot in the morning and evening at the times we used it, so I guess they worked that problem out. One issue that was a bit annoying was the elevator. I am sure the staff/management is aware of the problem. Lets just say we consistently ended up waiting a long time for an elevator with bell hops, etc. running back and forth in front of us. Somewhat chaotic at times. For this reason, I cannot give the hotel an excellent rating. I have experienced this at other NYC hotels, but it is an inconvenience just the same. Oh yeah, check out the deli around the corner called Pinnacle, they have great lox & bagels and the guys behind the counter were friendly. Not a common thing in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: amontgomery
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Alex -- everyone we dealt with at the hotel, from the doormen to the room service waiters, were genuinely nice and very service oriented (not always the typical NYC hotel experience). Although the lobby's a bit small and the check-in desk can be crowded, the rooms are surprisingly large by NYC standards -- we had two full-sized beds and a chaise, and still didn't feel crowded. The decor is very well done -- natural colors (beiges, browns and cream tones), the beds super comfortable with pillowtop mattresses and down duvets. 2 flat-screen TVs, minibar, robes and slippers -- Frederik Fekkai toiletries. Drawer space was a little limited - lots of little drawers but few large. All in all, very relaxing! We had drinks in the restaurant bar off the lobby (Riingo) but didn't get a chance to eat there. Housekeeping was responsive and quick - we asked for extra shampoo and it was there in 10 minutes, delivered with a smile. Room service was very quick (30 minutes max) and nicely presented -- the menu's a little limited, but what they have is excellent. Prices were typical for room service -- although breakfast prices weren't as high as I've seen in similar quality hotels. Great location, close to Grand Central and a few blocks away from the Lexington Ave subway line. If you're looking to grab cheap snacks or drinks, there's a deli next door on the corner of 45th & 3rd, and a gourmet grocery store across the street with prepared foods as well. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not exactly what I had imagined”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint: I thought the room would be bigger! We paid just under $300.00 per night (deluxe room), and my partner and I were tripping over each other. The pictures online were fabulous, but I didn't feel like it was really worth it in the end. We couldn't check in early, in fact they checked us in 20 minutes late. The room service was average. Don't order a well burger, it will be charred, and be aware that gratuity is included on the check. The shower was wonderful once we figured out how to use it, and the robes were comfy. The bathroom was tiny. The flat screen televisions were nice and the bed was comfortable. The room was very clean and the staff was polite. It was far from terrible, but I'd rather try another hotel. It didn't seem worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Just Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: UserLondon_England
Reviews.Content: Each to their own. Judging by the reviews The Alex was either one of the best or indeed the worst hotels in Manhattan. Fortunately it exceeded our low expectations. We got a discounted rate and a free night's stay at The Alex through Expedia. My advice would be no discount - no stay. I'd also advise to always chose a room with a "09" ending. These rooms are way above the rest. They are larger, with better views and a superior room layout. Our room was very large, with a kitchenette & plasma screen TV's dotted around. The however was mixed but food was good if a little over priced

Reviews.Title: “dont bother !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rubbish !!!! This hotel pretends to be a top class hotel , nice decor, etc but consider that this hotel will not allow you to check in until 4pm !!!! which if you have landed at 9am in the morning is totally unacceptable. Room service ? ring the conceirge for ice for your drinks, call them several times and 2 hours later they finally arrive.!!!!! and this is supposed to be a top hotel. The ventilation ducts in the bathroom allow you to listen to the wonderous sounds of your neighbouring guests performing their morning ablutions. and or their arguments in full technicolour. Cleaning ladies screaming at each other each morning outside your door , grumpy staff , bar staff that don't know how to make a cocktail. Fawlty towers eat your heart out !! although they can make a waldorf salad. This hotel is one that looks very nice in photographs but totally lacks the basic's of good service, and certainly does not justify its price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Appalingly thin walls, so not only were we forced to listen to the very noisy mating sounds from next door all night (we were woken up) but, when we asked the desk staff to ask them to pipe down, they didn't bother, (as we discovered the next day on speaking to the hotel manager having not understood why they didn't quieten down). All the desk-staff could be bothered to say was, "yes, the walls are paper-thin aren't they?" Hopeless. We were very tired and very angry the next day; you don't expect a crappy hotel with fancy wallpaper at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were told our room was not ready, even though we had specifically requested an early check in. The lady at the front desk was very unpleasant and rude and didn't want anything to do with us. Everyone else was very pleasant. After check in, I decided to take a shower but had to call the front desk since after about ten minutes I couldn't figure out how to work the shower. TV was a nice touch. Considering that it was a new hotel I was surprised to see cracks in the tile, paint on the floor, and faucet knob in the shower falling off. Safe wasn't working, we had to call service and he was very prompt and efficient in fixing it. Our suite included a martini package which wasn't there we we arrived so we had to call front desk and it was delivered that night. Studio suite was on the smaller side then expected. Linens were very clean and comfortable; however bed was very short - I am 5"6 and my feet were hanging off. Also our room was just outside the elevator and we could hear every conversation going on outside. Be aware of the hidden charges on the room service menu - my husband's $7 cookies and milk truned out to be an outrageous $14 after room service charge, tax and tip. The view of Chrysler building was neat, way better if you are on the upper floors. Overall, not worth the $$, next time I want to stay in a bigger hotel - Marriott Marquise at time square looked very impresive and they have the best breakfast buffet.
